original: @74a # // rgya gar skad du //
analyzed: @74a # // rgya gar skad du //
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya m'u la sarba asti bde shra ma ni ra k'a ri tti pra bh'a ba ti //
analyzed: a'arya m'u la sarba asti bde shra ma ni ra k'a ri tti pra bh'a ba ti //
translated: Ārya-mūla-sarva-asti-śramaṇa-śrāmaṇera-kārikā-tīka-prabhāvatī.

original: bod skad du /🔽'phags pa gzhi thams cad yod par smra ba'i dge tshul gyi tshig le'ur byas pa'i 'grel pa 'od ldan /
analyzed: bod skad du / 'phags pa gzhi thams cad yod par smra ba'i dge tshul gyi tshig le'ur byas pa'i 'grel pa 'od ldan /
translated: In Tibetan:🔽'phags pa gzhi thams cad yod par smra ba'i dge tshul gyi tshig le'ur byas pa'i 'grel pa 'od ldan.

original: bam po dang po //
analyzed: bam po dang po //
translated: fascicle one

original: thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Omniscient One.

original: thams cad yod smra gang dag rgyal 'gyur ba //
analyzed: thams cad yod smra gang dag rgyal 'gyur ba //
translated: Those who are victorious over the Sarvāstivādins,

original: ston pa'i bslab pa 'dzin byed sa 'dzin dbang //
analyzed: ston pa'i bslab pa 'dzin byed sa 'dzin dbang //
translated: The holders of the Teacher's training, the lords of the earth,

original: gzhan zhig skyes 'gyur me tog mnga' can dpung //
analyzed: gzhan zhig skyes 'gyur me tog mnga' can dpung //
translated: Another will be born, the one with the flower-banner,

original: rab tu rgyu bde dag bcom zhing rgyal //
analyzed: rab tu rgyu bde dag bcom zhing rgyal //
translated: Having conquered and been victorious over the wandering ones.

original: 'phags pa yon tan 'od dang nyer sbas dang // zla stsogs rnam bshad mdzad la dad pa yis //
analyzed: 'phags pa yon tan 'od dang nyer sbas dang // zla stsogs rnam bshad mdzad la dad pa yis //
translated: The noble one, Guṇaprabha, Upagupta, Candra, and so forth, with faith in the expounders,

original: phyag 'tshal dge tshul tshig le'ur byas pa'i don //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal dge tshul tshig le'ur byas pa'i don //
translated: Having paid homage, the meaning of the verses of the novice monk,

original: tshig don ldan pa spel bas ji bzhin bshad //
analyzed: tshig don ldan pa spel bas ji bzhin bshad //
translated: Having increased the meaningful words, is explained just as it is.

original: rnam bshad mtha' dag rnam mang nges brtags nas //
analyzed: rnam bshad mtha' dag rnam mang nges brtags nas //
translated: Having examined all the explanations in many ways,

original: 'dul ba rgya mtsho'i @74b pha rol phyin med tshul //
analyzed: 'dul ba rgya mtsho'i @74b pha rol phyin med tshul //
translated: I have not crossed the ocean of the Vinaya.

original: chu srin na kra'i 'jigs can de las bdag / grogs kyis ngo dgar 'dod pa'i dad pa skyes //🔽bla ma'i man ngag yang dag rnam bshad pa //
analyzed: chu srin na kra'i 'jigs can de las bdag / grogs kyis ngo dgar 'dod pa'i dad pa skyes // bla ma'i man ngag yang dag rnam bshad pa //
translated: I have been frightened by the fearsome Makara.🔽I have heard the explanations of the gurus,

original: de dang de dag thos te 'on kyang ni //🔽zab mo rnam par gtan la dbab pa la //
analyzed: de dang de dag thos te 'on kyang ni // zab mo rnam par gtan la dbab pa la //
translated: But still🔽The minds of ordinary beings are confused

original: so so'i skye bo'i sems dag 'khrul bar 'gyur //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i sems dag 'khrul bar 'gyur //
translated: By the profound ascertainment of reality.

original: yon tan 'od bshad lam gyi rjes 'brangs nas //
analyzed: yon tan 'od bshad lam gyi rjes 'brangs nas //
translated: Following the path explained by Guṇaprabha,

original: mkhas pas bdag smad mi 'gyur de yi phyir //
analyzed: mkhas pas bdag smad mi 'gyur de yi phyir //
translated: The wise will not disparage me.🔽Therefore, all the gurus of the Saṃmitīyas,

original: thams cad yod smra'i bla ma rnams kyis bdag /'di la yang dag zhugs pas myur grub mdzod //
analyzed: thams cad yod smra'i bla ma rnams kyis bdag /'di la yang dag zhugs pas myur grub mdzod //
translated: Make me quickly attain perfection by being correct in this.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims sdug bsngal spong //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims sdug bsngal spong //
translated: The morality of renunciation abandons suffering.

original: 'jig tshogs lta ba gdon gyi rtsa ba 'joms //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs lta ba gdon gyi rtsa ba 'joms //
translated: It conquers the root of the demon of the view of the transitory collection.

original: dpal 'byor sa dang me tog mda' can 'joms //
analyzed: dpal 'byor sa dang me tog mda' can 'joms //
translated: It conquers the demon of the afflictions and the demon of the lord of death.

original: sangs rgyas la ni mgos gtugs bshad par bya //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la ni mgos gtugs bshad par bya //
translated: I bow my head to the Buddha and explain.

original: gzhi thams cad yod par sma ba'i dge tshul rnams kyi cho ga bsdu bar bzhed nas /
analyzed: gzhi thams cad yod par sma ba'i dge tshul rnams kyi cho ga bsdu bar bzhed nas /
translated: Having decided to compose a compendium of the rituals for the novices of the Sarvāstivāda school,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te //
translated: he bowed his head to the feet of the Blessed Buddha

original: nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims bshad par bya'o //
translated: and said, “I will explain the morality of renunciation.”

original: zhes bya bal sogs pa skabs 'byed pa yin no //🔽nges par 'byung ba ni nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya bal sogs pa skabs 'byed pa yin no // nges par 'byung ba ni nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: and so on, he makes a statement of his purpose.

original: khams gsum las nges par phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: khams gsum las nges par phyin pa yin no //
translated: Renunciation is the going forth from the three realms.

original: de'i rgyur gyur pa'i tshul khrims ni nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur pa'i tshul khrims ni nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality that is the cause of that is the morality of renunciation.

original: 'dis ni nges par legs pa'i rgyu nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni nges par legs pa'i rgyu nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is the cause of definite goodness.

original: nges par legs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nges par legs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Definite goodness is twofold:

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa tha dad pas so //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa tha dad pas so //
translated: with remainder and without remainder of the aggregates, respectively.

original: de la tshul khrims gang gis phung po lnga'i bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal spong bar byed pa ni sdug bsngal spong byed ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la tshul khrims gang gis phung po lnga'i bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal spong bar byed pa ni sdug bsngal spong byed ces bya ba ste /
translated: The morality that causes the abandonment of the suffering that is the nature of the five aggregates is called the “abandoner of suffering.”

original: 'dis ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that it is the cause of nirvana without remainder of the aggregates.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyid gdon yin te //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba nyid gdon yin te //
translated: The view of the transitory collection is the demon,

original: gso bar dka' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gso bar dka' ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is difficult to cure.

original: de'i rtsa ba ste //
analyzed: de'i rtsa ba ste //
translated: It is the root of that,🔽because it destroys the seed.

original: sa bon 'joms par byed pa yin pas 'jig tshogs lta ba'i gdon gyi rtsa ba 'joms byed de /
analyzed: sa bon 'joms par byed pa yin pas 'jig tshogs lta ba'i gdon gyi rtsa ba 'joms byed de /
translated: Thus, it is the destroyer of the root of the demon that is the view of the transitory collection.

original: 'dis ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu nyid yin par sngon te /
analyzed: 'dis ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu nyid yin par sngon te /
translated: This shows that it is the cause of nirvana with remainder of the aggregates.

original: dpal 'byor sa zhes bya ba ni rten yin te /
analyzed: dpal 'byor sa zhes bya ba ni rten yin te /
translated: The “ground” called “prosperity” is the basis,

original: mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu yin par yang bstan to //
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu yin par yang bstan to //
translated: because it is also taught to be the cause of high status.

original: me tog gi mda' can 'dod pa'i lha ste //
analyzed: me tog gi mda' can 'dod pa'i lha ste //
translated: The god of desire, who has a flower arrow,

original: de 'joms pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin pa'i phyir me tog mnga' can 'joms pa ste //
analyzed: de 'joms pa'i rgyur gyur pa yin pa'i phyir me tog mnga' can 'joms pa ste //
translated: Because it is the cause for destroying that, it is the destroyer of the flower-possessor.

original: lha'i bu'i bdud las rnam par rgyal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu'i bdud las rnam par rgyal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the cause for conquering the demon of the son of gods.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: @75a * // 'dis ni mngon par mthong ba yang bstan to //
analyzed: @75a * // 'dis ni mngon par mthong ba yang bstan to //
translated: By this, the transcendence of suffering is also taught.🔽Now,🔽He who abandons taking life, taking others' wealth,

original: da ni / gang zhig srog gcod gzhan gyi nor 'phrog dang // mi tshangs spyod brdzun bcos pa'i chang la sogs //
analyzed: da ni / gang zhig srog gcod gzhan gyi nor 'phrog dang // mi tshangs spyod brdzun bcos pa'i chang la sogs //
translated: unclean conduct, lying, concocted liquor,🔽dancing and so forth, garlands and so forth, high beds,

original: gar stsogs phreng sogs mal chen mtho ba dang / phyi dro'i kha zas dngul ni spong ba de //
analyzed: gar stsogs phreng sogs mal chen mtho ba dang / phyi dro'i kha zas dngul ni spong ba de //
translated: eating in the afternoon, and silver,

original: nyon mongs dgra g-yul rgyal byed tshul khrims de //
analyzed: nyon mongs dgra g-yul rgyal byed tshul khrims de //
translated: that morality is the victor in the battle with the enemy of afflictions.

original: dge tshul brtul zhugs chu lon brtsigs pa dang // 'chi ba'i mche ba 'byin par byed pa'i thabs //
analyzed: dge tshul brtul zhugs chu lon brtsigs pa dang // 'chi ba'i mche ba 'byin par byed pa'i thabs //
translated: It is the embankment of the novice's discipline, the means for extracting the fangs of death,

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub dpal nod dbang bskur yin //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub dpal nod dbang bskur yin //
translated: the consecration of receiving the glory of perfect enlightenment.

original: zhes bya bas nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin ston te //
analyzed: zhes bya bas nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims kyi rang bzhin ston te //
translated: This teaches the nature of the morality of renunciation.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa re re la yang spong bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa re re la yang spong bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Each of the ten courses of action should be applied to the abandoning of killing and so on.

original: spong ba ni spong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: spong ba ni spong bar byed pa'o //
translated: Abandoning is the act of abandoning.

original: bcos pa'i chang la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni sbyar ba'i chang bsdu'o //
analyzed: bcos pa'i chang la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni sbyar ba'i chang bsdu'o //
translated: The term “and so on” in “distilled alcohol and so on” includes fermented alcohol.

original: gar la sogs pa dang / phreng ba la sogs pa dang / mal mthon po dang // chen po dang / phyi dro'i kha zas zhes bya bar tshig dbye'o //
analyzed: gar la sogs pa dang / phreng ba la sogs pa dang / mal mthon po dang // chen po dang / phyi dro'i kha zas zhes bya bar tshig dbye'o //
translated: The phrase “dancing and so on” should be analyzed as “dancing and so on, garlands and so on, high and large beds, and eating in the evening.”

original: de la gar sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni glu dang rol mo'i sgra gnyis gzung ngo //
analyzed: de la gar sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni glu dang rol mo'i sgra gnyis gzung ngo //
translated: The term “and so on” in “dancing and so on” includes singing and music.

original: phreng ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni spos nyug pa dang kha dog 'chang ba gnyis bsdu'o //
analyzed: phreng ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni spos nyug pa dang kha dog 'chang ba gnyis bsdu'o //
translated: The term “and so on” in “garlands and so on” includes perfumes and cosmetics.

original: mal chen mtho ba zhes bya ba ni de chen po yang yin la /🔽mthon po yang yin pas so //
analyzed: mal chen mtho ba zhes bya ba ni de chen po yang yin la / mthon po yang yin pas so //
translated: “High and large beds” are large and high.

original: mal gyi sgra spyir bstan pas mal chen po dang mal mthon po ston to //
analyzed: mal gyi sgra spyir bstan pas mal chen po dang mal mthon po ston to //
translated: The term “bed” is taught in general, and so it teaches large beds and high beds.

original: chen po dang mthon po'i sgra'i yan lag gi sgo nas ni mal zhes spyir bstan pa'i khyad par du 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: chen po dang mthon po'i sgra'i yan lag gi sgo nas ni mal zhes spyir bstan pa'i khyad par du 'byed pa yin no //
translated: The terms “high” and “large” are used to distinguish the bed from the general category of beds.

original: de'i phyir mal mthon po dang // mal chen po zhes bya ba'i don du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mal mthon po dang // mal chen po zhes bya ba'i don du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the terms “high bed” and “large bed” are used.

original: mal gyi sgra ni mtshon pa'i don yin pa'i phyir stan yang bsdu'o //🔽phyi dro'i kha zas zhes bya ba ni phyi dro'i kha zas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mal gyi sgra ni mtshon pa'i don yin pa'i phyir stan yang bsdu'o // phyi dro'i kha zas zhes bya ba ni phyi dro'i kha zas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “bed” is used in the sense of an example, so the term also includes seats.🔽The term “food” means food that is eaten.

original: zas ni bza' ba ste ma ning gi rtags su bstan to //
analyzed: zas ni bza' ba ste ma ning gi rtags su bstan to //
translated: The term “after noon” means after noon.

original: dngul rnams spong ba zhes bya ni dngul dang gser la sogs pa len pa spong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngul rnams spong ba zhes bya ni dngul dang gser la sogs pa len pa spong ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “accepting silver” means accepting silver, gold, and so on.🔽Thus, the term “abandoning” should be applied to the ten actions such as killing.

original: de ltar na srog gcod pa la sogs pa bcu po spong ba gang yin pa'i spong ba ste tshul khrims yin no zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na srog gcod pa la sogs pa bcu po spong ba gang yin pa'i spong ba ste tshul khrims yin no zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: This is the morality of abandoning the ten actions.

original: de yang dge tshul gyi sdom bzhes bya ba yin no //🔽de lta bu'i spong ba ste /
analyzed: de yang dge tshul gyi sdom bzhes bya ba yin no //🔽de lta bu'i spong ba ste /
translated: This is the morality of the novice monk.🔽This is the morality of the monk.

original: tshul khrims de ni nyon mongs dgra'i g-yul las rgyal byed de /
analyzed: tshul khrims de ni nyon mongs dgra'i g-yul las rgyal byed de /
translated: That morality is the victor in the battle with the afflictions

original: nges par 'byin pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because it is the means of definite release.🔽The novice monk builds the embankment of the vow of training,

original: nye bar ston par byed pa yin pa'i don gyis chu lon brtsigs pa dang 'dra bas dge tshul gyis ni brtul zhugs kyi chu lon brtsigs pa yin no /
analyzed: nye bar ston par byed pa yin pa'i don gyis chu lon brtsigs pa dang 'dra bas dge tshul gyis ni brtul zhugs kyi chu lon brtsigs pa yin no /
translated: because it is like a built embankment in the sense that it shows.

original: @75b dge tshul gyi brtul zhugs ni 'dir rab tu byung ba la bya ste /
analyzed: @75b dge tshul gyi brtul zhugs ni 'dir rab tu byung ba la bya ste /
translated: The training of the novice monk is here called going forth,

original: chos 'di pa rnams kyi cha byad yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di pa rnams kyi cha byad yin no //
translated: because it is the appearance of one who belongs to this religion.

original: dge tshul gyi sdom pa ni spong ba yin te /
analyzed: dge tshul gyi sdom pa ni spong ba yin te /
translated: The novice monk’s vow is the abandonment of the ten nonvirtues.

original: khyad par ni de yin no //
analyzed: khyad par ni de yin no //
translated: This is the difference.

original: 'chi ba'i mche ba 'byin par byed pa'i thabs yin pa ni 'chi ba'i mche ba 'don pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i mche ba 'byin par byed pa'i thabs yin pa ni 'chi ba'i mche ba 'don pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The means of pulling out the fangs of death is the cause of pulling out the fangs of death,

original: tshul khrims la gnas pa dang / thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i rigs kyis 'chi ba nges par 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims la gnas pa dang / thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i rigs kyis 'chi ba nges par 'joms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one who is established in morality and who is endowed with the wisdom born of listening, reflection, and meditation, definitely conquers death.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub nyid dpal yin te /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub nyid dpal yin te /
translated: Perfect enlightenment is glory.

original: chos kyi rgyal po mdzad pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal po mdzad pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause for becoming a Dharma King.

original: de thob par bya ba'i phyir dbang bskur ba yin te /
analyzed: de thob par bya ba'i phyir dbang bskur ba yin te /
translated: One is consecrated for the sake of attaining that.

original: dbang sbyin par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbang sbyin par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “one is consecrated” is the same as “one is anointed.”

original: da ni nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims kyi so so'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba'i phyir re zhig spyir btang bas ni /
analyzed: da ni nges par 'byung ba'i tshul khrims kyi so so'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba'i phyir re zhig spyir btang bas ni /
translated: Now, in order to explain the individual characteristics of the morality of renunciation, first, in a general way, it is said:

original: 'du shes gtso la don gnyis ji bzhin na //
analyzed: 'du shes gtso la don gnyis ji bzhin na //
translated: 1. When the perception is primary, the meaning is just as it is;

original: ltung rdzogs don nyid ji bzhin min na chung //
analyzed: ltung rdzogs don nyid ji bzhin min na chung //
translated: when the meaning is primary, it is less than that;🔽when there is doubt, it is to be determined as if certain;

original: yid gnyis gyur na nges dang 'dra bar gzhag / blangs pa'i phyogs mthun rnams la yid kyir 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yid gnyis gyur na nges dang 'dra bar gzhag / blangs pa'i phyogs mthun rnams la yid kyir 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: when it is in conformity with what has been adopted, it is mental.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The bases of training are of two kinds:

original: 'du shes gtso bor bya ba dang // dngos po gtso bor bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'du shes gtso bor bya ba dang // dngos po gtso bor bya ba'o //
translated: those in which the perception is primary and those in which the thing is primary.

original: de la 'du shes gtso bor bya ba ni dper na sro gcod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la 'du shes gtso bor bya ba ni dper na sro gcod pa lta bu'o //
translated: Among them, in those in which the perception is primary, it is like, for example, cutting grass.

original: dngos po gtso bor bya ba ni dper na 'khrig pa las byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dngos po gtso bor bya ba ni dper na 'khrig pa las byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when the thing is primary, as in the case of sexual intercourse.

original: spyir btang ba 'di ni 'du shes gtso bor bya ba rnams kyi yin gyi //
analyzed: spyir btang ba 'di ni 'du shes gtso bor bya ba rnams kyi yin gyi //
translated: This general rule applies to those cases where perception is primary.

original: dngos po gtso bor bya ba rnams kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽don nyid ji bzhin na zhes bya ba ni don de ji lta ba bzhin du gal te 'du shes kyang de kho na nyid bzhin du gyur na /🔽de'i tshe ltung ba rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gtso bor bya ba rnams kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // don nyid ji bzhin na zhes bya ba ni don de ji lta ba bzhin du gal te 'du shes kyang de kho na nyid bzhin du gyur na / de'i tshe ltung ba rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: It does not apply to those cases where the thing is primary.🔽If the object is as it is perceived, then the downfall is complete.

original: dper na srog chags dang bcas pa'i tshul srog chags dang bcas par 'du shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na srog chags dang bcas pa'i tshul srog chags dang bcas par 'du shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, if one perceives a living being in what is living and has the perception that it is living, then the downfall is complete.

original: don nyid ji bzhin min na chung zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gnas la ma gus pa nyid ni sdom pa mtha' dag 'jig pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa nyid yin no //

analyzed: gnas med par 'dug par yang mi sbyong ba yin te /

translated: The ten aspects are mental actions because the ten trainings are stated in the ten trainings of the novice monk mantra, which states:🔽I will train in the ten trainings.🔽If one transgresses the ten trainings, one commits a downfall.

original: dge tshul gyi sngags las yan lag bcu pa 'dis bdag ces bslab pa'i tshad gsungs pa las bslab pa bcu po dag kho na las 'das na ltung ba yin par gsungs pa'i phyir dang / gzhan la ni ma gsungs pa'i phyir la gzhan la'ang skyon med pa nyid ni ma yin zhing /
analyzed: dge tshul gyi sngags las yan lag bcu pa 'dis bdag ces bslab pa'i tshad gsungs pa las bslab pa bcu po dag kho na las 'das na ltung ba yin par gsungs pa'i phyir dang / gzhan la ni ma gsungs pa'i phyir la gzhan la'ang skyon med pa nyid ni ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not stated for other vows, but that does not mean there is no fault in transgressing them.🔽It is also stated that one should not transgress the ten trainings that one has taken and that the ten trainings are similar to the ten nonvirtues.

original: blangs pa las 'das pa dang / @77b shan 'dra ba'i phyir dang / yid kyis bsdam par bya ba yang spyir bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas phyogs dang mthun pa rnams yid kyis bsdam par bya ba yin no zhes rnam par gzhag go //🔽gal te yang ci'i phyir cha ma tshang ba'i ltung ba yin par mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: blangs pa las 'das pa dang / @77b shan 'dra ba'i phyir dang / yid kyis bsdam par bya ba yang spyir bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas phyogs dang mthun pa rnams yid kyis bsdam par bya ba yin no zhes rnam par gzhag go // gal te yang ci'i phyir cha ma tshang ba'i ltung ba yin par mi 'dod ce na /
translated: The ten aspects are mental actions because they are taught in general as the nature of mental vows.

original: mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
translated: If one transgresses the ten trainings, one commits a downfall.🔽If one transgresses the ten trainings, one commits a downfall.

original: cha ma tshang ba'i yang dag par blangs pa las 'das pa'i yul kho na nyid yin no //
analyzed: cha ma tshang ba'i yang dag par blangs pa las 'das pa'i yul kho na nyid yin no //
translated: It is only in the case of a complete acceptance that there is a transgression.

original: de la cha ji snyed cig gis 'gyur bar bstan pa de rnams las cha gcig med pas kyang chung bar rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: de la cha ji snyed cig gis 'gyur bar bstan pa de rnams las cha gcig med pas kyang chung bar rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: If one is missing from among the parts that were taught as necessary, then it is considered incomplete.

original: des na gzhan la ni cha ma tshang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gzhan la ni cha ma tshang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not incomplete in other cases.

original: de'i phyir bslab pa'i gzhi las gzhan blangs pa dang 'dra ba rnams ni ma blangs kyis kyang 'das na yid kyis bsdam par bya bar rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi ltung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bslab pa'i gzhi las gzhan blangs pa dang 'dra ba rnams ni ma blangs kyis kyang 'das na yid kyis bsdam par bya bar rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi ltung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that if one transgresses a vow that is similar to a training precept but not actually a training precept, then one must restrain oneself with mindfulness, but it is not a downfall.

original: kha na ma tho ba lci ba dang yang ba nyid du 'gyur ba ni bsam pa'i dbang las 'gyur ba dang / yul gyi dbang las 'gyur bar rnam par gzhag gi / ltung ba'i dbang las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba lci ba dang yang ba nyid du 'gyur ba ni bsam pa'i dbang las 'gyur ba dang / yul gyi dbang las 'gyur bar rnam par gzhag gi / ltung ba'i dbang las ni ma yin te /
translated: Heavy and light offenses are established as being due to the power of attitude and due to the power of the object, but not due to the power of the downfall.

original: ltung ba la ni bcas pa tsam gyi rjes su 'brang bas so //
analyzed: ltung ba la ni bcas pa tsam gyi rjes su 'brang bas so //
translated: This is because downfalls are merely a matter of proscription.

original: de ltar spyir btang ba rnams bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar spyir btang ba rnams bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the general topics,🔽now, in order to explain the specific topics, the text and commentary explain the first verse.

original: mtshan nyid rnams bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnams bshad par bya ste /
translated: The characteristics of the four truths will now be explained.🔽🔽

original: gang zhig rang bzhin gnas la bslab bcas pas //
analyzed: gang zhig rang bzhin gnas la bslab bcas pas //
translated: The characteristics of downfalls will now be explained.🔽If a novice monk kills another human being,🔽thinking that person is a human being,

original: mi gzhan yin la mir ni 'du shes dang // gsad pa'i bsam pas 'khrul med gsod byed cing //
analyzed: mi gzhan yin la mir ni 'du shes dang // gsad pa'i bsam pas 'khrul med gsod byed cing //
translated: with the intention to kill and without error,

original: mi shi rmi lam ma gtogs de brlag 'gyur //🔽tshig gi don ni dge tshul gang zhig rang bzhin du gnas pa dang bslab pa ma btang bas /
analyzed: mi shi rmi lam ma gtogs de brlag 'gyur // tshig gi don ni dge tshul gang zhig rang bzhin du gnas pa dang bslab pa ma btang bas /
translated: he is defeated, except if it is in a dream.

original: mi pha rol la mi'i blo dang gsad pa'i bsam pas 'khrul pa med par gsod cing pha rol po de yang shi na de pham par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: mi pha rol la mi'i blo dang gsad pa'i bsam pas 'khrul pa med par gsod cing pha rol po de yang shi na de pham par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The meaning of the words is as follows. If a novice monk who is abiding in his original condition and has not relinquished his training kills another human being, thinking that person is a human being, with the intention to kill and without error, and that other person dies, he is defeated.

original: rmi lam ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This does not apply if it is a dream.

original: rang bzhin gnas zhes bya ba ni tha mal bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gnas zhes bya ba ni tha mal bar gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding in the original condition means abiding in the ordinary state.

original: 'dir gzhung ni smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bas gzir ba la ni ltung ba med do zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bas gzir ba la ni ltung ba med do zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The text states, “There is no downfall if one is insane, mentally disturbed, or overwhelmed by pain.”

original: bslab pa bcas pa zhes bya ba ni bslab pa ma btang ba yin no //
analyzed: bslab pa bcas pa zhes bya ba ni bslab pa ma btang ba yin no //
translated: “The training is relinquished” means that the training is not given up.

original: 'dir gzhung ni so sor thar pa las bslab pa ma phul bslab pa nyams par ma byas par zhes gsungs pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni so sor thar pa las bslab pa ma phul bslab pa nyams par ma byas par zhes gsungs pa'i dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here the text is from the perspective of the Vinaya statement, “The training is not relinquished, the training is not damaged.”

original: phul ba zhes bya ba yang phul ba gsal bar byed pa gang yang rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phul ba zhes bya ba yang phul ba gsal bar byed pa gang yang rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Relinquished” means that any of the causes of relinquishment are present.

original: 'di ltar gzhung ni tha na 'di skad du bdag la khyed lta bu'i tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis ci zhig bya zhes zer na'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhung ni tha na 'di skad du bdag la khyed lta bu'i tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis ci zhig bya zhes zer na'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The text says, “Even if you say, ‘What use are you to me, you who are like brahmins who are fellow practitioners?’”

original: yang @78a * //
analyzed: yang @78a * //
translated: Again, it is said:

original: bshad pa / rang bzhin gnas pa'i sdom dang ni //
analyzed: bshad pa / rang bzhin gnas pa'i sdom dang ni //
translated: The vows that remain in their natural state

original: btang ba'i blo yis btang pa yi //
analyzed: btang ba'i blo yis btang pa yi //
translated: are relinquished by the mind that gives them up.

original: go bar byed pa thams cad kyis //
analyzed: go bar byed pa thams cad kyis //
translated: If you understand all the causes of relinquishment,

original: brda phrad mi la go byed na'o //
analyzed: brda phrad mi la go byed na'o //
translated: you understand the signs of relinquishment.

original: slob dpon gzhan dag ni /
analyzed: slob dpon gzhan dag ni /
translated: Other masters say:

original: ngag gis sdom pa len pa yin pas /
analyzed: ngag gis sdom pa len pa yin pas /
translated: Since the vows are taken verbally,

original: gtong ba yang tshig kho nas rigs so zhes zer ba de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: gtong ba yang tshig kho nas rigs so zhes zer ba de ni mi rigs te /
translated: But that is not correct,

original: lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyis kyang sdom pa len pa'i phyir ro zer ro //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyis kyang sdom pa len pa'i phyir ro zer ro //
translated: because one also takes up the vow through the indicative form of the body.

original: bslab pa nyams par ma byas zhes smos pa ni gtong ba'i rgyu yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bslab pa nyams par ma byas zhes smos pa ni gtong ba'i rgyu yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “without violating the training” is stated to show the cause of relinquishment.

original: ji ste bslab pa ma phul ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge slong la gsungs pa yin na ci'i phyir dge tshul gyi yang zhar la bshad ce na /
analyzed: ji ste bslab pa ma phul ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge slong la gsungs pa yin na ci'i phyir dge tshul gyi yang zhar la bshad ce na /
translated: If the phrase “without relinquishing the training” and so on refers to a fully ordained monk, why is it also stated in the context of a novice?

original: dge slong gi skabs su bab pa'i phyir dge slong zhes gsungs pas 'di ni spyir gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gi skabs su bab pa'i phyir dge slong zhes gsungs pas 'di ni spyir gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The term “fully ordained monk” is stated in the context of a fully ordained monk, but this is a general statement.

original: 'di ltar bye brag tu bshad pa las /🔽dge slong gang zhes bya ba 'dir dge slong gi sgra ni gzhi gcig la bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bye brag tu bshad pa las / dge slong gang zhes bya ba 'dir dge slong gi sgra ni gzhi gcig la bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The treatise Differentiating the Meanings of Words states:🔽The term “fully ordained monk” in the phrase “a fully ordained monk” is used in the sense of a single basis.

original: gang zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni spyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni spyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: The term “one” is a general statement.

original: de'i phyir sde lnga char gzung ngo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sde lnga char gzung ngo zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the five classes are included.

original: mi zhes bya ba ni mi'i 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: mi zhes bya ba ni mi'i 'gro ba ste /
translated: Human refers to the class of humans.

original: bshad pa ni 'gro ba'i gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa ni 'gro ba'i gtso bo yin no //
translated: It is the best of the classes of beings.

original: des na 'dir bud med dang / ma ning dang mer mer po la sogs pa dag kyang smos par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des na 'dir bud med dang / ma ning dang mer mer po la sogs pa dag kyang smos par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the term human also includes women, eunuchs, and embryos, etc.

original: 'dir gzhung ni mi'am mir chags pa zhes bya bar 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni mi'am mir chags pa zhes bya bar 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The text reads: “a human or one who is becoming a human.”

original: mir chags pa zhes bya ba ni mer mer po dang nur nur po dang / ltar ltar po dang mkhrang gyur gyi gnas skabs rnams yin no //
analyzed: mir chags pa zhes bya ba ni mer mer po dang nur nur po dang / ltar ltar po dang mkhrang gyur gyi gnas skabs rnams yin no //
translated: One who is becoming a human refers to the stages of embryo, i.e., kalala, arbuda, peśin, and ghana.

original: mi ni rka lag 'gyus pa dang / byis pa dang / gzhon nu dang / dar la bab pa dang / bar ma dang / rgan po'i gnas skabs rnams yin no //
analyzed: mi ni rka lag 'gyus pa dang / byis pa dang / gzhon nu dang / dar la bab pa dang / bar ma dang / rgan po'i gnas skabs rnams yin no //
translated: A human refers to the stages of birth, i.e., infant, youth, adult, middle-aged, and elder.

original: rnam par 'byed pa las mir chags pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis ma'i mngal du dbang po gsum po lus dang / srog dang / yid kyi dbang po rnams rnyed pa'o /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa las mir chags pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis ma'i mngal du dbang po gsum po lus dang / srog dang / yid kyi dbang po rnams rnyed pa'o /
translated: The Exposition of the Faculties declares: “One who is becoming a human is one who obtains the three faculties of body, life, and mind in the mother’s womb.”

original: // mi zhes bya ba ni gang gis dbang po drug po mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi dbang po rnams rnyed pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: // mi zhes bya ba ni gang gis dbang po drug po mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi dbang po rnams rnyed pa'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: “Human” refers to one who has obtained the six faculties of eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: de ltar na bcas pa'i gnas skabs lnga dang / mngal gyi gnas skabs lnga ni ris mthun pa gcig yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na bcas pa'i gnas skabs lnga dang / mngal gyi gnas skabs lnga ni ris mthun pa gcig yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the five stages of the embryo and the five stages of the garbha are to be understood as a single class.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rtsa ba'i bye brag tu bshad pa las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rtsa ba'i bye brag tu bshad pa las /
translated: Therefore, the root text of the Abhidharmakośa states,

original: 'phags pa nyer sbas kyis mer mer po bsad na mthar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / mngal tshun chad lo nyi shu lon pa ni bsnyen par rdzogs par rung ngo zhes khungs gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyer sbas kyis mer mer po bsad na mthar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / mngal tshun chad lo nyi shu lon pa ni bsnyen par rdzogs par rung ngo zhes khungs gsungs pa yin te /
translated: “Ārya Upagupta said that killing an embryo is a heinous act, and that one who is twenty years old in the womb is fit to be fully ordained.”

original: @78b mer mer po tshun chad mir gdags so zhes dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: @78b mer mer po tshun chad mir gdags so zhes dgongs pa yin no //
translated: This is because it is the intention that one is designated a human being from the stage of the embryo onward.

original: mi zhes ci'i phyir smos she na /
analyzed: mi zhes ci'i phyir smos she na /
translated: Why is “human” mentioned?

original: 'gro ba gzhan nam sprul pa la ni ltung ba chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan nam sprul pa la ni ltung ba chung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is stated in order to show that if one kills a being of another realm or a magical creation, it is a minor offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni tshe dang ldan pa dag mi ma yin pa shin tu chen po bsad na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni tshe dang ldan pa dag mi ma yin pa shin tu chen po bsad na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Venerables, if you kill a nonhuman of great size, you commit a serious offense.

original: sprul pa yang gzhung ni gtam gyi gzhi las /
analyzed: sprul pa yang gzhung ni gtam gyi gzhi las /
translated: The treatise Bases of Discipline declares:

original: gang zhig 'gro ba thams cad dang ma 'brel la /
analyzed: gang zhig 'gro ba thams cad dang ma 'brel la /
translated: What is it that is not related to any world,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin zhing /
translated: is not nirvana,

original: rgyal ba'i bstan pa la yang mi 'jug pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i bstan pa la yang mi 'jug pa de gang zhe na /
translated: and does not enter the Conqueror's teaching?

original: bshad pa / sprul pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / sprul pa'o //
translated: It is an emanation.

original: de srog dang bral na cir 'gyur bshad pa /
analyzed: de srog dang bral na cir 'gyur bshad pa /
translated: What happens if you kill it?

original: dman pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //🔽ji ste ci'i phyir mi bsad na mthar 'gyur la lha la sogs pa mi ma yin pa bsad na ni sdom por 'gyur /
analyzed: dman pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no // ji ste ci'i phyir mi bsad na mthar 'gyur la lha la sogs pa mi ma yin pa bsad na ni sdom por 'gyur /
translated: It is said: You commit a serious offense.🔽Why is killing a human a heinous act, but killing a nonhuman such as a god is a serious offense?

original: dud 'gror gyur pa bsad na ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: dud 'gror gyur pa bsad na ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na //
translated: Killing an animal is a downfall.

original: 'dir 'phags pa nyer sbas kyis gsungs pa la 'jig rten na mi bsad pa la shin tu skyo bar byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa nyer sbas kyis gsungs pa la 'jig rten na mi bsad pa la shin tu skyo bar byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Here, it is said that the arya Upagupta said this because he was extremely disgusted with killing humans in the world.

original: gzhan yang mi rnams kho na la dkon mchog gsum rnam par 'jog pa dang / so sor thar pa dang / bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa gnas la /
analyzed: gzhan yang mi rnams kho na la dkon mchog gsum rnam par 'jog pa dang / so sor thar pa dang / bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa gnas la /
translated: Moreover, the three jewels are posited among humans and the vows of individual liberation, absorption and uncontaminated vows exist among humans.

original: mi ma yin pa rnams la yang bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa gnyis gnas shing /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa rnams la yang bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pa gnyis gnas shing /
translated: The two vows of absorption and uncontaminated vows exist among nonhumans,

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni med do ;🔽dud 'gro rnams la ni sdom pa gsum char med pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas mi rnams ni gtso bo yin /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni med do ; dud 'gro rnams la ni sdom pa gsum char med pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas mi rnams ni gtso bo yin /
translated: but the vows of individual liberation do not exist among them.🔽It is said that the three vows do not exist among animals and so on.

original: mi ma yin pa rnams ni 'bring yin /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa rnams ni 'bring yin /
translated: Therefore humans are primary, nonhumans are intermediate and animals are inferior.

original: dud 'gro rnams ni tha chad yin pas ltung ba tha dad par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: dud 'gro rnams ni tha chad yin pas ltung ba tha dad par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that downfalls are different for each.

original: gzhan smos pa ci dgos she na /
analyzed: gzhan smos pa ci dgos she na /
translated: Why mention others?

original: bdag gsod pa ltung ba chung ngu yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag gsod pa ltung ba chung ngu yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that killing oneself is a minor downfall.

original: zhus pa las kyang 'di skad du /
analyzed: zhus pa las kyang 'di skad du /
translated: The Questions of Revata Sutra states:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis mi la mir 'du shes pas srog dang phral na mthar mi 'gyur ba lta mchis sam /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis mi la mir 'du shes pas srog dang phral na mthar mi 'gyur ba lta mchis sam /
translated: “Venerable! Is it possible for a fully ordained monk to take the life of a human being, thinking he is a human being, and not commit a heinous offense?”

original: bdag nyid la gsod par byed na dman pa sbom por 'gyur ba yod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag nyid la gsod par byed na dman pa sbom por 'gyur ba yod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: “If he kills himself, he commits a serious offense entailing expulsion.”

original: dman pa sbom por zhes bya ba ni chung ba'i rnam grangs yin te /
analyzed: dman pa sbom por zhes bya ba ni chung ba'i rnam grangs yin te /
translated: The term “serious offense entailing expulsion” is a synonym for “minor offense.”

original: autpa la'i phreng ba las 'di skad ces dman pa sdom ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni ril gyis ma yin pa dang / glang po che'i gtso bo dag mi bul mi mgyogs par 'gro ba la sbyar ba yin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: autpa la'i phreng ba las 'di skad ces dman pa sdom ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni ril gyis ma yin pa dang / glang po che'i gtso bo dag mi bul mi mgyogs par 'gro ba la sbyar ba yin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The Garland of Flowers states: “The term ‘serious offense’ is applied to those who are not fully ordained and to those who are fully ordained but are not swift in their actions, like the chief of elephants.”

original: ril gyis ma yin pa ni chung ba nyid yin no @79a * //
analyzed: ril gyis ma yin pa ni chung ba nyid yin no @79a * //
translated: “Not fully ordained” means “minor.”

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the term.

original: gang la nyes pa sbom por zhes 'byung ba der dman pa sbom po zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
analyzed: gang la nyes pa sbom por zhes 'byung ba der dman pa sbom po zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
translated: In the case of the term “serious offense,” the term “serious offense entailing expulsion” is used.

original: sbom po zhes bya ba'i sgrar sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: sbom po zhes bya ba'i sgrar sbyar ba yin no //
translated: The term “heavy” is applied to the term “offense.”

original: 'di ltar tshig ni phyogs gcig la yang sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshig ni phyogs gcig la yang sbyar ba yin te /
translated: For example, the term “one” is applied to a part,🔽as in the case of “one who is afraid” and “one who speaks the truth.”

original: dper na 'jigs sde la 'jigs pa zhes bya ba dang / bden smra la smra ba zhes bya ba lta bu yin pas de'i phyir nyes pa'i sgras bye brag gi tshig tu bsdu na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur te /
analyzed: dper na 'jigs sde la 'jigs pa zhes bya ba dang / bden smra la smra ba zhes bya ba lta bu yin pas de'i phyir nyes pa'i sgras bye brag gi tshig tu bsdu na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, when the term “offense” is included in the term “heavy,” it becomes “heavy offense.”

original: 'das pa chung ngu zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa chung ngu zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be “minor transgression.”

original: bud med kyi rtags su bstan pa ni ltung ba chung ngu dang sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bud med kyi rtags su bstan pa ni ltung ba chung ngu dang sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “woman” is used because it is associated with a minor offense.

original: ci ste de ltar na 'das pa chung ngu zhes bya ba 'das ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ji ltar 'brel bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste de ltar na 'das pa chung ngu zhes bya ba 'das ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don ji ltar 'brel bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how is the term “minor transgression” related to the term “transgression”?

original: spyi dang khyad par gyi dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di la nges pa med de dper na ba lang gso bar byed ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par gyi dngos po nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di la nges pa med de dper na ba lang gso bar byed ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: There is no certainty in this case, because it is a general and specific entity, as in the case of “one who tends cows.”

original: ltung ba'i rang bzhin ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: ltung ba'i rang bzhin ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of a transgression?

original: lus kyi dang ngag gi las 'das pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: lus kyi dang ngag gi las 'das pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the downfalls is that of physical and verbal karma.

original: ci ste yid kyis thal ba'i rang bzhin ltung ba ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yid kyis thal ba'i rang bzhin ltung ba ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the nature of the downfalls not that of mental karma?

original: yid kyi sdom pa la so sor thar pa'i sdom pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi sdom pa la so sor thar pa'i sdom pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mental vow is not the pratimoksa vow.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni spong ba bdun gyi mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ni spong ba bdun gyi mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: The pratimoksa vow is characterized by the abandonment of the seven kinds of unwholesome actions:

original: lus kyi rnam pa gsum ngag gi rnam pa bzhi zhes bya bar nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi rnam pa gsum ngag gi rnam pa bzhi zhes bya bar nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: three kinds of physical actions and four kinds of verbal actions.

original: gtam gyi gzhi las kyang /
analyzed: gtam gyi gzhi las kyang /
translated: The Basis of Discipline states:

original: ltung ba ni rnam par rig byed yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba ni rnam par rig byed yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The downfalls are to be described as intimation.🔽Similarly, the downfalls are not to be described as either mind or mental factors.

original: de bzhin du ltung ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir rnam par rig byed nyid dang / gzugs can nyid du bstan pa'i phyir dang / sems dang sems las byung ba dag ni bkag pa'i phyir yid kyi bya ba la ni ltung ba nyid med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du ltung ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir rnam par rig byed nyid dang / gzugs can nyid du bstan pa'i phyir dang / sems dang sems las byung ba dag ni bkag pa'i phyir yid kyi bya ba la ni ltung ba nyid med do //
translated: Therefore, the downfalls are not mental actions because they are taught to be intimation and to be form, and because mind and mental factors are excluded.

original: mir ni 'du shes zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba gzhan du 'du shes pa ni mthar 'gyur ba med par ston to //
analyzed: mir ni 'du shes zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba gzhan du 'du shes pa ni mthar 'gyur ba med par ston to //
translated: The phrase “the perception of a human being” shows that the perception of another being is not a terminating factor.

original: gsad pa'i bsam pas zhes bya ba ni gsad par bya ba'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: gsad pa'i bsam pas zhes bya ba ni gsad par bya ba'i sems kyis so //
translated: The phrase “with the intention to kill” means with the thought to kill.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text reads:

original: dge slong gis skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning dag gsang ba'i sems kyis zhes bya ba 'byung ba yin no //🔽'khrul med ces bya ba ni 'khrul pa ni de ma yin bzhin du yin no zhes nges par brtags nas nor ba ste /
analyzed: dge slong gis skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning dag gsang ba'i sems kyis zhes bya ba 'byung ba yin no // 'khrul med ces bya ba ni 'khrul pa ni de ma yin bzhin du yin no zhes nges par brtags nas nor ba ste /
translated: “If a monk, with a hidden intention, kills a human being, a neuter, or an animal, he commits an offense entailing expulsion.”🔽The phrase “without error” means that there is no error if the person is killed when the person is not the one who was intended to be killed.

original: ma 'khrul pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “without error” means that there is no error if the person is killed when the person is not the one who was intended to be killed.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /
translated: The text reads:

original: ma lam ma lags pa'i 'du shes kyis 'gums na cir 'gyur /
analyzed: ma lam ma lags pa'i 'du shes kyis 'gums na cir 'gyur /
translated: “What if I kill someone who is not the one I intended to kill?”

original: bka' stsal pa /🔽nyes pa sbom po'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du mi @79b gnyis 'khod pa na /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa / nyes pa sbom po'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du mi @79b gnyis 'khod pa na /
translated: The Buddha said:🔽“You commit a serious offense.”🔽“What if I kill two people when I intend to kill only one?”🔽The Buddha said:

original: de na de gsad do snyam nas gcig gsad pa'i sems kyis gnyis pa 'gums na cir 'gyur bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de na de gsad do snyam nas gcig gsad pa'i sems kyis gnyis pa 'gums na cir 'gyur bka' stsal pa /
translated: “You commit an offense entailing expulsion for the one you kill, and a serious offense for the other.”

original: nyes pa sbom po'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom po'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: It is a serious offense.

original: 'o na dgra bcom pa la dgra bcom pa ma yin pa'i 'du shes kyis gsod na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin /🔽ci dgra bcom pa'i lus la dgra bcom pa ma yin pa'i lus su nor pas dgra bcom pa ma yin par 'du shes pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'o na dgra bcom pa la dgra bcom pa ma yin pa'i 'du shes kyis gsod na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin / ci dgra bcom pa'i lus la dgra bcom pa ma yin pa'i lus su nor pas dgra bcom pa ma yin par 'du shes pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: What is the meaning of the statement, “If one kills an arhat with the thought that the person is not an arhat, one commits a serious offense”?🔽Does it mean that one kills an arhat with the thought that the body of an arhat is not the body of an arhat,

original: 'on te lus gcig la dgra bcom pa nyid kyi chos med par nor ba las 'gyur ba brjod par bya dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te lus gcig la dgra bcom pa nyid kyi chos med par nor ba las 'gyur ba brjod par bya dgos so zhe na /
translated: or does it mean that one kills an arhat with the thought that the body of an arhat lacks the qualities of an arhat?

original: de ni gzhan gyi lus su nor ba las sbom po yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi lus su nor ba las sbom po yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: It is explained that it is a serious offense if one kills another thinking him to be an arhat.🔽If that were not so, then if one kills an arhat with the thought that the body of an arhat lacks the qualities of an arhat, it would be a heinous act.

original: de lta ma yin na dgra bcom pa nyid kyi chos med pa las yin na ni mtshams med par gyur na mi rung gis kyang lus gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dgra bcom pa nyid kyi chos med pa las yin na ni mtshams med par gyur na mi rung gis kyang lus gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But it is not, because the body is the same.

original: pham pa ni sus kyang bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: pham pa ni sus kyang bzlog par dka'o //
translated: It is difficult to reverse a defeat.

original: de lta bas na ji ltar ma lam ma yin pa'i 'du shes bzhin du dgra bcom pa la dgra bcom pa ma yin pa'i 'du shes kyang de lta bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na ji ltar ma lam ma yin pa'i 'du shes bzhin du dgra bcom pa la dgra bcom pa ma yin pa'i 'du shes kyang de lta bur rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, just as there is the perception of a non-path as a path, so too should one understand the perception of a non-arhat as an arhat.

original: gsod byed ces bya ba ni gsod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsod byed ces bya ba ni gsod par byed pa'o //
translated: “Killer” means one who kills.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here, the text reads:

original: lus kyis sam lus dang 'brel pas sam phyi rol du thal bas sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: lus kyis sam lus dang 'brel pas sam phyi rol du thal bas sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: “By body, by body-related means, by external means, and so on.”

original: mi shi zhes bya ba ni mi'i rigs shi bar gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi shi zhes bya ba ni mi'i rigs shi bar gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Dead” means when a human of a certain type dies.

original: dus nges par ma bshad pa'i phyir de'i tshe'am gzhan gyi tshe yang rung ste /
analyzed: dus nges par ma bshad pa'i phyir de'i tshe'am gzhan gyi tshe yang rung ste /
translated: Since the time is not specified, it is at that time or at another time.

original: sbyong ba des shi na mthar 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //🔽'dir gzhung ni des de'i tshe kho na ni ma yin la /
analyzed: sbyong ba des shi na mthar 'gyur bar rig par bya'o // 'dir gzhung ni des de'i tshe kho na ni ma yin la /
translated: If that one dies by that means, it should be understood that the end has come.🔽Here, the text reads:

original: 'on kyang des de nas phyis gyur na dge slong pham pa byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang des de nas phyis gyur na dge slong pham pa byung ba yin no //
translated: “It is not just at that time, but if that one later becomes so, then the monk has incurred a defeating offense.”

original: des de'i tshe yang ma yin la des de nas phyis kyang ma yin na dge slong nyes pa sbom po byung ba yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: des de'i tshe yang ma yin la des de nas phyis kyang ma yin na dge slong nyes pa sbom po byung ba yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If it is not by that and it is not later by that, then the monk has committed a heinous offense.

original: 'o na rtsa ba'i bye brag tu bshad pa'i gzhung dang 'gal te /
analyzed: 'o na rtsa ba'i bye brag tu bshad pa'i gzhung dang 'gal te /
translated: Well then, this contradicts the root text of the Great Exegesis, which states:

original: gcig gis ni zhag bcu tsam gyis 'chi bar 'gyur bar mtshon bsnun la /
analyzed: gcig gis ni zhag bcu tsam gyis 'chi bar 'gyur bar mtshon bsnun la /
translated: One person stabs with a weapon and the other dies after ten days.

original: gnyis pas ni zhag dgus 'chi bar 'gyur bar mtshon bsnun pa nas /🔽bcu pas ni de nyid kyi nyin par shi bar mtshon bsnun na de'i phyir dgu po rnams kyis ni pham pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bzung ba yin la /
analyzed: gnyis pas ni zhag dgus 'chi bar 'gyur bar mtshon bsnun pa nas / bcu pas ni de nyid kyi nyin par shi bar mtshon bsnun na de'i phyir dgu po rnams kyis ni pham pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bzung ba yin la /
translated: The second stabs with a weapon and the other dies after nine days.

original: bcu pas ni pham pa'i rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba dang 'gal te /
analyzed: bcu pas ni pham pa'i rnam par rig byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang bzung ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba dang 'gal te /
translated: The tenth stabs with a weapon and the other dies on that very day. Therefore the first nine take up the nonindicative form of a heinous act but the tenth takes up both the indicative and nonindicative form of a heinous act.🔽This contradicts the above explanation.

original: 'dir snga ma shos rnams la ni @80a * //
analyzed: 'dir snga ma shos rnams la ni @80a * //
translated: Here the first nine

original: sbyor ba de nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i don de mi srid pa'i phyir dang / bcu pa shos kho na la srid pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: sbyor ba de nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i don de mi srid pa'i phyir dang / bcu pa shos kho na la srid pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because it is impossible for the first to be the meaning of that passage and because it is possible for the tenth to be the meaning of that passage.🔽This contradicts the Abhidharmakosa statement:

original: bcu char gyis pham pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin par bsdus so zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bcu char gyis pham pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin par bsdus so zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal ba yin no zhe na /
translated: The tenth is subsumed by the nonindicative form of defeat.

original: 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: 'gal ba med de /
translated: There is no contradiction because

original: bcu char gyi yang sbyor ba mthun pa'i phyir dang 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcu char gyi yang sbyor ba mthun pa'i phyir dang 'bras bu gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the first and the tenth are similar in their performance and they have the same result.

original: gzhan dag na re dang po nyid kyis nges par byas pa'i phyir gnyis pa la sogs pa la ni pham par mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dang po nyid kyis nges par byas pa'i phyir gnyis pa la sogs pa la ni pham par mi rigs te /
translated: Others say: It is illogical that the second and so on are defeats because they are definitely not defeats from the very first.

original: dang po pas tshe'i tshad ci yod pa med par byas pa de kho na la gnyis pa la sogs pas byed par zad de //
analyzed: dang po pas tshe'i tshad ci yod pa med par byas pa de kho na la gnyis pa la sogs pas byed par zad de //
translated: The first destroys whatever life span one has and the second and so on merely destroy that.

original: 'di ltar rtsa ba'i bye brag tu bshad pa nyid las gang gi tshe dbugs rdu ba pa dang 'byung ba tha mar gyur cing gnad dang 'gal ba'i tshor ba la gnas pa na mtshon bsnun te dus byas na des pham pa'i ltung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtsa ba'i bye brag tu bshad pa nyid las gang gi tshe dbugs rdu ba pa dang 'byung ba tha mar gyur cing gnad dang 'gal ba'i tshor ba la gnas pa na mtshon bsnun te dus byas na des pham pa'i ltung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: When one’s breath is about to cease and one is experiencing pain that is incompatible with life, if one is killed by a weapon, one does not commit a defeating offense.

original: 'di ltar de ni de nyid kyi tshe 'chi bas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni de nyid kyi tshe 'chi bas so zhes zer ro //
translated: Because one dies at that time.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: mi bcu char yang sbyor ba mtshungs pa dang 'dra bar zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: mi bcu char yang sbyor ba mtshungs pa dang 'dra bar zhugs pa yin te /
translated: All ten men are similar in their preparation and performance.

original: des na de rnams ltung ba mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de rnams ltung ba mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are similar in their offense.🔽Since the final breath is the state of death, it is meaningless to act.

original: dbugs rgyu ba tha mar gyur pa ni 'jig pa'i gnas skabs nyid yin pa'i phyir byed pa don med pa nyid yin pas gal mtshungs /
analyzed: dbugs rgyu ba tha mar gyur pa ni 'jig pa'i gnas skabs nyid yin pa'i phyir byed pa don med pa nyid yin pas gal mtshungs /
translated: Therefore, they are similar in their offense.

original: btsun pa chos dga' na re ni yod ye tshe'i skad cig gcig lus pa la yang gsod pa gang yin pa de la mthar 'gyur la /
analyzed: btsun pa chos dga' na re ni yod ye tshe'i skad cig gcig lus pa la yang gsod pa gang yin pa de la mthar 'gyur la /
translated: Bhadanta Dharmatrāta says: If one kills someone who has only one moment of life remaining, one commits a heinous offense.

original: gzhan rnams la ni sbom por 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan rnams la ni sbom por 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: If one kills others, one commits a serious offense.

original: yang gang zhig gsad pa'i phyir mtshon btab nas 'gyod par byed /
analyzed: yang gang zhig gsad pa'i phyir mtshon btab nas 'gyod par byed /
translated: Also, if one strikes with a weapon in order to kill but then regrets it,🔽if one confesses it, then it will not become a heinous act.

original: phyir 'chos par byed na de la mthar mi 'gyur ro zhes 'chad pa ni dngos gzhi'i las kyi lam 'jug par byed pa'i sems pa rnam par smad pas log pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa mi skye bas so ;
analyzed: phyir 'chos par byed na de la mthar mi 'gyur ro zhes 'chad pa ni dngos gzhi'i las kyi lam 'jug par byed pa'i sems pa rnam par smad pas log pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa mi skye bas so ;
translated: This is explained because the nonindicative form does not arise since the intention that engages the actual basis of the karmic path is censured.

original: / de bzhin du mdo las /
analyzed: / de bzhin du mdo las /
translated: Similarly, a sutra states:

original: 'dun pa bzlog pa'i 'og tu shi na rgyu med pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dun pa bzlog pa'i 'og tu shi na rgyu med pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: If one dies after turning away from desire, then it is causeless.

original: gal te de lta ma yin na ma skyes dgra la mtshams med pa 'byung ngo zhes pa dang 'gal te /
analyzed: gal te de lta ma yin na ma skyes dgra la mtshams med pa 'byung ngo zhes pa dang 'gal te /
translated: If that were not so, it would contradict the statement that Ajatashatru would commit a heinous act.

original: ma skyes dgras gson pa'i gtam zhig yod na mgu ba'i rdzas sbyin par dam bcas pa dang / gzugs can snying po shin du brtad par 'os pa rnams kyi sgra thos pas shi bar gyur pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ma skyes dgras gson pa'i gtam zhig yod na mgu ba'i rdzas sbyin par dam bcas pa dang / gzugs can snying po shin du brtad par 'os pa rnams kyi sgra thos pas shi bar gyur pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: This is because Ajatashatru promised to give a reward to anyone who would please him with news of the living Jivaka and because Bimbisara died from hearing the very alarming news.

original: 'gal ba med de de dus phyi mar gnas skabs mi 'dra ba la sbyor ba ni chung ba nyid yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba med de de dus phyi mar gnas skabs mi 'dra ba la sbyor ba ni chung ba nyid yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no contradiction, because it is asserted that the action is small if it is applied to a different occasion in the future.

original: de bzhin du mdo las /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo las /
translated: Similarly, a sutra states:

original: sngon gyi tshigs su sbyor ba byas pa ni chung ba nyid yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi tshigs su sbyor ba byas pa ni chung ba nyid yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The former application is small.

original: dper na sngon gyi @80b tshigs khyim pa nyid yin la sbyor ba de'i dbang gis dge tshul nyid la sogs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dper na sngon gyi @80b tshigs khyim pa nyid yin la sbyor ba de'i dbang gis dge tshul nyid la sogs pa'i tshe /
translated: For example, if one was previously a layperson and by the power of that application one becomes a novice and so on,

original: las kyi lam gang zhig grub na'o //
analyzed: las kyi lam gang zhig grub na'o //
translated: then the path of action is established.

original: dge tshul nyid kyis sbyor ba byas pa tsam gyi dbang gis bsnyen par rdzogs pa nyid du grub na chung ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: dge tshul nyid kyis sbyor ba byas pa tsam gyi dbang gis bsnyen par rdzogs pa nyid du grub na chung ba nyid yin te /
translated: If one becomes fully ordained by the power of merely applying oneself to the vows of a novice, it is small.

original: snga ma'i tshigs su sbyor ba byas pa'i las kyi lam tshigs phyi ma la rdzogs na chung ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snga ma'i tshigs su sbyor ba byas pa'i las kyi lam tshigs phyi ma la rdzogs na chung ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that if the path of action established by the former application is completed in the latter stage, it is small.

original: de bzhin du yang gtsug lag las /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang gtsug lag las /
translated: Similarly, the Abhidharma states:

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas rku ba la sbyor zhing /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas rku ba la sbyor zhing /
translated: One who is not fully ordained applies himself to stealing🔽and then becomes fully ordained.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa na rku bar byed na nyes byas so //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa na rku bar byed na nyes byas so //
translated: If one steals when not fully ordained, it is a wrong action.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas rku ba la sbyor zhing bsnyen par rdzogs pa na rku bar byed na nyes pa sbom po'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas rku ba la sbyor zhing bsnyen par rdzogs pa na rku bar byed na nyes pa sbom po'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If one who is not fully ordained prepares to steal and then steals when fully ordained, it is a serious violation.

original: de lta bas na rab tu sdang ba'i gnas skabs la sbyor ba byas pa ni snying brtse ba'i gnas skabs su yongs su rdzogs na chung ba nyid yin pas ma skyes dgra la mtshams med pa chung ba nyid byung ba'i phyir 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: de lta bas na rab tu sdang ba'i gnas skabs la sbyor ba byas pa ni snying brtse ba'i gnas skabs su yongs su rdzogs na chung ba nyid yin pas ma skyes dgra la mtshams med pa chung ba nyid byung ba'i phyir 'gal ba med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in saying that Ajātaśatru committed a minor immediate karmic retribution because he committed the action of the occasion of intense hatred, but it was completed on the occasion of compassion.

original: dper na nyes byas chung ngu la nyes byas zhes bya ba de bzhin du mtshams med pa chung ngu la mtshams med pa nyid ces bya'o //🔽'o na gsad par bya ba la mtshon btab nas de dang lhan cig gam /
analyzed: dper na nyes byas chung ngu la nyes byas zhes bya ba de bzhin du mtshams med pa chung ngu la mtshams med pa nyid ces bya'o // 'o na gsad par bya ba la mtshon btab nas de dang lhan cig gam /
translated: Just as a minor offense is called an offense, so too a minor immediate karmic retribution is called an immediate karmic retribution.🔽If one strikes with a weapon to kill another and then dies simultaneously with the other,

original: de bas sngar gsod par byed pa shi na de la ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas sngar gsod par byed pa shi na de la ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: or if the killer dies before the other, what is the result?

original: de la yang mthar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la yang mthar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But that also does not become a limit.🔽

original: gsad pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skye ba'i gnas skabs la bab pa na ris mi 'dra ba'i lus su skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsad pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skye ba'i gnas skabs la bab pa na ris mi 'dra ba'i lus su skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not so, because at the time when the nonindicative form of killing arises, one is born in a different class of body.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: lhan cig sngar ni shi ba la //🔽lus gzhan skyes pas dngos gzhi med //
analyzed: lhan cig sngar ni shi ba la // lus gzhan skyes pas dngos gzhi med //
translated: If one dies before the other,

original: ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: then there is no actual basis since one is born in a different body.

original: de bzhin du 'dul ba mdo las /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dul ba mdo las /
translated: And the Vinaya Sutra declares:

original: tshe rabs gzhan du las kyi lam skyo ba med do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du las kyi lam skyo ba med do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: There is no path of action in other lives.

original: rmi lam ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni rmi lam du rmis pa bor te /
analyzed: rmi lam ma gtogs zhes bya ba ni rmi lam du rmis pa bor te /
translated: Except for dreams means that dreams are excluded.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The treatise declares:

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'khrig pa las byung ba'i chos bsten na zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'khrig pa las byung ba'i chos bsten na zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If one engages in sexual union, then one possesses the actual basis of sexual misconduct.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin pas 'dir chos smos pa gang yin pa des na bcom ldan 'das kyis rmi lam gyi 'khrig pa las byung ba la sogs pa la ni rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin pas 'dir chos smos pa gang yin pa des na bcom ldan 'das kyis rmi lam gyi 'khrig pa las byung ba la sogs pa la ni rang gi ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir
translated: Because it holds its own intrinsic reality, it is called a phenomenon.

original: ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the Bhagavān said that there is no downfall in the case of sexual intercourse in a dream, etc., because they lack intrinsic reality.

original: gzhan yang 'di chos ma yin yang chos kyi sgrar gsungs so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di chos ma yin yang chos kyi sgrar gsungs so zhes bstan to //
translated: Moreover, it is taught that even though it is not a phenomenon, it is called a phenomenon.

original: 'khrig pa ni chos ma yin yang chos kyi sgrar bstan pas rang gi mtshan nyid du yod pa'i 'khrig pa @81a * //
analyzed: 'khrig pa ni chos ma yin yang chos kyi sgrar bstan pas rang gi mtshan nyid du yod pa'i 'khrig pa @81a * //
translated: Sexual intercourse is taught as a phenomenon even though it is not a phenomenon, in order to refute sexual intercourse that exists by its intrinsic reality.

original: dgag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dgag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: bye brag tu bshad pa las kyang rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin par byed pa nyid yin par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir so sor thar pa rdzogs kyi bar du chos smos pa yang de'i dbang du mdzad pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bye brag tu bshad pa las kyang rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin par byed pa nyid yin par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir so sor thar pa rdzogs kyi bar du chos smos pa yang de'i dbang du mdzad pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The term phenomena is mentioned in the Sūtra on Monastic Discipline until the vows of individual liberation are mentioned in order to teach that they are the characteristics of the vows.

original: gzhan yang 'dul ba las 'gyur ba'i dgongs pa 'di ni 'dod par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dul ba las 'gyur ba'i dgongs pa 'di ni 'dod par bya ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, this intention of the Vinaya should be accepted:

original: rmi lam ma gtogs te dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o zhes gsungs pa'i rtags yod pa'i phyir dang / rmi lam ni tha snyad gdags su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rmi lam ma gtogs te dge 'dun gyi lhag ma'o zhes gsungs pa'i rtags yod pa'i phyir dang / rmi lam ni tha snyad gdags su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The Vinaya mentions, “Except for dreams, it is a partial defeat,” because there is a sign of that and because dreams cannot be designated as conventional reality.

original: 'o na rmi lam la dgag par ji ltar 'thad /
analyzed: 'o na rmi lam la dgag par ji ltar 'thad /
translated: If so, how can it be possible to stop dreams?

original: dge slong dang dge slong ma'i sdom pa ni spong ba bdun gyi mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: dge slong dang dge slong ma'i sdom pa ni spong ba bdun gyi mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: The vows of fully ordained monks and nuns are characterized by seven vows to abandon.

original: dge tshul la sogs pa dag gi ni spong ba bzhi'i mtshan nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: dge tshul la sogs pa dag gi ni spong ba bzhi'i mtshan nyid yin zhing /
translated: The vows of male and female novices and so on are characterized by four vows to abandon.

original: rmi lam na ni lus kyi rnam pa gsum dang / ngag gi rnam pa bzhi med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rmi lam na ni lus kyi rnam pa gsum dang / ngag gi rnam pa bzhi med pa kho na yin te /
translated: In dreams, there are only three types of physical action and four types of verbal action.

original: rmi lam ni yid kyi rnam par rtog pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: rmi lam ni yid kyi rnam par rtog pa tsam nyid yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because a dream is merely a mental conception, and

original: yid kyi bya ba la ni ltung bar yang mi 'dod pas so zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyi bya ba la ni ltung bar yang mi 'dod pas so zhe na /
translated: mental action is not considered to be a downfall.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gang la mi nyal ba'i gnas skabs bzhin du byed pa dag la 'jug pa'i rmi lam kha cig la lus dang ngag gi las dag kyang yod de /
analyzed: gang la mi nyal ba'i gnas skabs bzhin du byed pa dag la 'jug pa'i rmi lam kha cig la lus dang ngag gi las dag kyang yod de /
translated: In some dreams, such as when one is awake, there is physical and verbal action.

original: de lta bu'i rmi lam de'i dbang du mdzad nas rmi lam ni ma gtogs so zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rmi lam de'i dbang du mdzad nas rmi lam ni ma gtogs so zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in saying that dreams are excluded, because they are like that.

original: de lta yin na yang bshad par mi bya ba yin te ;
analyzed: de lta yin na yang bshad par mi bya ba yin te ;
translated: Even if that is so, it should not be explained,

original: rang bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya ba nyid kyis go ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya ba nyid kyis go ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is understood by the term “natural state.”

original: de yang bden na 'jig rten pa'i lugs kyi dbang gis de skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang bden na 'jig rten pa'i lugs kyi dbang gis de skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: That is true, but it was said in that way from the perspective of worldly convention.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na ni rmi lam na byed pa'i srog chags dag la brtags nas smyos pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na ni rmi lam na byed pa'i srog chags dag la brtags nas smyos pa'am /
translated: In this way, people in the world do not think that those who act in dreams are insane,

original: sems 'khrug pa'am /
analyzed: sems 'khrug pa'am /
translated: or that their minds are disturbed,

original: tshor bas gzir ba yin par mi sems so //
analyzed: tshor bas gzir ba yin par mi sems so //
translated: or that they are afflicted by pain.

original: de brlag 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dge tshul las pham pa yin te /
analyzed: de brlag 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dge tshul las pham pa yin te /
translated: “He is ruined” means that a novice monk has a root downfall,

original: ta la'i mgo bcad pa dang 'dra bar phyis skye ba'i skal pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ta la'i mgo bcad pa dang 'dra bar phyis skye ba'i skal pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is like a palm tree that has had its top cut off, which cannot live.

original: de yang pham pa rnams las dge slong ji lta ba bzhin du dge slong ma dang / dge slob ma dang / dge tshul ma yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang pham pa rnams las dge slong ji lta ba bzhin du dge slong ma dang / dge slob ma dang / dge tshul ma yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood from the scriptures, which state that, “Just as a monk has root downfalls, so too a nun, a female probationer, and a novice nun.”🔽But in the Vinaya, the monk Pārśva said to the novice monk Dīrghanakha, “You have not taken full ordination, and I have not committed a transgression,” and the Blessed One said,

original: 'o na 'dul byed las sdig can dgon pa bas dge tshul la khyod la bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / mi changs par spyod pa byas dang / kho bo la yang ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes brid pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'o na 'dul byed las sdig can dgon pa bas dge tshul la khyod la bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / mi changs par spyod pa byas dang / kho bo la yang ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes brid pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Pārśva, you have committed a root downfall.”

original: dge tshul la nyes byas @81b su 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge tshul la nyes byas @81b su 'gyur la /
translated: For novices, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge tshul ma la yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: dge tshul ma la yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
