translated: The same applies to nuns.

original: 'di ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'di ni nyes pa med de /
translated: This is not a fault.

original: dge tshul gyi ltung ba ni thams cad du nyes byas kho na yin no //
analyzed: dge tshul gyi ltung ba ni thams cad du nyes byas kho na yin no //
translated: For novices, all downfalls are offenses of wrong conduct.

original: de yang yul gyi khyad par las kha cig tu ni pham par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang yul gyi khyad par las kha cig tu ni pham par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, due to the difference in the object, in some cases they are a defeat.

original: dper na srog gcod pa la sogs pa dag tu'o //
analyzed: dper na srog gcod pa la sogs pa dag tu'o //
translated: For example, killing and so on.

original: kha cig tu ni bshags par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: kha cig tu ni bshags par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: In some cases they are an acknowledgment.

original: dper na chang 'thung ba la sogs pa dag tu'o //
analyzed: dper na chang 'thung ba la sogs pa dag tu'o //
translated: For example, drinking alcohol and so on.

original: yang ci'i phyir bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i ni thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i chad pa rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i ni thams cad du nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i chad pa rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why is it that for those not fully ordained, all downfalls are established as offenses of wrong conduct?🔽Ārya Upagupta said:

original: 'phags pa nyer sbas kyi zhal nas bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa gnyis kyi bye brag bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyer sbas kyi zhal nas bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa gnyis kyi bye brag bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: The difference between those fully ordained and those not fully ordained is taught.

original: 'phags pa zla ba'i nor bu'i zhal nas ni tshul khrims kyi tha mar gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa zla ba'i nor bu'i zhal nas ni tshul khrims kyi tha mar gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: The noble Candrapradīpa Sūtra says, “Because it is the last of the moral disciplines.”

original: 'dir yang bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir yang bshad pa /
translated: Here, too, it is said:

original: mi gsod la sogs bzhi rnams kyis //
analyzed: mi gsod la sogs bzhi rnams kyis //
translated: By the four, such as not killing,🔽the novice monk falls;

original: dge tshul las ni nyams gyur dang // dge slong bzhin du dge tshul yang //
analyzed: dge tshul las ni nyams gyur dang // dge slong bzhin du dge tshul yang //
translated: just as the novice monk,

original: phyi nas sdom skye'i skal ba med //
analyzed: phyi nas sdom skye'i skal ba med //
translated: the monk also has no portion in the vow.

original: chang 'thung la sogs drug po yi //
analyzed: chang 'thung la sogs drug po yi //
translated: By the six, such as drinking alcohol,

original: bshags pa'i nyes byas mthun pa yin //
analyzed: bshags pa'i nyes byas mthun pa yin //
translated: he has the fault of a confessed offense.

original: phyogs dang mthun las 'das na de'i //
analyzed: phyogs dang mthun las 'das na de'i //
translated: If he transgresses the rule of the part,

original: nyes pa smad bya yin par bzhed //
analyzed: nyes pa smad bya yin par bzhed //
translated: that fault is to be confessed.

original: da ni gsod pa'i yan lag rnams rnam par dbye bar bya'o //🔽gang gis gsang sngags la sogs thabs rnams sam //
analyzed: da ni gsod pa'i yan lag rnams rnam par dbye bar bya'o // gang gis gsang sngags la sogs thabs rnams sam //
translated: Now, the limbs of killing should be analyzed.🔽If one kills by means of a spell, etc.,

original: gsang par sbyor la yi rang bas gsod na //
analyzed: gsang par sbyor la yi rang bas gsod na //
translated: or by means of a contrivance,

original: de yang mthar 'gyur gsang par sbyor ba las //
analyzed: de yang mthar 'gyur gsang par sbyor ba las //
translated: that also is a root downfall, because of the contrivance.

original: yid kyis yi rang na ni yid kyir 'gyur //
analyzed: yid kyis yi rang na ni yid kyir 'gyur //
translated: If one rejoices in the killing, it is mental.

original: dge tshul gang gis gsang sngags la sogs pa'i thabs rnams kyis gsod par byed na de yang mthar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: dge tshul gang gis gsang sngags la sogs pa'i thabs rnams kyis gsod par byed na de yang mthar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: If a novice monk kills by means of mantra and so on, he also becomes one who has committed a root downfall.

original: pham par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “one who has committed a root downfall” means “one who has committed a defeating offense.”

original: thabs rnams zhes bya ba mang po'i tshig smos pa ni thabs rnams mang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: thabs rnams zhes bya ba mang po'i tshig smos pa ni thabs rnams mang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir te //
translated: The term “means” is stated in the plural because there are many means.🔽For example, the Vinaya mentions:🔽If a monk sends someone to a place where there is danger with the intention to kill and that person dies, he commits a defeating offense.

original: dper na 'dul byed las dge slong gis gsad pa'i sems kyis 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs su btang la de yang shi na pham par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: dper na 'dul byed las dge slong gis gsad pa'i sems kyis 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs su btang la de yang shi na pham par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: Similarly, the Vinaya Verses states:

original: g-yangs la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: g-yangs la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: If one throws someone off a cliff and so on.

original: 'dir yang mi'i ched du sbyor ba byas la /
analyzed: 'dir yang mi'i ched du sbyor ba byas la /
translated: Here, if one prepares to kill a human but

original: gal te mi ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: gal te mi ma yin pa'am /
translated: kills a nonhuman,

original: dud 'gro'am / mi gzhan 'chi bar byed na thams cad la yang mi gsad @82a * //
analyzed: dud 'gro'am / mi gzhan 'chi bar byed na thams cad la yang mi gsad @82a * //
translated: an animal or another human, then in all cases one does not commit a heinous act.

original: pa'i sbyor ba de kho na las nyes pa sbom por 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //🔽mi ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: pa'i sbyor ba de kho na las nyes pa sbom por 'gyur bar rig par bya'o // mi ma yin pa'am /
translated: You should understand that the offense is a serious transgression only in that very context.🔽If you kill a nonhuman,

original: dud 'gro'am / mi gzhan 'chi bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni de kho na las /
analyzed: dud 'gro'am / mi gzhan 'chi bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni de kho na las /
translated: an animal, or another human, then in that very context,

original: ltung ba med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ltung ba med pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not a downfall.

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa nyer sbas kyis gang la sbyor ba byas pa de kho na las ltung bar 'gyur bar 'dod kyi gzhan las ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //🔽gsod par sbyor la yi rang bas //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa nyer sbas kyis gang la sbyor ba byas pa de kho na las ltung bar 'gyur bar 'dod kyi gzhan las ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'o // gsod par sbyor la yi rang bas //
translated: Thus, the noble Upaliparipṛcchā declares, “The offense is incurred only in that very context in which you have made the preparation, not in any other.”

original: zhes bya ba yang gang gis gsod na zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yang gang gis gsod na zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
translated: “If you rejoice in killing” is connected to “if you kill.”

original: gang gis gsad pa'i sbyor ba la mngon du yi rang bas gsod par byed na de yang mthar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gis gsad pa'i sbyor ba la mngon du yi rang bas gsod par byed na de yang mthar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If you kill by directly rejoicing in the preparation for killing, then you also incur a root downfall.

original: 'dir gzhung ni nye sde khyod kyis mngal med par byas pa bden nam /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni nye sde khyod kyis mngal med par byas pa bden nam /
translated: Here is the text: “Upāli, is it true that you have caused an abortion?”

original: btsun pa ma lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa ma lags so //
translated: “No, reverend.”

original: 'on kyang bdag gis rjes su yi rang ba bgyis so //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag gis rjes su yi rang ba bgyis so //
translated: “But I have rejoiced in it.”

original: dge slong dag nye sde la ni ltung ba med de /
analyzed: dge slong dag nye sde la ni ltung ba med de /
translated: Monks, Upasena is without offense.

original: yang dge slong gis mngal med par bya ba la rjes su yi rang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gis mngal med par bya ba la rjes su yi rang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Moreover, a monk should not rejoice in an abortion.

original: rjes su yi rang bar byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang bar byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If he rejoices, he becomes guilty of an offense.

original: 'gal chabs zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'das pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: 'gal chabs zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'das pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: The term “guilty of an offense” is a past participle.

original: 'das pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'das pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means “he becomes guilty of an offense together with the past participle.”

original: de'i phyir 'dir lus sam ngag gis rjes su yi rang bar byed na ni mthar 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir lus sam ngag gis rjes su yi rang bar byed na ni mthar 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, if one rejoices with body or speech, one becomes guilty of a serious offense.

original: yid kyis rjes su yi rang bar byed na ni yid kyi bya ba yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyis rjes su yi rang bar byed na ni yid kyi bya ba yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: If one rejoices with the mind, one should understand that it is a mental action.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: gsad par sbyor la /🔽yid kyis yi rang na ni yid kyir 'gyur zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gsad par sbyor la / yid kyis yi rang na ni yid kyir 'gyur zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: if one is engaged in killing,🔽if one rejoices with the mind, it becomes a mental action.

original: yid kyis rjes su yi rang ba byas na yid kyis byas pa'i nyes byas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid kyis rjes su yi rang ba byas na yid kyis byas pa'i nyes byas su 'gyur te /
translated: If one rejoices with the mind, it becomes a mental action.🔽If one rejoices with the body, it becomes a physical action.

original: de bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a mere offense to be restrained from committing it.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nye sde la ni ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nye sde la ni ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: For this reason, it is said that Udayana had no offense,

original: yid kyis dang du len pa'i bdag nyid la ni ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyis dang du len pa'i bdag nyid la ni ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no presentation of offenses for one who accepts it mentally.🔽Similarly, the Vinaya Verses declares:

original: de bzhin du 'dul ba gcig las 'phros pa las kyang ltung ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dul ba gcig las 'phros pa las kyang ltung ba ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two downfalls:

original: lus kyi dang ngag gi'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi dang ngag gi'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: those of body and speech.

original: gtam gyi gzhi las kyang /
analyzed: gtam gyi gzhi las kyang /
translated: And the Basis of Discipline declares:

original: sems las byung ba 'ba' zhig gis ni ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems las byung ba 'ba' zhig gis ni ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: There is no downfall by mere mental action.

original: 'o na ni dge slong ma'i rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: 'o na ni dge slong ma'i rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: But the Bhiksuni Vibhanga declares:🔽A woman whose husband was absent, tormented by affliction, sat with another man.

original: khyim thab mi gnas pa'i bud med cig nyon mongs pas gzir ba na skyes pa gzhan zhig dang lhan cig 'dug pa las dge slong ma khyod kyis mngal med par byas @82b pa bden nam /
analyzed: khyim thab mi gnas pa'i bud med cig nyon mongs pas gzir ba na skyes pa gzhan zhig dang lhan cig 'dug pa las dge slong ma khyod kyis mngal med par byas @82b pa bden nam /
translated: A bhiksuni asked, “Did you make it without a womb?”

original: btsun pa bdag gis mngal ma mchis par ni ma bgyis so //
analyzed: btsun pa bdag gis mngal ma mchis par ni ma bgyis so //
translated: “Noble one, I did not make it so that she was not pregnant.

original: 'on kyang bdag gis dang du ni blangs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag gis dang du ni blangs so //
translated: But I did consent to it.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong ma la bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said to the nun:

original: dge slong mas gnas kyi rnam pa de lta bu la dang du blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas gnas kyi rnam pa de lta bu la dang du blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: “A nun should not consent to such a condition.

original: dang du len par byed na ni nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: dang du len par byed na ni nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba dang 'gal lo //
translated: If she does consent, it is a serious offense.”

original: de lta bas na 'dir gal te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir gal te /
translated: Therefore, in this case,

original: lus dang ngag gi rang bzhin gyi rjes su yi rang ba yin na de'i tshe phas pham pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi rang bzhin gyi rjes su yi rang ba yin na de'i tshe phas pham pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: if it is rejoicing that is of the nature of body and speech, then it would be a defeating offense.

original: 'on te yid kyi rang bzhin na ni de'i tshe yid kyis byas par 'gyur bas nyes pa sbom po'o zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal te /
analyzed: 'on te yid kyi rang bzhin na ni de'i tshe yid kyis byas par 'gyur bas nyes pa sbom po'o zhes gsungs pa dang 'gal te /
translated: But if it is of the nature of mind, then it would be a serious offense committed by the mind.

original: 'dir yid kyi bya ba yin par yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'dir yid kyi bya ba yin par yang mi 'thad de /
translated: But it is not tenable that this is an action of the mind.

original: tshig gis 'grub pa'i don la cang mi smra bas dang du blangs pas 'grub pa'i phyir 'dir pham pa kho na yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: tshig gis 'grub pa'i don la cang mi smra bas dang du blangs pas 'grub pa'i phyir 'dir pham pa kho na yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Since one accepts by remaining silent, the meaning accomplished by words is accomplished. Therefore, here it is only a defeat.

original: de ni 'gal ba med de dang du blangs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni 'gal ba med de dang du blangs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There is no contradiction, because there are two types of acceptance:

original: rang nyid byed par smra ba dang du len pa dang / snang ba gsol ba dang du len pa'o //
analyzed: rang nyid byed par smra ba dang du len pa dang / snang ba gsol ba dang du len pa'o //
translated: acceptance of speaking to do oneself and acceptance of requesting permission.

original: de bas na 'dir de ni rang nyid byed par smra ba la dang du len pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir de ni rang nyid byed par smra ba la dang du len pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, here it is the acceptance of speaking to do oneself,

original: gnang ba gsol ba dang du len pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnang ba gsol ba dang du len pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the acceptance of requesting permission.

original: bsko ba po ma yin pa'i phyir cang mi smra bas dang du len pa go bar byed pa yin du zin kyang 'dir pham par rnam par mi gzhag ste /
analyzed: bsko ba po ma yin pa'i phyir cang mi smra bas dang du len pa go bar byed pa yin du zin kyang 'dir pham par rnam par mi gzhag ste /
translated: Even though one understands acceptance by remaining silent because one is not the one who appoints, it is not posited here as a defeat.

original: sems la de byed pa ni legs na bdag gis ni de mi bya zhing byed du yang mi gzhug go snyam du sems shing /
analyzed: sems la de byed pa ni legs na bdag gis ni de mi bya zhing byed du yang mi gzhug go snyam du sems shing /
translated: One thinks, “If it is good to do that in the mind, I will not do it and I will not allow others to do it.”

original: gal te des byed dam mi byed kyang rung bdag la 'dis ni ci zhig bya snyam du sems pa'i phyir pham par 'gyur ba'i skabs ni med //
analyzed: gal te des byed dam mi byed kyang rung bdag la 'dis ni ci zhig bya snyam du sems pa'i phyir pham par 'gyur ba'i skabs ni med //
translated: Whether or not he does it, what does it matter to me?

original: yid kyis dang du blangs pa yod pa'i phyir yid kyis rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: yid kyis dang du blangs pa yod pa'i phyir yid kyis rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: It is established as mental because it is undertaken mentally.

original: 'gal tshabs can gyi sgra dang nyes pa sdom po'i tshig kyang nyes pa mang po 'phel ba la ni yid kyis bsgrub par bya ba yod do //
analyzed: 'gal tshabs can gyi sgra dang nyes pa sdom po'i tshig kyang nyes pa mang po 'phel ba la ni yid kyis bsgrub par bya ba yod do //
translated: The words “with a word that is a pretext” and “with words that conceal a fault” are established as mental actions because many faults increase.

original: de lta bas na nyes pa mang po'i tshig la 'dir nyes pa sbom po zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na nyes pa mang po'i tshig la 'dir nyes pa sbom po zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, in this case, the words “many faults” are taught as “a grave fault.”

original: de bzhin du sbom po'i sgra gzhan la yang mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbom po'i sgra gzhan la yang mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du brtag par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the word “grave” should be understood in other contexts according to its characteristics.

original: dper na 'dul byed las dge slong yo byad mang po zhig na ba dang / de'i nad g-yog gis shin dge 'dun la nor rdzas bgor yod pas 'di la rim gro mi bya ba'o zhes bsams bsams nas des de'i rim gro ma byas te shi nas de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang /
analyzed: dper na 'dul byed las dge slong yo byad mang po zhig na ba dang / de'i nad g-yog gis shin dge 'dun la nor rdzas bgor yod pas 'di la rim gro mi bya ba'o zhes bsams bsams nas des de'i rim gro ma byas te shi nas de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang /
translated: He died because he was not cared for and he was remorseful.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: pham pa'i ltung ba ni med de /
analyzed: pham pa'i ltung ba ni med de /
translated: “There is no offense entailing expulsion,

original: nyes pa sbom por @83a * //🔽'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por @83a * // 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: but there is a serious offense.”

original: de lta bas na nyes pa sbom po zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam pa gnyis su ston te /
analyzed: de lta bas na nyes pa sbom po zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam pa gnyis su ston te /
translated: Thus the term serious offense is taught to have two types:

original: ming du chags pa'i sgra dang / yon tan gyi sgra'o //
analyzed: ming du chags pa'i sgra dang / yon tan gyi sgra'o //
translated: the term serious offense that is a designation and the term serious offense that is a quality.

original: de la ming du chags pa'i sgra ni nyes pa chung ngu zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la ming du chags pa'i sgra ni nyes pa chung ngu zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Among them, the term serious offense that is a designation is a minor offense.

original: yon tan gyi sgra ni nyes pa mang po zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yon tan gyi sgra ni nyes pa mang po zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The term serious offense that is a quality is a multiple offense.

original: 'o na rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: Well then, the Exposition declares:

original: nyes pa sbom po ni gnyis te pham pa las byung ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma las byung ba'o zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa sbom po ni gnyis te pham pa las byung ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma las byung ba'o zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: There are two kinds of grave offenses: those that arise from the defeating offenses and those that arise from the residual faults.

original: de ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de ni nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault here.

original: nyes pa sbom po gnyis chung ba'i tshig yin par dgongs pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bzhin bdag nyid dud 'gror mthun pa yi //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom po gnyis chung ba'i tshig yin par dgongs pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin bdag nyid dud 'gror mthun pa yi //
translated: The two kinds of grave offenses are considered to be minor offenses.🔽If one kills sentient beings

original: gzugs su bsgyur nas sems can gsod byed la //
analyzed: gzugs su bsgyur nas sems can gsod byed la //
translated: while in the form of an animal,

original: sdom brtson sdom brtson nyid du 'du shes na //
analyzed: sdom brtson sdom brtson nyid du 'du shes na //
translated: and one is a fully ordained monk,

original: dngos gzhi'o min na ltung ba chung dang ldan //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'o min na ltung ba chung dang ldan //
translated: one commits a basic transgression.

original: bdag nyid smin la sogs pas stag la sogs pa'i gzugs gang yin par bsgyur te /🔽mi gsod par byed la /
analyzed: bdag nyid smin la sogs pas stag la sogs pa'i gzugs gang yin par bsgyur te / mi gsod par byed la /
translated: If one kills sentient beings while in the form of a tiger and so on,🔽if one is a fully ordained monk, one commits a basic transgression.

original: gal te bdag dge tshul yin na bya ba ma yin pa zhig byed do snyam du dge slong gi 'du shes byung na de mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bdag dge tshul yin na bya ba ma yin pa zhig byed do snyam du dge slong gi 'du shes byung na de mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one thinks, “I am a novice monk and I am doing what should not be done,” and one has the perception of being a fully ordained monk, then one commits a basic transgression.

original: gal te ma yin na ltung ba chung ngu kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ma yin na ltung ba chung ngu kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is not a fully ordained monk, one commits only a minor offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /
translated: Here the treatise Atthasālinī says:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis bdag nyid dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gyur par bsgyur te /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis bdag nyid dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gyur par bsgyur te /
translated: If a monk transforms himself into an animal and

original: mi'i srog dang phral na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: mi'i srog dang phral na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: kills a human, what is the offense?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: gal te bdag ni dge slong yin na bya ba ma yin pa byed do snyam du dge slong gi 'du shes byung na mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bdag ni dge slong yin na bya ba ma yin pa byed do snyam du dge slong gi 'du shes byung na mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he thinks, “I am a monk, but I am doing what should not be done,” and he has the perception of being a monk, he commits a serious offense.

original: gal te dge slong gi 'du shes ma byung na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te dge slong gi 'du shes ma byung na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If he does not have the perception of being a monk, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'dir gzhung yang /🔽rmi lam bslab pa med dam gsad pa yi //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung yang / rmi lam bslab pa med dam gsad pa yi //
translated: The text also says:

original: bsam pa med dam smyos pas gal te gsod //
analyzed: bsam pa med dam smyos pas gal te gsod //
translated: If one kills in a dream, if one is without training, if one is without the intention to kill, or if one kills while insane,

original: de ni ltung bar mi 'gyur bsdam bya yin //
analyzed: de ni ltung bar mi 'gyur bsdam bya yin //
translated: that is not a downfall, but one should restrain oneself.

original: gsod pa'i yan lag lhag ma ma tshang na //
analyzed: gsod pa'i yan lag lhag ma ma tshang na //
translated: If the remaining limbs of killing are incomplete,

original: ltung chung / rmi lam ma yin pa nyid dang / bslab pa ma btang ba nyid dang / gsad pa'i bsam pa nyid dang / rang bzhin du gnas pa nyid ces bya ba bzhi po 'di rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig ma tshang na ltung ba med de bsdam par bya bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltung chung / rmi lam ma yin pa nyid dang / bslab pa ma btang ba nyid dang / gsad pa'i bsam pa nyid dang / rang bzhin du gnas pa nyid ces bya ba bzhi po 'di rnams las gang yang rung ba zhig ma tshang na ltung ba med de bsdam par bya bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If any of these four are incomplete—it is not a dream, the training has not been relinquished, there is no intention to kill, or it is not natural—then there is no downfall, and it is not a downfall that must be restrained.

original: yan lag lhag ma drug po dag /'di lta ste /
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma drug po dag /'di lta ste /
translated: The remaining six branches are🔽human,🔽other,🔽perception of that,🔽non-error,🔽application,🔽and death.

original: mi nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / der 'du shes pa nyid dang / ma nor ba nyid dang / sbyor ba nyid dang / shi ba nyid de gsod pa'i yan lag drug po de rnams las gcig cig med na yang @83b ltung ba chung ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: mi nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / der 'du shes pa nyid dang / ma nor ba nyid dang / sbyor ba nyid dang / shi ba nyid de gsod pa'i yan lag drug po de rnams las gcig cig med na yang @83b ltung ba chung ba kho na yin te /
translated: If any one of these six branches of killing is absent, it is a minor downfall.

original: yan lag thams cad 'dus na ni rdzogs pa yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: yan lag thams cad 'dus na ni rdzogs pa yin no zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
translated: If all the branches are complete, it is a complete downfall.

original: kha cig na re gsod pa'i yan lag rnams su ni the tshom med pa nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gis kha bskang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re gsod pa'i yan lag rnams su ni the tshom med pa nyid ces bya ba'i tshig gis kha bskang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Some say: The words without doubt in the branch of killing should be added.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /🔽btsun pa dge slong gis 'di bdag gi yin nam ma yin snyam du the tshom 'tshal ba las de yang ma lags la /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las / btsun pa dge slong gis 'di bdag gi yin nam ma yin snyam du the tshom 'tshal ba las de yang ma lags la /
translated: Here the text of the questions of Guptakaukrtya states:

original: de la gsod par bgyid na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: de la gsod par bgyid na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “Venerable! If a monk thinks, ‘Is this mine or not?’ and then kills it, what is the offense?”

original: bka' stsal pa /🔽ltung ba sbom por 'gyur te /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa / ltung ba sbom por 'gyur te /
translated: The Buddha said:

original: mtshams med par ni mi 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mtshams med par ni mi 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no zhe na /
translated: “It is a serious downfall, but it is not a heinous act.”

original: tshig gi kha bskang bar mi bya ste /🔽'di ltar gsad par bya ba'am /
analyzed: tshig gi kha bskang bar mi bya ste / 'di ltar gsad par bya ba'am /
translated: The words should not be added because🔽if one thinks, “I will kill it” or “I will not kill it,”

original: gsad par mi bya snyam pa'i bsam pa sngar yod kyang gsod pa'i tshe gdon mi za bar su yin pa zhes nges pa skye'o //
analyzed: gsad par mi bya snyam pa'i bsam pa sngar yod kyang gsod pa'i tshe gdon mi za bar su yin pa zhes nges pa skye'o //
translated: then at the time of killing, one definitely generates the ascertainment, “This is it.”

original: de lta ma yin na bsad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na bsad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then it would not be killing.

original: las thams cad la gdon mi za bar 'jug pa'i sems pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: las thams cad la gdon mi za bar 'jug pa'i sems pa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of intention that definitely engage in all action.

original: dpyod pa dang / nges pa dang / g-yo bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa dang / nges pa dang / g-yo bar byed pa'o //
translated: and the determination, and the movement.

original: re zhig thog mar ni ci bya'am 'on te mi bya snyam du dpyod pa skye'o //
analyzed: re zhig thog mar ni ci bya'am 'on te mi bya snyam du dpyod pa skye'o //
translated: First of all, the doubt arises: “What should I do? Or should I not do it?”

original: de nas bya'o zhes nges pa skye'o //
analyzed: de nas bya'o zhes nges pa skye'o //
translated: Then the determination arises: “I will do it.”

original: de nas g-yo bar byed pa skye ste /
analyzed: de nas g-yo bar byed pa skye ste /
translated: Then the movement arises.

original: des ni lus g-yo bar byed do //
analyzed: des ni lus g-yo bar byed do //
translated: By that, the body moves.

original: de bas na don de ni drang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na don de ni drang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, that meaning should be interpreted.

original: 'di ltar drang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar drang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: It should be interpreted in this way:

original: gsad par bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis dngos gzhi'i las kyi lam dang / las kyi lam gyi sbyor ba bstan to //
analyzed: gsad par bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis dngos gzhi'i las kyi lam dang / las kyi lam gyi sbyor ba bstan to //
translated: By this, “he should be killed,” the actual course of action and the preparation for the course of action are taught.

original: de lta bas na 'dir las kyi lam gyi sbyor ba'i dbang du mdzad nas zhus pa las ltung ba sbom por 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir las kyi lam gyi sbyor ba'i dbang du mdzad nas zhus pa las ltung ba sbom por 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, here, with reference to the preparation for the course of action, it is said in the answer, “It is a grave offense, but it is not a heinous act.”

original: mtshams med par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i lan rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshams med par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i lan rigs pa yin no //
translated: That is the correct answer.

original: de ltar byas na 'dul byed kyi gzhung las btsun pa dge slong gis ma bsad dam mi gsad snyam du the tshom 'tshal ba las de la 'gums par bgyid na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: de ltar byas na 'dul byed kyi gzhung las btsun pa dge slong gis ma bsad dam mi gsad snyam du the tshom 'tshal ba las de la 'gums par bgyid na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “Venerable monks, if one is in doubt, thinking ‘Has this monk killed his mother or not?’ and he kills her, what is the consequence?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said:

original: pham par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba dang yang mi 'gal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba dang yang mi 'gal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: “It is a defeating offense.”

original: 'dir gsod pa'i sgras ni dngos gzhi'i las kyi lam bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir gsod pa'i sgras ni dngos gzhi'i las kyi lam bstan to //
translated: Here, the term “kill” teaches the actual karmic path.

original: 'o na yang las dang po pa ma yin pa yang smos par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na yang las dang po pa ma yin pa yang smos par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But it should be stated that it is not for beginners.

original: smos par mi bya ste /
analyzed: smos par mi bya ste /
translated: It should not be stated

original: da ltar las dang po ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar las dang po ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for a beginner to do this.

original: 'o na lta zhig de'i tshe yang las dang po ba mi srid pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'o na lta zhig de'i tshe yang las dang po ba mi srid pa nyid yin te /
translated: But at that time, it is impossible for a beginner to do this.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni byang chub kyi shing drung du tho rangs nyon mongs pa'i bdud btul nas tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin @84a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni byang chub kyi shing drung du tho rangs nyon mongs pa'i bdud btul nas tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin @84a * //
translated: The Bhagavān, having subdued the demon of afflictions at dawn under the Bodhi tree, attained the three knowledges and six superknowledges.

original: dang shes rab kyi phung po gsum tshang bar bcas pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa las kyang /
analyzed: dang shes rab kyi phung po gsum tshang bar bcas pa dang / rnam par 'byed pa las kyang /
translated: and the three aggregates of ethics, meditative stabilization and wisdom are complete.🔽Also, the Analysis of Discipline states:

original: da ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis so sor thar pa bstan to zhes gsungs pas she na /
analyzed: da ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis so sor thar pa bstan to zhes gsungs pas she na /
translated: The Bhagavan taught the pratimoksa in two verses.🔽Arya Sthiramati states:

original: 'phags pa nyer sbas kyi zhal nas chad pa bca' ba las dgongs nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyer sbas kyi zhal nas chad pa bca' ba las dgongs nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: This was stated with the intention of the stages of the treatise.

original: chad pa bca' ba'i rim pa'i ngo bo kho na yin pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: chad pa bca' ba'i rim pa'i ngo bo kho na yin pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: This is because it is the nature of the stages of the treatise.

original: dge tshul gyi bslab pa'i rim pa las bzlog nas 'dul ba las rim pa gzhan du bstan to //
analyzed: dge tshul gyi bslab pa'i rim pa las bzlog nas 'dul ba las rim pa gzhan du bstan to //
translated: The stages of training of novices are taught in a different order in the Vinaya than in the stages of training of novices.

original: gsod pa las byung ba'i lhag ma med pa'i ltung ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: gsod pa las byung ba'i lhag ma med pa'i ltung ba bshad zin to //
translated: The residual offenses that arise from killing have been explained.

original: lhag ma dang bcas pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: lhag ma dang bcas pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: I will now explain the remaining offenses.

original: de bshad pa /🔽'khrul med srog chags gsad bsams pas //
analyzed: de bshad pa / 'khrul med srog chags gsad bsams pas //
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:

original: rigs gzhan gsad pa las ni nyes byas 'gyur //🔽ma brtags pa yi chu bum brnyas pa las //
analyzed: rigs gzhan gsad pa las ni nyes byas 'gyur //🔽ma brtags pa yi chu bum brnyas pa las //
translated: If one intentionally kills a being of a different type, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one intentionally kills a being of the same type, one commits a heinous offense.

original: sbyin par gyur kyang nyes pa med pa yin //
analyzed: sbyin par gyur kyang nyes pa med pa yin //
translated: But there is no fault if one gives.

original: de kho na yin gyi 'dra bar ma 'khrul pa dang / gsang ba'i bsam pa kho nas mi'i rigs las rigs gzhan te /
analyzed: de kho na yin gyi 'dra bar ma 'khrul pa dang / gsang ba'i bsam pa kho nas mi'i rigs las rigs gzhan te /
translated: It is only the real thing, not a substitute, and one is not mistaken about it; it is only with a hidden intention; and it is only to a human, not to another kind of being,

original: dud 'gro dang yi dags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dud 'gro dang yi dags la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as an animal or ghost.

original: de la srog chags kyi blos mi ma yin pa bsad na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //🔽de ltar na 'khrul pa med pa dang / bsad pa'i bsam pa dang / rigs gzhan nyid dang / srog chags su 'du shes pa nyid dang / gsad pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la srog chags kyi blos mi ma yin pa bsad na nyes byas su 'gyur ro // de ltar na 'khrul pa med pa dang / bsad pa'i bsam pa dang / rigs gzhan nyid dang / srog chags su 'du shes pa nyid dang / gsad pa nyid de /
translated: If one kills a non-human with the idea that it is a living being, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽Thus, there are five branches of an offense of wrong conduct: not being mistaken, the intention to kill, another kind of being, the perception that it is a living being, and the killing itself.

original: nyes byas kyi yan lag ni lnga po 'di dag yin no //
analyzed: nyes byas kyi yan lag ni lnga po 'di dag yin no //
translated: When these are complete, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gang na de dag med pa de na ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gang na de dag med pa de na ni ltung ba med do //
translated: When they are not complete, there is no offense.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ma brtags pa'i chu'i bum pa slong ba dag la byin na yang 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ma brtags pa'i chu'i bum pa slong ba dag la byin na yang 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not contradictory to give a pot of water that has not been examined to those who ask for it.

original: nyes byas kyi yan lag rnams tshang na ji ltar rigs par ltung bar 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyes byas kyi yan lag rnams tshang na ji ltar rigs par ltung bar 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: When the branches of an offense of wrong conduct are complete, it should be understood that it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gang gis srog chags bcas chu la sogs spyod //
analyzed: gang gis srog chags bcas chu la sogs spyod //
translated: One who uses water containing living beings

original: yang na chu tshan la sogs ldugs byed la //🔽bltar yod skye bo shi na de la ni //
analyzed: yang na chu tshan la sogs ldugs byed la // bltar yod skye bo shi na de la ni //
translated: or pours hot water on the ground🔽commits an offense for each living being

original: srog chags re re'i ltung ba lci ba 'byung //
analyzed: srog chags re re'i ltung ba lci ba 'byung //
translated: when they die.

original: gang gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu dang rtsa ba mo la sogs pa spyod dam /
analyzed: gang gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu dang rtsa ba mo la sogs pa spyod dam /
translated: If one uses water containing living beings or roots, etc.,

original: khu ba tsha ba la sogs pa dag ldugs par byed na sdom brtson de la ni srog chags re re ste srog chags mig gis gzung du yod pa de dag ji snyed shi na de snyed kho na'i nyes byas ngag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khu ba tsha ba la sogs pa dag ldugs par byed na sdom brtson de la ni srog chags re re ste srog chags mig gis gzung du yod pa de dag ji snyed shi na de snyed kho na'i nyes byas ngag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: or pours hot water on the ground, then for each living being, as many as are seen by the eye, that dies, the diligent one commits as many offenses of wrong conduct.

original: zhus pa las /
analyzed: zhus pa las /
translated: The Questions of Revata states:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i chab gzhag ste srog chags dang bcas pa gzhan dag spyod @84b par bgyid na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis srog chags dang bcas pa'i chab gzhag ste srog chags dang bcas pa gzhan dag spyod @84b par bgyid na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “If a monk uses water containing living beings and pours it on the ground, what is the offense?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He replied:🔽“If he uses it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: srog chags ji snyed srog dang bral ba de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: srog chags ji snyed srog dang bral ba de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
translated: As many living beings die as a result of that action, there are that many offenses.

original: rnam par 'byed pa las kyang /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa las kyang /
translated: The Vinaya Verses also states:

original: srog chags dang bcas pa'i yur ba pho na /
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa'i yur ba pho na /
translated: If a canal is filled with living beings,

original: srog chags ji snyed shi ba de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur la /
analyzed: srog chags ji snyed shi ba de snyed kyi ltung byed du 'gyur la /
translated: there are as many offenses as there are living beings that die.

original: srog chags ji snyed pa dus ma byas pa de snyed kyi ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: srog chags ji snyed pa dus ma byas pa de snyed kyi ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If living beings are not killed, there are as many offenses of wrong conduct.

original: ltung ba de dag lci ba ni srog chags gsod pa ni kha na ma thob dang bcas pa chen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltung ba de dag lci ba ni srog chags gsod pa ni kha na ma thob dang bcas pa chen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These offenses are serious because killing living beings is a great offense.

original: bltar yod ces bya ba 'di ga las 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: bltar yod ces bya ba 'di ga las 'byung zhe na /
translated: What is the source of the term “visible”?

original: phran tshegs las /🔽btsun pa chab btsags pa ma brtags par 'tshal du rung ngam nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
analyzed: phran tshegs las / btsun pa chab btsags pa ma brtags par 'tshal du rung ngam nye ba 'khor mi rung ngo //
translated: The Kṣudraka Collection states:🔽“Lord, is it proper to drink water that has not been filtered and not examined?

original: btsun pa ma btsags pa brtags na 'tshal du rung ngam /
analyzed: btsun pa ma btsags pa brtags na 'tshal du rung ngam /
translated: Upāli, it is not proper.🔽Lord, is it proper to drink water that has not been filtered but has been examined?

original: nye ba 'khor rung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor rung ngo zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: But, Upali, it is proper to rely on what is seen.

original: 'di ltar yod pa kho na la brten par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa kho na la brten par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For one relies on what exists.

original: yang ci'i phyir bltar yod pa kho na la brten par bya'i /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir bltar yod pa kho na la brten par bya'i /
translated: Why rely on what is seen,

original: chu tshags la ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: chu tshags la ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: and not on a water strainer?

original: srog chags phra mo kha cig bltar yod du zin kyang chu tshags kyis gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog chags phra mo kha cig bltar yod du zin kyang chu tshags kyis gzung du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because some small living beings are seen but not caught in the strainer.

original: de bzhin du rnam par 'byed pa las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par 'byed pa las kyang /
translated: So too, the Exposition declares:

original: srog chags dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: srog chags dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: “Living beings are of two kinds:

original: gang dag mig la snang bar 'gyur ba dang / gang dag chags kyis gzung du yod pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag mig la snang bar 'gyur ba dang / gang dag chags kyis gzung du yod pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: those that are seen by the eye and those that are caught by the strainer.”

original: de lta bas na mthong ba kho na la brten pa yin gyi tshags la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mthong ba kho na la brten pa yin gyi tshags la ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, one relies on what is seen, not on the strainer.

original: tha mal pa yi mig ni nad med pas //
analyzed: tha mal pa yi mig ni nad med pas //
translated: The eye of the ordinary person is not free from error.🔽One should examine the water, not moving, not disturbed,

original: chu mi g-yo zhing rnyog pa med la brtag / bum pa gang ba brtag bya ka ta ka / rnams kyis chu rdul can dag dang bar bya //
analyzed: chu mi g-yo zhing rnyog pa med la brtag / bum pa gang ba brtag bya ka ta ka / rnams kyis chu rdul can dag dang bar bya //
translated: and the vessel, the water strainer, with its many holes,🔽to remove the living beings that are in the water.

original: sha'i mig nyid rab rib la sogs pas nyams par ma gyur pas chu mi g-yo zhing rnyog pa med pa la brtag par bya'i lha'i mig gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sha'i mig nyid rab rib la sogs pas nyams par ma gyur pas chu mi g-yo zhing rnyog pa med pa la brtag par bya'i lha'i mig gis ni ma yin no //
translated: The fleshly eye is impaired by cataracts and so on, but the divine eye is not impaired.

original: 'dir gzhung ni phran tshegs las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni phran tshegs las /
translated: The text of the Kṣudraka Collection says:

original: tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas /
translated: The Venerable Aniruddha🔽examined the water with his divine eye and saw that it was filled with intermediate beings who were to be born as animals.

original: lha'i mig gis chu brtags na de na srid pa bar ma ngo ba'i srog chags rnams kyis gang ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis chu brtags na de na srid pa bar ma ngo ba'i srog chags rnams kyis gang ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: lha'i mig ni tha snyad du brjod du med pas de'i phyir lha'i mig gis chu brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i mig ni tha snyad du brjod du med pas de'i phyir lha'i mig gis chu brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: “The divine eye is inexpressible in conventional terms. Therefore, do not examine the water with the divine eye.”

original: zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The text continues up to this point.

original: snod gang du brtag par bya ba de ni don gyis smos par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snod gang du brtag par bya ba de ni don gyis smos par rig par bya'o //
translated: The water that is to be examined is to be understood as referring to the water that is to be filled.

original: bum pa dag la khyad par yod de /
analyzed: bum pa dag la khyad par yod de /
translated: There is a difference between filled and unfilled pots.

original: de ni gang la kho na la brtag par bya'i ma gang bar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni gang la kho na la brtag par bya'i ma gang bar ni ma yin no //
translated: The water is to be examined in the filled pot, not in the unfilled one.

original: phran tshigs las kyang /
analyzed: phran tshigs las kyang /
translated: The Kṣudraka Collection says:

original: de dag bum pa ma @85a * //
analyzed: de dag bum pa ma @85a * //
translated: “Those who are filled with pots

original: gang ba la rtog par byed pa na srog chags rnams mi rtogs so //
analyzed: gang ba la rtog par byed pa na srog chags rnams mi rtogs so //
translated: When it is full, he should stop.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: bum pa gang ba la brtag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bum pa gang ba la brtag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “One should examine the water pot when it is full.”

original: gal te chu de rdul can yin na shing tog ka ta ka la sogs pas dang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te chu de rdul can yin na shing tog ka ta ka la sogs pas dang bar bya'o //
translated: If the water is turbid, it should be made clear with the fruit of the kataka tree, etc.

original: ka ta ka rnams kyis zhes mang po'i tshig tu smos pa ni nas phye'i zan 'bru mar gyis bskus pa la sogs pa bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ka ta ka rnams kyis zhes mang po'i tshig tu smos pa ni nas phye'i zan 'bru mar gyis bskus pa la sogs pa bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The plural form “kataka fruits” is used to include barley flour, etc.

original: ji srid 'di la yid ni dag gyur na //🔽de srid brtag bya ring min thung ngu min //
analyzed: ji srid 'di la yid ni dag gyur na // de srid brtag bya ring min thung ngu min //
translated: As long as the mind is clear,🔽one should examine the breath, neither too long nor too short.

original: steng du'ang de bzhin yang dang yang du min //
analyzed: steng du'ang de bzhin yang dang yang du min //
translated: Nor too high, nor repeatedly,

original: glo bur pa yis srog chags bcas te min //
analyzed: glo bur pa yis srog chags bcas te min //
translated: nor with a living being in it, nor suddenly.

original: dus ji srid du sems dag par 'gyur ba'i dus de srid du brtag par bya'i yun ring du yang ma yin la /
analyzed: dus ji srid du sems dag par 'gyur ba'i dus de srid du brtag par bya'i yun ring du yang ma yin la /
translated: For as long as the mind is clear, for that long one should examine the breath.

original: yun thung ngu yang ma yin zhing yang dang yang du brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yun thung ngu yang ma yin zhing yang dang yang du brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: But not for too long a time, nor for too short a time.🔽And one should not examine the breath repeatedly.

original: steng du yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: steng du yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same holds for the upper part.

original: sbrang bu dang sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pa gang dag chu'i steng na 'khyam pa de dag ni chu na gnas pa ma yin pas de dag bsal te /🔽de dag dang mthun pa'i gnas su gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: sbrang bu dang sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pa gang dag chu'i steng na 'khyam pa de dag ni chu na gnas pa ma yin pas de dag bsal te / de dag dang mthun pa'i gnas su gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The insects that move on the surface of the water, mosquitoes, etc. , are not considered to be in the water; they are placed in the category of those that live on land.

original: grog sbur la sogs pa glo bur bas kyang chu de srog chags dang bcas pa yin par mi brtsi'o //
analyzed: grog sbur la sogs pa glo bur bas kyang chu de srog chags dang bcas pa yin par mi brtsi'o //
translated: The water is considered to be “with living beings” when these insects are there.

original: de bzhin khron pa dag dang chu ra'i chu //🔽lan cig brtags nas nyi ma shar bar du //
analyzed: de bzhin khron pa dag dang chu ra'i chu // lan cig brtags nas nyi ma shar bar du //
translated: The same for the water in wells and water pipes.

original: the tshom med par spyad par rung ba yin //
analyzed: the tshom med par spyad par rung ba yin //
translated: As long as the sun does not rise, one can drink this water without committing a transgression.

original: de yi nyen 'khor 'dom gang 'khor yug go //
analyzed: de yi nyen 'khor 'dom gang 'khor yug go //
translated: The water is considered to be “with living beings” when the smallest crustaceans live in it.🔽The water is considered to be “with living beings” when the smallest crustaceans live in it.

original: khron pa dang bum pa la sogs pa'i chu lan cig brtags pa ni ji srid du phyi de nyin par gyi nyi ma shar ba'i bar de srid du the tshom med par spyad par bya bar rung ba yin no //🔽de phyin chad ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: khron pa dang bum pa la sogs pa'i chu lan cig brtags pa ni ji srid du phyi de nyin par gyi nyi ma shar ba'i bar de srid du the tshom med par spyad par bya bar rung ba yin no //🔽de phyin chad ni mi rung ngo //
translated: The water is considered to be “with living beings” when the smallest crustaceans live in it.

original: chu'i cha brtag pa'i nye 'khor ni 'dom gang 'khor yug yin par bshad do /
analyzed: chu'i cha brtag pa'i nye 'khor ni 'dom gang 'khor yug yin par bshad do /
translated: It is explained that the area to be examined for water is one fathom in all directions.

original: khron pa sogs gtsang chu tshags dam la sogs //
analyzed: khron pa sogs gtsang chu tshags dam la sogs //
translated: A well, etc., is suitable if it is covered and so on.

original: dge slong dge 'dun de bzhin yid ches pas /
analyzed: dge slong dge 'dun de bzhin yid ches pas /
translated: If a monk, a saṅgha, or a person is trustworthy,

original: lnga char rung ba'i chu yin blang bar bya //
analyzed: lnga char rung ba'i chu yin blang bar bya //
translated: any of the five kinds of water is suitable to drink.

original: chu tshags med pa dag tu mi bya'o //🔽chu blang bar rung ba ni lngar bsten te /
analyzed: chu tshags med pa dag tu mi bya'o // chu blang bar rung ba ni lngar bsten te /
translated: But do not use water that is not filtered.🔽There are five kinds of water that are suitable to drink:

original: khron pas rung ba dang ste /
analyzed: khron pas rung ba dang ste /
translated: Water from a well is suitable if it is covered

original: brtags pas gtsang ba'o //
analyzed: brtags pas gtsang ba'o //
translated: and if it is clean after being examined.

original: chu tshags kyis rung ba dang ste chu tshags dam po ni srog chags 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu tshags kyis rung ba dang ste chu tshags dam po ni srog chags 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Water that is suitable because of a filter is water that is filtered with a fine cloth, because it prevents the killing of living beings.

original: dge slong gis rung ba dang ste /
analyzed: dge slong gis rung ba dang ste /
translated: Water that is suitable because of a monk is water that is suitable for a monk.

original: 'di ni bslab pa 'dod pa'o zhes de la yid ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni bslab pa 'dod pa'o zhes de la yid ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he is trustworthy, since he is one who desires the training.

original: dge 'dun gyis rung ba dang ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis rung ba dang ste /
translated: Water that is suitable because of a saṅgha is water that is suitable for a saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun ni chu ma btsags par mi spyod pa'i phyir ro //🔽yid ches pas rung ba ni bkod ma'i rung ba dang ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun ni chu ma btsags par mi spyod pa'i phyir ro // yid ches pas rung ba ni bkod ma'i rung ba dang ste /
translated: This is because a saṅgha does not use water that has not been filtered.🔽Water that is suitable because of trust is water that is suitable for a spring.

original: bkod ma @85b ni chu mig ces bya ste /
analyzed: bkod ma @85b ni chu mig ces bya ste /
translated: A spring is a water source.

original: de la srog chags med do snyam du yid ches pa'i dbang gis so //🔽nyin zhag gcig rung ba yang yid ches pas rung ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la srog chags med do snyam du yid ches pa'i dbang gis so // nyin zhag gcig rung ba yang yid ches pas rung ba nyid yin te /
translated: It is suitable for one day because it is suitable through confidence.🔽It is suitable for one day because it is suitable through confidence.

original: brtags pa ni srog chags med do snyam du yid ches pa 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: brtags pa ni srog chags med do snyam du yid ches pa 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is suitable for one day because it is suitable through confidence.

original: de ni sngar nyi ma shar gyi bar du zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
analyzed: de ni sngar nyi ma shar gyi bar du zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
translated: This is indicated by the earlier statement, “until sunrise.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni chu rung ba ni lnga dag ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni chu rung ba ni lnga dag ste /
translated: Here the text is: “The five kinds of suitable water are:🔽suitable by a well, suitable by a water strainer, suitable by a monk, suitable by the Saṅgha, and suitable for one day.”

original: khron pas rung ba dang / chu tshags kyis rung ba dang / dge slong gis rung ba dang dge 'dun gyis rung ba dang / nyin zhag gcig rung ba dang zhes bya ba dang / 'dir yang gzhung phran tshegs las /
analyzed: khron pas rung ba dang / chu tshags kyis rung ba dang / dge slong gis rung ba dang dge 'dun gyis rung ba dang / nyin zhag gcig rung ba dang zhes bya ba dang / 'dir yang gzhung phran tshegs las /
translated: And here the Kṣudraka-vinaya teaches:

original: lnga pa bkod ma'i rung ba'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lnga pa bkod ma'i rung ba'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: “The fifth is suitable by a water container.”

original: chu tshags dang bral ba nyid du na ma yang mi bya'o /
analyzed: chu tshags dang bral ba nyid du na ma yang mi bya'o /
translated: One should not be without a water strainer.

original: // / bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: // / bam po gnyis pa /
translated: Here is the second chapter on the water strainer.

original: gang zhig chu tshags ril tshags gru gsum dang // sbyangs tshags ril ba zhabs tshags can dag gam //
analyzed: gang zhig chu tshags ril tshags gru gsum dang // sbyangs tshags ril ba zhabs tshags can dag gam //
translated: “Those who have a water-pot, a round container, a triangular one,🔽A water-purifying gem, or a cup with a stand,

original: bsal chags dag kyang bor te 'gro byed na //
analyzed: bsal chags dag kyang bor te 'gro byed na //
translated: If one goes away having left behind a water-pot, a water-sistrum, a triangular water-filter, a water-strainer, or a water-pitcher,

original: de la yid kyis bya ba'i nyes byas 'gyur //
analyzed: de la yid kyis bya ba'i nyes byas 'gyur //
translated: then one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: tha na chu tshags gcig tsam yang khyer te 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: tha na chu tshags gcig tsam yang khyer te 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: One should go taking even a single water-pot.

original: dge tshul gang zhig chu tshags mkhyer bar 'gro na de la bsdam par bya ba'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge tshul gang zhig chu tshags mkhyer bar 'gro na de la bsdam par bya ba'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a novice goes without taking a water-pot, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: chu tshags kyang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: chu tshags kyang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five kinds of water-pots:

original: de la chu tshags ril tshags ni zlum po kha gnyis pa'o //🔽gru gsum ni grva gru gsum yod pa'o //🔽sbyangs tshags zhes bya ba ni chu tshags yu ba yod pa'o//
analyzed: de la chu tshags ril tshags ni zlum po kha gnyis pa'o // gru gsum ni grva gru gsum yod pa'o // sbyangs tshags zhes bya ba ni chu tshags yu ba yod pa'o//
translated: A water-pot with a round body and two openings is called a water-pot.🔽A water-pot with three corners is called a triangular water-filter.🔽A water-pot with a handle is called a water-strainer.

original: ril ba zhabs tshags can ni ril ba'i zhabs su tshags byas pa'o //
analyzed: ril ba zhabs tshags can ni ril ba'i zhabs su tshags byas pa'o //
translated: A water-pot with a spout is called a water-pitcher.

original: bsal tshags ni gos kyi dum bu'o //
analyzed: bsal tshags ni gos kyi dum bu'o //
translated: A piece of cloth is called a water-filter.

original: ming gsum po ni gos kyi tha ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ming gsum po ni gos kyi tha ma zhes bya ste /
translated: These three names are for the last of the robes.

original: gos kyi tha ma nyid kyis ni bum tshags gce 'u can yang bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gos kyi tha ma nyid kyis ni bum tshags gce 'u can yang bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The last of the garments is the water-pot, which is also mentioned.

original: gal te song na bsal tshags la sogs yod //
analyzed: gal te song na bsal tshags la sogs yod //
translated: If he goes, he should take the water-pot, etc.

original: de tshe rgyang grags lngar ni chu tshags dag / med par 'gro bya gal te med na yang //
analyzed: de tshe rgyang grags lngar ni chu tshags dag / med par 'gro bya gal te med na yang //
translated: If he goes five hundred bow-lengths without the water-pot,

original: de slar 'ong 'dod dpag tshad phyed 'gro bya //
analyzed: de slar 'ong 'dod dpag tshad phyed 'gro bya //
translated: he may return if he wishes, but not beyond half a league.

original: gal te der song na chu tshags rnyed na de'i tshe rgyang grags lnga kho nar 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te der song na chu tshags rnyed na de'i tshe rgyang grags lnga kho nar 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: If he goes there and finds the water-pot, then he should go five hundred bow-lengths,

original: de las phan chad du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de las phan chad du ni ma yin no //
translated: but not beyond that.

original: ji ste ji snyed kyang de'i tshe bya ba de lta bu zhig yod na brtul zhugs can des de ma thag tu slar 'ong ba'i bsam pas dpag tshad phyed kho nar 'gro bar bya'i de phan chad du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ste ji snyed kyang de'i tshe bya ba de lta bu zhig yod na brtul zhugs can des de ma thag tu slar 'ong ba'i bsam pas dpag tshad phyed kho nar 'gro bar bya'i de phan chad du ni ma yin no //
translated: If he goes that far and there is still no water-pot, then the ascetic should return immediately with the intention of returning, but not beyond half a league.

original: gcugs pa rnams kyi tshig gis lam ring du //
analyzed: gcugs pa rnams kyi tshig gis lam ring du //
translated: Even if he goes a long distance on the word of a friend,

original: song du zin yang nam yang nyes pa med //
analyzed: song du zin yang nam yang nyes pa med //
translated: he is never at fault.

original: chu po'i 'gram nas 'gro bar byed pa na //
analyzed: chu po'i 'gram nas 'gro bar byed pa na //
translated: When he goes to the bank of a river,

original: mthong bas dag pa'i chu 'thungs nyes pa med //🔽ji ste 'grogs bshes @86a * //
analyzed: mthong bas dag pa'i chu 'thungs nyes pa med // ji ste 'grogs bshes @86a * //
translated: If you drink water that is purified by seeing, there is no fault.🔽If a friend says, “I will give you a water filter,”

original: na re kho bos khyod la chu tshags sbyin no zhes zer na de'i tshig gis ring du song yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: na re kho bos khyod la chu tshags sbyin no zhes zer na de'i tshig gis ring du song yang nyes pa med do //
translated: there is no fault if you go a long distance because of his words.

original: gzhan yang chu klung gi 'gram nas 'gro ba na mthong bas dag par 'gyur ba'i chu la spyod na chu tshags med na yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan yang chu klung gi 'gram nas 'gro ba na mthong bas dag par 'gyur ba'i chu la spyod na chu tshags med na yang nyes pa med do //
translated: Moreover, if you are traveling along a riverbank and use water that is purified by seeing, there is no fault if you do not have a water filter.

original: rgyun gyis 'bab pa'i chu rgyun ma 'dres pa //
analyzed: rgyun gyis 'bab pa'i chu rgyun ma 'dres pa //
translated: If the water is flowing in a stream that is not mixed with other water,🔽you should examine the water every furlong,

original: der ni rgyang grags re res legs par brtag / gzhan du 'jug dogs re re kho nar ro //
analyzed: der ni rgyang grags re res legs par brtag / gzhan du 'jug dogs re re kho nar ro //
translated: and every time you enter other water.

original: 'di ni chu tshags med 'gro'i tshul yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni chu tshags med 'gro'i tshul yin no //
translated: This is the procedure if you do not have a water filter.

original: 'bab par byed pas 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: 'bab par byed pas 'bab pa'o //
translated: “Flowing” means flowing in a stream.

original: gal te chu klung de chu'i rgyun gzhan dang ma 'dres pa yin na der rgyang grags re rer chu brtags nas spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te chu klung de chu'i rgyun gzhan dang ma 'dres pa yin na der rgyang grags re rer chu brtags nas spyad par bya'o //
translated: If the water of the river is not mixed with other water, you should examine the water every furlong and use it.

original: chu rgyun ni 'dir rgyun la bya'o //
analyzed: chu rgyun ni 'dir rgyun la bya'o //
translated: Here, “stream” means a continuous flow of water.

original: 'dir slob dpon gyi zhal nas rgyang grags su rjes su 'gro ba zhig yin na chu'i tshogs brtags pa la rgyang grags zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon gyi zhal nas rgyang grags su rjes su 'gro ba zhig yin na chu'i tshogs brtags pa la rgyang grags zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: The Master says: “If it is a matter of a river, one should examine the water at the distance of a krośa.

original: gzhan du na ji ltar chu'i tshogs gzhan brtags na gzhan brtags par ji ltar 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan du na ji ltar chu'i tshogs gzhan brtags na gzhan brtags par ji ltar 'gyur zhes gsungs so //
translated: Otherwise, how could one examine the water of another river?🔽But, in the absence of a river, one should examine the water in a pond, etc.

original: rjes su 'gro ba nyid med pa'i phyir rgyun gyi bzlog phyogs su ni 'jug dogs re rer brtags nas spyad par bya'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal to //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba nyid med pa'i phyir rgyun gyi bzlog phyogs su ni 'jug dogs re rer brtags nas spyad par bya'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One has said that one should go to the opposite side of the stream, and examine the water drop by drop.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni chu klung gi rgyun 'bab pa'i bzlog phyogs dag tu ni 'jug dogs re rer brtags nas spyad par rung ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni chu klung gi rgyun 'bab pa'i bzlog phyogs dag tu ni 'jug dogs re rer brtags nas spyad par rung ba yin no //
translated: “Otherwise” means that it is proper to examine the water drop by drop when one goes to the opposite side of the stream.

original: cho ga 'di ni chu tshags med par 'gro ba la bstan pa yin no //🔽spu bcas gos dang nyi rim dag gis ni //
analyzed: cho ga 'di ni chu tshags med par 'gro ba la bstan pa yin no // spu bcas gos dang nyi rim dag gis ni //
translated: This rule is taught for one who has no water strainer.🔽One should not wash one’s clothes in the water where living beings are,

original: srog chags bcas pa'i chu la khrus bya bkag / gang la chu bas srog chags mang ba der //
analyzed: srog chags bcas pa'i chu la khrus bya bkag / gang la chu bas srog chags mang ba der //
translated: nor should one wash one’s feet there.

original: rim pa gcig pus khrus ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa gcig pus khrus ni mi bya'o //
translated: One should not bathe with only one garment on.

original: gos spus g-yogs pa dang nyi rim gyis srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la khrus bya ba bkag ste /
analyzed: gos spus g-yogs pa dang nyi rim gyis srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la khrus bya ba bkag ste /
translated: One should not bathe in water containing living beings, either covered with foam or covered with algae.

original: 'di gnyis la srog chags 'chags pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di gnyis la srog chags 'chags pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that living beings will be destroyed in these two cases.

original: ji skad du gos lhan pas btab pa dang / spus khebs pa dag gis khrus mi bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad du gos lhan pas btab pa dang / spus khebs pa dag gis khrus mi bya'o //
translated: As it is said, “One should not bathe with a garment that has a patch or is covered with algae.

original: byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa de yang bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa de yang bsdus pa yin te /
translated: If one does so, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: nyi rim bkag pas gos lhan pas btab pa yang 'dus pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: nyi rim bkag pas gos lhan pas btab pa yang 'dus pa'i phyir la /
translated: This is also included in the prohibition against bathing in water covered with algae, because the word “covered” is used.

original: spu dang bcas pa smos pas kyang spus khebs pa rnams so //
analyzed: spu dang bcas pa smos pas kyang spus khebs pa rnams so //
translated: And the word “algae” includes patches.

original: gang la chu bas srog chags mang ba der ni gos rim pa gcig gis kyang khrus mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang la chu bas srog chags mang ba der ni gos rim pa gcig gis kyang khrus mi bya'o //
translated: One should not bathe in water where there are more living beings than water, even with one garment on.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text says:

original: gang la srog chags kyi byings ni mang la chu byings ni chung ba der ni khrus mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang la srog chags kyi byings ni mang la chu byings ni chung ba der ni khrus mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not bathe in water where there are more living beings than water.

original: gang na chu'i byings ni che la srog chags kyi byings ni nyung ba der khrus bya'o @86b zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gang na chu'i byings ni che la srog chags kyi byings ni nyung ba der khrus bya'o @86b zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: One should bathe in a place where the mass of water is great and the mass of living beings is small.

original: de la chu brtags pa ni khyor bas so zhes gsungs pa de ni nya phyis la sogs pa mtshon par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la chu brtags pa ni khyor bas so zhes gsungs pa de ni nya phyis la sogs pa mtshon par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The examination of water there is with a cup.🔽The water of a well mixed with rice and so on,

original: khron pa'i chu dag 'bras chan la sogs dang // 'dres pa btsags nas de ni kha zas med //
analyzed: khron pa'i chu dag 'bras chan la sogs dang // 'dres pa btsags nas de ni kha zas med //
translated: is not food if it is strained.

original: gang tshe khyim pa'i bsti sar yod pa'i chu //
analyzed: gang tshe khyim pa'i bsti sar yod pa'i chu //
translated: If the water in the house of a householder

original: gtsang na phyi dro'ang the tshom med par btung //
analyzed: gtsang na phyi dro'ang the tshom med par btung //
translated: is pure, one may drink it in the afternoon without doubt.

original: khron pa la sogs pa'i chu 'bras chan dang tshod ma la sogs pa dang 'dres pa gang yin pa de ni btsags nas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: khron pa la sogs pa'i chu 'bras chan dang tshod ma la sogs pa dang 'dres pa gang yin pa de ni btsags nas blang bar bya'o //
translated: The water of a well, etc., mixed with rice, vegetables, etc., should be taken after it is strained.

original: sil bu las /
analyzed: sil bu las /
translated: In the Ksudraka Collection,

original: dge slong dag khron pa nas chu len pa dang de na de rnams kyi chu tshags su 'bras chan gyi tshigs ma dang khur ba'i dum bu dag ltung ba nas /
analyzed: dge slong dag khron pa nas chu len pa dang de na de rnams kyi chu tshags su 'bras chan gyi tshigs ma dang khur ba'i dum bu dag ltung ba nas /
translated: it is said that monks were drawing water from a well and rice and cake fell into their water strainer.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: kha zas des kha zas kyi bya ba byed mi nus kyi bor la btsag par bya'o //
analyzed: kha zas des kha zas kyi bya ba byed mi nus kyi bor la btsag par bya'o //
translated: “Since that food cannot serve as food, discard it and cook it again.

original: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o //
translated: Do not regret this.

original: mtshan mo yang btung bar bya zhing /
analyzed: mtshan mo yang btung bar bya zhing /
translated: Also, drink it at night.🔽Also, fill the bird’s nest.”

original: bya ma bum yang dgang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du dge slong gis dus su lhung bzed nas khu ba 'thungs pa dang / dus ma yin par lhung bzed nas skom 'thungs pa na lhung bzed las snum langs pa nas /
analyzed: bya ma bum yang dgang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du dge slong gis dus su lhung bzed nas khu ba 'thungs pa dang / dus ma yin par lhung bzed nas skom 'thungs pa na lhung bzed las snum langs pa nas /
translated: Similarly, when a monk drank juice from his alms bowl at the proper time and drank a beverage from his alms bowl at the improper time, oil rose up from his alms bowl.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: steng gi snum phor la skom btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: steng gi snum phor la skom btung bar bya'o //
translated: “Drink the beverage from the oil-holding vessel above.

original: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Do not regret this.”

original: gang gi tshe khyim pa rnams kyi bsti sa na yod pa'i chu brtags pas gtsang ba yin na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyim pa rnams kyi bsti sa na yod pa'i chu brtags pas gtsang ba yin na /
translated: When the water in the assembly hall of the householders is examined and found to be pure,

original: de'i tshe mtshan mo yang btung du rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe mtshan mo yang btung du rung ngo //
translated: then it is suitable to drink at night.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gleng gzhi las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gleng gzhi las /
translated: Here, the treatise topic is the nidana.

original: dge slong dag lam du 'gro bar byed la /
analyzed: dge slong dag lam du 'gro bar byed la /
translated: Monks were traveling on the road.

original: de na chu med pa dang / 'gron pa rnams kyis khyim pa'i bsti sa na yod pa'i chu byin na /
analyzed: de na chu med pa dang / 'gron pa rnams kyis khyim pa'i bsti sa na yod pa'i chu byin na /
translated: When they were without water and received water from the home of a layperson,

original: dge slong rnams dus ma yin pa na 'gyod pas mi btung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong rnams dus ma yin pa na 'gyod pas mi btung ngo //
translated: the monks did not drink it because they were anxious about the time.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavan said,

original: gal te gzhan rnyed pa med na brtags nas btung bar bya zhing bya ma bum dang ril ba dag tu yang blugs par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gzhan rnyed pa med na brtags nas btung bar bya zhing bya ma bum dang ril ba dag tu yang blugs par bya'o //
translated: “If you do not find anything else, drink it after examining it and pour it into a bird’s nest or a pot.

original: zo chun rgyud mo dang rgyal ba dag na yod pa yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: zo chun rgyud mo dang rgyal ba dag na yod pa yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The same is true of water in a waterwheel or a water mill.

original: dge slong dag zo chun rgyud mo ni gtsang ba'i rgyu yin gyi brtags na dus sam dus ma yin par yang btung bar bya zhing 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag zo chun rgyud mo ni gtsang ba'i rgyu yin gyi brtags na dus sam dus ma yin par yang btung bar bya zhing 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Monks, a waterwheel is a cause of purity. If you examine it, you may drink it at the proper time or the improper time and you should not be anxious about it.”

original: 'di ni dus ma yin pa'i kha zas dang 'brel pa yin yang chu'i skabs yin pa'i phyir 'dir bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni dus ma yin pa'i kha zas dang 'brel pa yin yang chu'i skabs yin pa'i phyir 'dir bstan to //
translated: This is related to improper food, but it is taught here because it is a section on water.

original: dbyug gu gsum pa gru gsum grva srad bus //
analyzed: dbyug gu gsum pa gru gsum grva srad bus //
translated: The third cubit is triangular, with a string in the corner.

original: btags nas chu ni legs par btsag par bya //🔽lci ba skam po gtsang ma'i phye @87a * //
analyzed: btags nas chu ni legs par btsag par bya // lci ba skam po gtsang ma'i phye @87a * //
translated: The water should be filtered with a cloth tied to a three-stick strainer.

original: ma yis // chu tshags shin tu srab na gdab par bya //
analyzed: ma yis // chu tshags shin tu srab na gdab par bya //
translated: If the cloth is too thin, one should put a little dry, clean clay in the strainer.

original: dbyug gu gsum las chu chags gru gsum gyi grva'i srad bu btags nas btsag par bya'o //
analyzed: dbyug gu gsum las chu chags gru gsum gyi grva'i srad bu btags nas btsag par bya'o //
translated: The water should be filtered with a cloth tied to a three-stick strainer.

original: gal te srab pa'i phyir srog chags dag mi 'dzin na de'i tshe lci ba shin tu skam po'i phye ma chu tshags gru gsum po der gdab par bya'o //🔽chu tshags 'dzag par bya phyir yang dang yang //
analyzed: gal te srab pa'i phyir srog chags dag mi 'dzin na de'i tshe lci ba shin tu skam po'i phye ma chu tshags gru gsum po der gdab par bya'o // chu tshags 'dzag par bya phyir yang dang yang //
translated: If the cloth is too thin and does not catch the living beings, then one should put a little dry, clean clay in the strainer.

original: smyig ma'i tshal pa dag gis brdab par bya //🔽srog chags srung phyir lcags kyi lu gu brgyud //
analyzed: smyig ma'i tshal pa dag gis brdab par bya // srog chags srung phyir lcags kyi lu gu brgyud //
translated: In order to make the water drip, one should shake the strainer with a clump of grass.

original: btags pa'i snod ni 'og tu gzhag par bya //
analyzed: btags pa'i snod ni 'og tu gzhag par bya //
translated: In order to protect living beings, one should place the container below the strainer with a chain of iron filings.

original: chu tshags der lci ba'i phye ma btab pas gal te chu mi 'dzag na /
analyzed: chu tshags der lci ba'i phye ma btab pas gal te chu mi 'dzag na /
translated: If the water does not drip because of the clay in the strainer, one should shake the strainer with a clump of grass.

original: de'i tshe chu 'dzag par bya ba'i phyir yang dang yang du smyig ma'i tshal pas brdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe chu 'dzag par bya ba'i phyir yang dang yang du smyig ma'i tshal pas brdab par bya'o //
translated: At that time, in order to stop the water from leaking, one should repeatedly tap the bamboo with something.

original: chu tshags gru gsum gyi 'og tu srog chags de dag bsrung ba'i phyir snod la lcags kyi lu gu rgyud la sogs pas btags nas gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: chu tshags gru gsum gyi 'og tu srog chags de dag bsrung ba'i phyir snod la lcags kyi lu gu rgyud la sogs pas btags nas gzhag par bya'o //
translated: In order to protect those creatures, one should place the water strainer in a triangular container, and tie it with an iron chain or something similar.

original: 'o na phran tshegs las /
analyzed: 'o na phran tshegs las /
translated: But isn't it said in the Ksudraka Collection:

original: tshags rten snod gnyis te /
analyzed: tshags rten snod gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of water strainers:
