original: zangs las byas pa dang / sa las byas pa'o //
analyzed: zangs las byas pa dang / sa las byas pa'o //
translated: one made of copper and one made of clay.

original: de la zangs las byas pa la bu ga btod de lu gu rgyud kyis bu ga la gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: de la zangs las byas pa la bu ga btod de lu gu rgyud kyis bu ga la gdags par bya'o //
translated: In the copper one, a hole is made and a chain is attached to the hole.

original: sa las byas pa la bu ga btong de srad bus gdags par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sa las byas pa la bu ga btong de srad bus gdags par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: In the clay one, a hole is made and a string is attached.

original: da ji ltar gzhan du bstan zhe na /
analyzed: da ji ltar gzhan du bstan zhe na /
translated: So how can it be explained differently?

original: de ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de ni nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault,

original: ji tsam gyis srog chags zad pa tsam 'grub pa de tsam zhig 'dir brjod pa mtshon pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis srog chags zad pa tsam 'grub pa de tsam zhig 'dir brjod pa mtshon pa'i phyir na /
translated: because here only that much is stated to illustrate the establishment of the mere exhaustion of creatures.

original: de ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: That is the illustration.

original: ji ste lugs kyis yul na khron pa yod pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: ji ste lugs kyis yul na khron pa yod pa zhig yin na /
translated: If there is a well in the place where one lives,

original: srog chags de dag btsags pa'i chu ji ltar dbo bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: srog chags de dag btsags pa'i chu ji ltar dbo bar bya zhe na /
translated: how should one draw water without harming the living beings?🔽It is said:

original: bshad pa / de yi srog chags gnod pa spang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: bshad pa / de yi srog chags gnod pa spang ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to avoid harming the living beings,🔽one should draw the water with a vessel

original: srog chags yod chu thar par byed pa'i snod /
analyzed: srog chags yod chu thar par byed pa'i snod /
translated: that allows the living beings to escape,

original: kha dang zhabs su thag pa gnyis btags pas //🔽snying rje'i dor ni khron pa'i nang du dbo //
analyzed: kha dang zhabs su thag pa gnyis btags pas // snying rje'i dor ni khron pa'i nang du dbo //
translated: with two ropes attached to the mouth and the bottom.

original: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu de thar bar byed pa'i snod kyis dbo'o //
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu de thar bar byed pa'i snod kyis dbo'o //
translated: One should draw the water with a vessel that allows the living beings to escape.

original: ji 'dra bar bya zhe na /🔽srog chags rnams la /
analyzed: ji 'dra bar bya zhe na / srog chags rnams la /
translated: How should one do it?

original: gnod pa med par bya ba'i phyir bsal tshags des sam /
analyzed: gnod pa med par bya ba'i phyir bsal tshags des sam /
translated: In order to avoid harming the living beings,

original: thar par byed pa'i snod la thag pas btags nas khron par gzhug par bya zhing gang ba ni gzhug la /
analyzed: thar par byed pa'i snod la thag pas btags nas khron par gzhug par bya zhing gang ba ni gzhug la /
translated: one should draw the water with a vessel that allows the living beings to escape,🔽with two ropes attached to the mouth and the bottom.

original: stong pa ni slar dbyung ba de lta bur bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: stong pa ni slar dbyung ba de lta bur bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: One should put the full one in the well and take out the empty one.

original: 'di ni bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This is the summary.

original: 'phags pas 'jig rten mdun du ril ba dag / kha la bzlog ste gtad nas chu mi btung //
analyzed: 'phags pas 'jig rten mdun du ril ba dag / kha la bzlog ste gtad nas chu mi btung //
translated: The noble one should not drink water from a bowl held upside down in front of the world.

original: lo ma la sogs mi rnyed dben song ste //
analyzed: lo ma la sogs mi rnyed dben song ste //
translated: If one does not find leaves, etc., one should go to a secluded place.

original: skom pa'i phyir ni @87b 'thungs na nyes pa med //
analyzed: skom pa'i phyir ni @87b 'thungs na nyes pa med //
translated: If one drinks water for the sake of thirst, there is no fault.

original: 'phags pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'brang bas ni khar ril ba spyi blugs bzlog nas chu btung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'brang bas ni khar ril ba spyi blugs bzlog nas chu btung bar mi bya'o //
translated: One who follows the noble Dharma should not drink water from a bowl held upside down in front of the world.

original: lo ma la sogs pa dag mi rnyed la skom pas gdungs na skye bo med par song ste btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: lo ma la sogs pa dag mi rnyed la skom pas gdungs na skye bo med par song ste btung bar bya'o //
translated: If one does not find leaves, etc., and is tormented by thirst, one should go to a place without people and drink.

original: sil bu las /
analyzed: sil bu las /
translated: In the Sthavira scriptures it is said:

original: dge slong gis bya ma bum nas chu 'thungs pa na /
analyzed: dge slong gis bya ma bum nas chu 'thungs pa na /
translated: When a monk drank water from a bird's beak,🔽he was bitten by a three-mouthed mosquito.

original: sbrang bu mchu gsum pas zin pa nas btung du med pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: sbrang bu mchu gsum pas zin pa nas btung du med pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: gang du gzhan dag gis mthong nas ma dad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyogs dben par 'dug ste /
analyzed: gang du gzhan dag gis mthong nas ma dad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyogs dben par 'dug ste /
translated: One should sit in a secluded place where others, seeing, will not lose faith.

original: bya ma bum nas btung bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ma bum nas btung bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should drink from a bird's beak. And so on, it is extensively taught.

original: dus dang dus su bum pa bskam par bya //
analyzed: dus dang dus su bum pa bskam par bya //
translated: and from time to time dry it.

original: khrud shing gis rab tu bkru bar bya //🔽rung ba'i snod rnams kyi ni kha dag la //
analyzed: khrud shing gis rab tu bkru bar bya // rung ba'i snod rnams kyi ni kha dag la //
translated: Wash it with a cleansing agent.🔽Always cover the mouths of the suitable vessels

original: rtag tu bsgrims nas lo ma la sogs dgab //
analyzed: rtag tu bsgrims nas lo ma la sogs dgab //
translated: with leaves, etc., in order to protect them.

original: dus su zhes bya ba ni phyis so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dus su zhes bya ba ni phyis so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “In time” means “later,” that is the meaning.

original: mi zad pa'i bsdu ba yin la de'i phyir dus dang dus su zhes bya ba ni dus dang dus su'o //🔽pu shel tsil sogs pa'i khru da shing gtsang mas bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi zad pa'i bsdu ba yin la de'i phyir dus dang dus su zhes bya ba ni dus dang dus su'o // pu shel tsil sogs pa'i khru da shing gtsang mas bkru bar bya'o //
translated: It is a collection of imperishables. Therefore, “in time” means “from time to time.”🔽Wash it with a cleansing agent such as pusheltsi.

original: rdul med par bya ba'i phyir chu'i bum pa la sogs pa'i kha dgab par bya'o //
analyzed: rdul med par bya ba'i phyir chu'i bum pa la sogs pa'i kha dgab par bya'o //
translated: Cover the mouths of the water pots, etc., with leaves, etc., in order to keep out dust.

original: yang chu shin tu gtsang ma dag spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: yang chu shin tu gtsang ma dag spyad par bya'o //
translated: Again, use very clean water.

original: snying nas lan gnyis lan gsum bkrus nas ni //
analyzed: snying nas lan gnyis lan gsum bkrus nas ni //
translated: If you wash it twice or thrice from the heart,

original: lag pa snum por yod kyang dag pa yin //
analyzed: lag pa snum por yod kyang dag pa yin //
translated: it is pure even if your hands are oily.

original: rnyog ma can gyi chu ni ji srid du //
analyzed: rnyog ma can gyi chu ni ji srid du //
translated: As long as the water is turbid,

original: gzhan gyi gzugs snang bar du bsgrims te btsag / g-yo bor te de snying nas lan gnyis lan gsum du bkrus na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi gzugs snang bar du bsgrims te btsag / g-yo bor te de snying nas lan gnyis lan gsum du bkrus na /
translated: He should rub the other's form into it, and wash it twice or thrice with his heart.

original: gal te lag pa la snum snang du zin kyang de dag pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te lag pa la snum snang du zin kyang de dag pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: If his hand appears to be oily, he should understand that it is purified.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: snying nas lan gnyis lan gsum drung par bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: snying nas lan gnyis lan gsum drung par bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: He should wash it twice or thrice with his heart.

original: gal te snod dang 'brel par 'di bstan du zin kyang 'on kyang 'di spyir bstan par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te snod dang 'brel par 'di bstan du zin kyang 'on kyang 'di spyir bstan par khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: Although this is taught in connection with a vessel, nevertheless it should be understood as a general teaching,

original: thams cad la dag par bya bar mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la dag par bya bar mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because everything is equal in being purified.

original: chu gang shin tu rnyog pa can du gyur pa de ni rab tu bsgrims te bcag par bya'o //
analyzed: chu gang shin tu rnyog pa can du gyur pa de ni rab tu bsgrims te bcag par bya'o //
translated: If the water becomes very turbid, then it should be clarified by filtering it.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: dge slong rnams lam du 'gro ba na chu shin tu rnyog pa can du gyur pas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams lam du 'gro ba na chu shin tu rnyog pa can du gyur pas /
translated: When the monks were traveling on the road, the water became very turbid.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽Monks, if the water becomes turbid,

original: gang la bzhin gyi gzugs mi snang ba de ni byin len byas nas btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang la bzhin gyi gzugs mi snang ba de ni byin len byas nas btung bar bya'o //
translated: If the reflection of one’s face does not appear in it, one should drink it after having received the gift.

original: gang la snang ba de ni de kho na bzhin du btung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //🔽'o na dge tshul rnams la byin len ma byas na nyes pa med @88a * //
analyzed: gang la snang ba de ni de kho na bzhin du btung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no // 'o na dge tshul rnams la byin len ma byas na nyes pa med @88a * //
translated: If the reflection appears, one should drink it as it is.

original: ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that there is no fault for novices if they do not receive the gift?

original: 'dir ji ltar bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar bstan zhe na /
translated: How is this taught here?

original: bla ma'i ched du blangs na chu tshags kyis gzung du med pa'i rdul dag yod na yang nyes pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bla ma'i ched du blangs na chu tshags kyis gzung du med pa'i rdul dag yod na yang nyes pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'di bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught in order to show that there is no fault if one drinks water from a well, etc., that is not received in the presence of the teacher, if one is unable to receive the gift because of the presence of dust.

original: khron pa la sogs rnams nas chu blangs nas //🔽khron pa la sogs byed de'i chu lha la //
analyzed: khron pa la sogs rnams nas chu blangs nas // khron pa la sogs byed de'i chu lha la //
translated: Having drawn water from a well, etc.,🔽one should recite the verse of offering to the water deity

original: sbyin pa'i rabs mthun tshigs bcad gdon par bya //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i rabs mthun tshigs bcad gdon par bya //
translated: in accordance with the lineage of generosity.

original: 'thung dang khrus byed pa na'ang de bzhin brjod //
analyzed: 'thung dang khrus byed pa na'ang de bzhin brjod //
translated: One should recite it also when drinking and bathing.

original: khron pa la sogs pa rnams nas chu blangs nas /
analyzed: khron pa la sogs pa rnams nas chu blangs nas /
translated: Having drawn water from a well, etc.,

original: khron pa la sogs pa byed pa dang / de'i chu lha rnams la sbyin pa'i rabs dang mthun pa'i tshigs bcad gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: khron pa la sogs pa byed pa dang / de'i chu lha rnams la sbyin pa'i rabs dang mthun pa'i tshigs bcad gdon par bya'o //
translated: One should recite verses in praise of generosity, such as the Jatakamala.

original: 'thung ba dang khrus byed pa na yang de bzhin du bya ste /
analyzed: 'thung ba dang khrus byed pa na yang de bzhin du bya ste /
translated: One should do the same when drinking and bathing.

original: khron pa la sogs pa rnams nas chu blangs nas khron pa la sogs pa byed pa dang / de'i chu'i lha rnams kyi phyir gtsug lag gi tshigs su bcad pa gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: khron pa la sogs pa rnams nas chu blangs nas khron pa la sogs pa byed pa dang / de'i chu'i lha rnams kyi phyir gtsug lag gi tshigs su bcad pa gdon par bya'o //
translated: Having drawn water from a well, etc., one should recite verses from the scriptures for the sake of the well-deity, etc.

original: mud ga la sogs 'bru la srog chags yod //
analyzed: mud ga la sogs 'bru la srog chags yod //
translated: There are living beings in grain such as rice and wheat.

original: de ni bde dang bsil bar dgram par bya //
analyzed: de ni bde dang bsil bar dgram par bya //
translated: One should spread them out in a cool place.

original: 'on kyang de nas srog chags mi 'bral na //
analyzed: 'on kyang de nas srog chags mi 'bral na //
translated: If living beings are not separated from them,🔽one should put them in a place where there is no living being.

original: 'on kyang gnas khang nang du bcug ste gzhag / gal te sran mud ga la sogs pa la srog chags rnams yod par gyur na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gnas khang nang du bcug ste gzhag / gal te sran mud ga la sogs pa la srog chags rnams yod par gyur na /
translated: If there are living beings in rice, wheat, etc.,

original: de'i tshe bsil ba'i phyogs su bkram ste gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe bsil ba'i phyogs su bkram ste gzhag par bya'o //
translated: then one should spread them out in a cool place.

original: gal te 'on kyang srog chags rnams bral ba'am gyur na 'on kyang gnas khang du bcug ste gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te 'on kyang srog chags rnams bral ba'am gyur na 'on kyang gnas khang du bcug ste gzhag par bya'o //
translated: But if the living beings are not separated or have not gone away, then he should put them in a dwelling place.

original: shig rnams dal gyis ras mar bzhag nas ni //🔽rtsig pa la sogs bu ga rnams su gzhug / rtsva shig dag kyang de bzhin bsil ba'i sa //
analyzed: shig rnams dal gyis ras mar bzhag nas ni // rtsig pa la sogs bu ga rnams su gzhug / rtsva shig dag kyang de bzhin bsil ba'i sa //
translated: Having slowly taken the lice, he should put them on a piece of cloth🔽and put them in a hole in a wall, etc.

original: rtsva sngon bcas pa'i phyogs su dor bar bya //
analyzed: rtsva sngon bcas pa'i phyogs su dor bar bya //
translated: The lice eggs should be thrown in a place with green grass.

original: shig rnams ni dal gyis blangs te ras ma dag tu bzhag nas rtsig pa la sogs pa'i bu ga dag tu gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: shig rnams ni dal gyis blangs te ras ma dag tu bzhag nas rtsig pa la sogs pa'i bu ga dag tu gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Having slowly taken the lice, he should put them on a piece of cloth and put them in a hole in a wall, etc.

original: srog chags ma gu ta ga dag ni bsil ba'i rtsva sngon po dang bcas pa'i phyogs su gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: srog chags ma gu ta ga dag ni bsil ba'i rtsva sngon po dang bcas pa'i phyogs su gtang bar bya'o //
translated: The lice eggs should be thrown in a place with green grass and with blue-green algae.

original: gdug pa la sogs nyon mongs byed pa gzhan //
analyzed: gdug pa la sogs nyon mongs byed pa gzhan //
translated: The other afflictive ones, such as snakes, are

original: rang gi spyod yul dag tu gtang bar 'os //
analyzed: rang gi spyod yul dag tu gtang bar 'os //
translated: suitable to be released in their own range.

original: sbrul dang byi ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa bskyed pa gzhan rnams kyang thabs kyis bzung ste /
analyzed: sbrul dang byi ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa bskyed pa gzhan rnams kyang thabs kyis bzung ste /
translated: The other afflictive ones, such as snakes, mice, etc., should be caught by skillful means and released in their own range.

original: rang gi yul kho nar gtang bar 'os pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi yul kho nar gtang bar 'os pa yin no //
translated: It is proper to give it only to one’s own country.

original: mthar 'gyur de ni nyes byas lhan cig bstan //
analyzed: mthar 'gyur de ni nyes byas lhan cig bstan //
translated: The conclusion is taught together with the misdeed.

original: de nas srog gcod phyogs mthun bshad par bya //
analyzed: de nas srog gcod phyogs mthun bshad par bya //
translated: Now the factors conducive to killing should be explained.

original: mthar 'gyur ba de ni nyes byas dang lhan cig tu bstan zin to //
analyzed: mthar 'gyur ba de ni nyes byas dang lhan cig tu bstan zin to //
translated: The conclusion is taught together with the misdeed.

original: zhar la de'i phyogs dang @88b mthun pa dag kyang bstan zin na /
analyzed: zhar la de'i phyogs dang @88b mthun pa dag kyang bstan zin na /
translated: The factors conducive to that have also been taught.

original: gtsor ni ma yin pas de'i phyir da ni srog gcod pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gtsor ni ma yin pas de'i phyir da ni srog gcod pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: But they are not primary, therefore now the factors conducive to killing should be explained.🔽What are they?

original: yang de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang de dag gang zhe na /
translated: It is said:

original: bshad pa / dper na nad pa dag la dug mtshon sbyin //
analyzed: bshad pa / dper na nad pa dag la dug mtshon sbyin //
translated: For example, poison and weapons are given to the sick,

original: skom la sogs pa mi 'phrod sbyin pa ste //
analyzed: skom la sogs pa mi 'phrod sbyin pa ste //
translated: and unsuitable things such as alcohol are given.

original: rgan po mkhas dang sman pa dag la yang //
analyzed: rgan po mkhas dang sman pa dag la yang //
translated: Even to the wise elders and physicians,

original: dris nas nad pa dag la sman dag sbyin //
analyzed: dris nas nad pa dag la sman dag sbyin //
translated: after asking, medicine is given to the sick.

original: nad pa la dug gam mtshon dag gya tshom du sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: nad pa la dug gam mtshon dag gya tshom du sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: Poison or weapons should not be given recklessly to the sick.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
translated: Here, the text is from the Vinaya:

original: dge slong zhig yun ring por nad kyis nyon mongs nas /
analyzed: dge slong zhig yun ring por nad kyis nyon mongs nas /
translated: A monk was afflicted by illness for a long time.

original: de bdag gi srog 'di 'dra bas ci zhig bya snyam du sems shing de dge slong 'grogs bshes kyi gan du song ste /
analyzed: de bdag gi srog 'di 'dra bas ci zhig bya snyam du sems shing de dge slong 'grogs bshes kyi gan du song ste /
translated: Thinking, What is the use of this kind of life? he went to the monk Mitra and said,

original: 'di skad ces bdag la mtshon byin ces smras pa na /
analyzed: 'di skad ces bdag la mtshon byin ces smras pa na /
translated: Give me a weapon.

original: des mtshon gyis mgul pa bcad de shi nas dus byas pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: des mtshon gyis mgul pa bcad de shi nas dus byas pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' stsal pa /
translated: He cut his throat with the weapon and died. The Blessed One said,

original: ltung ba ni med do //
analyzed: ltung ba ni med do //
translated: There is no offense.

original: phyis dge slong gis gya tshom du mtshon sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: phyis dge slong gis gya tshom du mtshon sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: Later, a monk should not recklessly give a weapon.

original: dug kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dug kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The same applies up to poison.

original: ltung ba med do zhes bya ba 'di yang sems dag pa la bstan pa yin no gzhan du na ni mtha'i yan lag rnams tshang ba'i phyir pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltung ba med do zhes bya ba 'di yang sems dag pa la bstan pa yin no gzhan du na ni mtha'i yan lag rnams tshang ba'i phyir pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: There is no offense is taught for a pure mind. Otherwise, because the final limbs are complete, it would be a defeating offense.

original: mi 'phrod ces bya ba ni ltung ba la sogs pa mi phan pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'phrod ces bya ba ni ltung ba la sogs pa mi phan pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: Unwholesome means giving a downfall and so on that is not beneficial.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: dge slong zhig na nas des kha zas 'phrod pa dag mi rnyed pa dang / de'i rim gro bas mi 'phrod pa zhig byin te shi ba nas /
analyzed: dge slong zhig na nas des kha zas 'phrod pa dag mi rnyed pa dang / de'i rim gro bas mi 'phrod pa zhig byin te shi ba nas /
translated: A monk became ill and could not find suitable food.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said,

original: pham pa'i ltung ba ni med de /
analyzed: pham pa'i ltung ba ni med de /
translated: “There is no offense entailing expulsion,

original: dman pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dman pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
translated: but there is a serious offense.”

original: rgan po mkhas dang sman pa dag la yang //
analyzed: rgan po mkhas dang sman pa dag la yang //
translated: The text says, “After asking an elder, a learned person, and a doctor.”

original: dris nas zhes bya ba ni 'dir rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: dris nas zhes bya ba ni 'dir rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: Here, the analysis says,

original: yang dge slong gis rang gi blos nad pa la sman sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gis rang gi blos nad pa la sman sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: “A monk should not give medicine to a sick person on his own.

original: sman pa la dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sman pa la dri bar bya'o //
translated: He should ask a doctor.

original: sman pa med na yang sman pa las rab tu byung ba la dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sman pa med na yang sman pa las rab tu byung ba la dri bar bya'o //
translated: If there is no doctor, he should ask someone who has trained as a doctor.

original: sman pa las rab tu byung ba med na yang sman pas bkol ba la dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sman pa las rab tu byung ba med na yang sman pas bkol ba la dri bar bya'o //
translated: If there is no one who has trained as a doctor, he should ask someone who has been instructed by a doctor.

original: sman pas bkol ba med na nad kyis nyon mongs pa dag la dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sman pas bkol ba med na nad kyis nyon mongs pa dag la dri bar bya'o //
translated: If there is no one who has been instructed by a doctor, he should ask those who are afflicted by the same illness.”

original: de dag kyang med na gnas brtan gnas brtan rnams la dri bar bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang med na gnas brtan gnas brtan rnams la dri bar bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If they are not available, he should ask the most venerable of the elders.

original: de yi rim gro ba ni glen mi bsko //
analyzed: de yi rim gro ba ni glen mi bsko //
translated: The attendant should not be stupid.

original: med par gyur na legs par bsgo ste bsko //🔽gang gis de yi sems ni 'chir gnas pa //
analyzed: med par gyur na legs par bsgo ste bsko // gang gis de yi sems ni 'chir gnas pa //
translated: If he is not available, one should appoint a skilled attendant.

original: de 'dra'i chos rnams nad pa la mi bshad //
analyzed: de 'dra'i chos rnams nad pa la mi bshad //
translated: The patient should not be told of the things🔽that would disturb his mind.🔽The Vinaya also says:

original: rnam par 'byed pa las kyang dge slong gis rim gro pa mi mkhas pa gzhag par mi bya'o //🔽gal te de lta bu'i @89a * //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa las kyang dge slong gis rim gro pa mi mkhas pa gzhag par mi bya'o // gal te de lta bu'i @89a * //
translated: A monk should not appoint an unskilled attendant.

original: rkyen zhig byung na bsgo ste gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rkyen zhig byung na bsgo ste gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If such conditions arise, he should be appointed after being instructed.

original: bsgo ba ni 'dir khong du chud par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bsgo ba ni 'dir khong du chud par bya ba yin no //
translated: Here, “instructed” means “made to understand.”

original: gang gis nad pa 'chi bar bya ba'i phyir spro ba de lta bu'i chos nang pa la bshad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis nad pa 'chi bar bya ba'i phyir spro ba de lta bu'i chos nang pa la bshad par mi bya'o //
translated: The patient should not be told of the things that would disturb his mind, such as the fact that the attendant is not skilled and has been appointed only because he has no other choice.

original: rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: The Vinaya also says:

original: dge slong gis gang mthong na nad pa 'chi bar sems pa de lta bu'i chos nad pa la bshad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gis gang mthong na nad pa 'chi bar sems pa de lta bu'i chos nad pa la bshad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: A monk should not explain to a patient any Dharma that would cause him to think that he is dying.

original: 'dir spyir dgag par bzhed pa'i phyir nad pa smos pa ni mtshon par zad do //
analyzed: 'dir spyir dgag par bzhed pa'i phyir nad pa smos pa ni mtshon par zad do //
translated: The term “patient” is used here as an illustration, because it is intended to be a general prohibition.

original: 'o na rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: Well then, how do you interpret the exegesis?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa thos nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa thos nas /
translated: After hearing the Blessed One’s teaching of the Dharma,

original: dge slong dag lus rnag can des 'dzem nas bdag nyid srog dang 'bral bar byed ces bya ba la sogs pa 'di ji ltar grang zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag lus rnag can des 'dzem nas bdag nyid srog dang 'bral bar byed ces bya ba la sogs pa 'di ji ltar grang zhe na /
translated: the monks, disgusted with the putrid body, will kill themselves.

original: 'di la 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: 'di la 'gal ba med de /
translated: There is no contradiction here.

original: de rnams ni chos bstan pas ngoms pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de rnams ni chos bstan pas ngoms pa ma yin gyi /
translated: These monks were not satisfied with the teaching of the Dharma,

original: 'on kyang myong bar 'gyur bas nges pa'i las kyis so //
analyzed: 'on kyang myong bar 'gyur bas nges pa'i las kyis so //
translated: but rather with the karma that was certain to ripen.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis las bzlog dka' bar gzigs nas mi sdug pa bstan pas de rnams kyis thar pa'i sa bon brtas par mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis las bzlog dka' bar gzigs nas mi sdug pa bstan pas de rnams kyis thar pa'i sa bon brtas par mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed One, seeing that it is difficult to turn back karma, causes the seed of liberation to grow by teaching repulsiveness.

original: de la ji srid yun rings chos spyod 'tsho //
analyzed: de la ji srid yun rings chos spyod 'tsho //
translated: For as long as he lives, he should practice the Dharma.

original: de srid du ni dge ba'i rgyun 'phel bas //
analyzed: de srid du ni dge ba'i rgyun 'phel bas //
translated: For as long as he lives, the stream of virtue will increase.

original: sos par shog shig yun rings gson par shog / nad 'jigs las thar bde bar shog ces brjod //🔽nad pa de la tshe dang ldan pa chos la gnas pa ni ji srid du yun ring du 'tsho ba de srid du dge ba rgyud la rgyas par 'gyur gyi sos par shog shig / yun ring du gson par shog shig / dus thams cad du nad las
analyzed: sos par shog shig yun rings gson par shog / nad 'jigs las thar bde bar shog ces brjod // nad pa de la tshe dang ldan pa chos la gnas pa ni ji srid du yun ring du 'tsho ba de srid du dge ba rgyud la rgyas par 'gyur gyi sos par shog shig / yun ring du gson par shog shig / dus thams cad du nad las
translated: May he be cured! May he live a long time!

original: thar te bde bar shog shig ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: thar te bde bar shog shig ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: To the patient, the one who is abiding in the Dharma and is long-lived, one should say, “For as long as he lives, may the stream of virtue increase. May he be cured! May he live a long time! At all times, may he be free from the fear of illness and be happy!”

original: gal te nad pa na re spo byas na //
analyzed: gal te nad pa na re spo byas na //
translated: If the patient says, “If I am moved,

original: bdag ni 'chi 'gyur zer na de mi bya //
analyzed: bdag ni 'chi 'gyur zer na de mi bya //
translated: I will die,” do not move him.

original: gdol pa bzhin du lhung bzed la sogs phyir //
analyzed: gdol pa bzhin du lhung bzed la sogs phyir //
translated: For the sake of the alms-bowl and so on, like a caṇḍāla,

original: snying brtse med par chags pa'i sems mi bya //
analyzed: snying brtse med par chags pa'i sems mi bya //
translated: One should not be attached to the sick person without compassion.

original: gal te nad pa na re spos na bdag 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes zer na de spo bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te nad pa na re spos na bdag 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes zer na de spo bar mi bya'o //
translated: If the sick person says, “If I am moved, I will die,” then he should not be moved.

original: 'dir khungs ni 'dul byed las /
analyzed: 'dir khungs ni 'dul byed las /
translated: The source for this is the Vinaya Kṣudraka-vastu:

original: dge slong nad pa zhig stan la 'dug pa dang / de'i rim gro pas smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong nad pa zhig stan la 'dug pa dang / de'i rim gro pas smras pa /
translated: A sick monk was sitting on a bed. His attendant said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa longs shig / des smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa longs shig / des smras pa /
translated: “Venerable, get up!”🔽He said, “It is not right for me to die. Don’t make me get up!”🔽“Venerable, get up!”

original: bdag shi na mi rung gi ma bslang shig / tshe dang ldan pa longs shig / langs pa dang shi nas de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bdag shi na mi rung gi ma bslang shig / tshe dang ldan pa longs shig / langs pa dang shi nas de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: He died as soon as he got up. He felt regret, and the Blessed One said,

original: pham pa'i ltung ba ni med de /
analyzed: pham pa'i ltung ba ni med de /
translated: “There is no offense entailing expulsion.

original: dman pa sbom pa @89b por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dman pa sbom pa @89b por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
translated: There is a serious offense for the one who is inferior.”

original: gdol ba dang 'dra bar lhung bzed la sogs pa'i ched du chags pa'i sems bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gdol ba dang 'dra bar lhung bzed la sogs pa'i ched du chags pa'i sems bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not generate attachment for the sake of a begging bowl or other possessions, as if one were a caṇḍāla.

original: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: The source for this is the Vibhāṣā:

original: dge slong gis gdol ba dang 'dra bar chos gos kyi phyir de lta bu'i sems skyed par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gis gdol ba dang 'dra bar chos gos kyi phyir de lta bu'i sems skyed par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If a monk generates such a thought for the sake of his robes, he becomes guilty of an offense.🔽Moreover,🔽when one is the basis of faults,🔽one sits on another’s seat or bed,

original: gzhan yang / gang tshe nyes pa'i gzhi dag byed pa dang // nan gyis gzhan gyi khri dang khri'u la 'dug / rdeg par byed dam yang na gzas pa dang / rnam par 'tshe dang 'jigs pa la sogs byed //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gang tshe nyes pa'i gzhi dag byed pa dang // nan gyis gzhan gyi khri dang khri'u la 'dug / rdeg par byed dam yang na gzas pa dang / rnam par 'tshe dang 'jigs pa la sogs byed //
translated: one strikes, or threatens, or harms, or frightens,

original: khros pas brtul zhugs can la zan med byed /
analyzed: khros pas brtul zhugs can la zan med byed /
translated: or, angry, one does not give food to the ascetic.

original: ngal la 'bul lam rgyal la chom rkun 'bul //
analyzed: ngal la 'bul lam rgyal la chom rkun 'bul //
translated: One gives to the lazy, not to the diligent; one gives to the king, not to the poor.

original: bsams bzhin du ni 'gyod pa'i tshul dag byed //🔽'tshir dang g-ya' sgog la sogs nags mes gtong //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du ni 'gyod pa'i tshul dag byed // 'tshir dang g-ya' sgog la sogs nags mes gtong //
translated: One acts in a way that is contrary to one’s intentions.🔽One sets fire to forests, with their grass, trees, and so on.

original: 'bras ni ma smin par yang brtol byed dang // yan lag gcod dam de bzhin 'bigs kyang rung //
analyzed: 'bras ni ma smin par yang brtol byed dang // yan lag gcod dam de bzhin 'bigs kyang rung //
translated: One opens green mangoes, or cuts off a limb, or pierces it,

original: de yi tshe yang phyogs mthun de ltar 'dir //
analyzed: de yi tshe yang phyogs mthun de ltar 'dir //
translated: at that time, in this way,

original: thams cad srog gcod mthun pa'i phyogs tsam yin //
analyzed: thams cad srog gcod mthun pa'i phyogs tsam yin //
translated: all are merely partial causes of killing.

original: nyes pa 'thab mo dang mtshang 'bru ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dag gzhi gang dag las skyes pa de dag ni nyes pa'i gzhi dag ste /
analyzed: nyes pa 'thab mo dang mtshang 'bru ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dag gzhi gang dag las skyes pa de dag ni nyes pa'i gzhi dag ste /
translated: The bases of faults are those things from which faults arise, such as quarrels, slander, and so on.

original: gang gi tshe gtong bar mi byed na de'i tshe yang phyogs mthun zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gtong bar mi byed na de'i tshe yang phyogs mthun zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: If one does not give up those bases, then at that time, it is said that one is similar to those who are not celibate.

original: de bzhin du gal te gzhan dag gi khri dang khri'u dag la nan gyis 'dug pa dang / gal te rdeg par byed pa dang / gal te gzas par byed pa dang / gal te rnam par 'tshe bar byed pa dang / gal te gnod sbyin pa gu la yin no zhes bya bas 'jigs par byed pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te gzhan dag gi khri dang khri'u dag la nan gyis 'dug pa dang / gal te rdeg par byed pa dang / gal te gzas par byed pa dang / gal te rnam par 'tshe bar byed pa dang / gal te gnod sbyin pa gu la yin no zhes bya bas 'jigs par byed pa dang /
translated: Similarly, if one sits down on the seats or beds of others by force, or if one strikes them, or if one threatens them, or if one harms them, or if one frightens them, saying, “I am a yakṣa,”🔽or if one, out of anger, makes a vow of silence toward an ascetic, then at that time, it is said that one is similar to those who are not celibate.

original: gal te khros pas brtul zhugs can la zan med par byed na de'i tshe yang phyogs dang mthun pa nyid do zhes re re la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te khros pas brtul zhugs can la zan med par byed na de'i tshe yang phyogs dang mthun pa nyid do zhes re re la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied to each case.

original: 'di la zan yod pa ma yin pas zan med pa ste //
analyzed: 'di la zan yod pa ma yin pas zan med pa ste //
translated: This is because there is no food here, it is without food.

original: zan gcod par byed na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zan gcod par byed na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: “if one is fasting.”

original: phan par 'dod pas ni nyes pa med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir khros pas zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
analyzed: phan par 'dod pas ni nyes pa med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir khros pas zhes bya ba smos pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “if angry” is stated by the author to show that there is no fault if one is motivated by a desire to help.

original: gzhan yang ngal ba la 'phul ba dang / gal te rgyal ni rgyal po ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ngal ba la 'phul ba dang / gal te rgyal ni rgyal po ste /
translated: Moreover, if one is urging someone to undertake a difficult task,🔽if one is offering a gift to a king,🔽if one is acting intentionally,🔽if one is speaking in order to stop someone from engaging in nonvirtue,🔽if one is speaking in order to stop someone from engaging in a wrong view,

original: rgyal po la chom rkun pa 'bul bar byed pa dang / bsams bzhin du ni blo sngon du btang ba'o //🔽gal te khyod ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyal po la chom rkun pa 'bul bar byed pa dang / bsams bzhin du ni blo sngon du btang ba'o // gal te khyod ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa ma yin no //
translated: if one is speaking in order to stop someone from engaging in a wrong livelihood,🔽if one is speaking in order to stop someone from engaging in a wrong practice of austerity,🔽if one is speaking in order to stop someone from engaging in a wrong view of the fruits of past deeds and of the future world,🔽if one is speaking in order to stop someone from engaging in a wrong view of the Buddha,🔽if one is speaking in order to stop someone from engaging in a wrong view of the Dharma,🔽if one is speaking in order to stop someone from engaging in a wrong view of the Saṅgha,

original: khyod kyi mkhan po yang tshul khrims 'chal ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gyod pa'i gnas dag brjod pa dang / gal te @90a * //
analyzed: khyod kyi mkhan po yang tshul khrims 'chal ba yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'gyod pa'i gnas dag brjod pa dang / gal te @90a * //
translated: if one is speaking in order to stop someone from engaging in a wrong view of the precepts of the training,🔽if one is speaking in order to stop someone from engaging in a wrong view of the precepts of individual liberation,🔽if one is speaking in order to stop someone from engaging in a wrong view of the precepts of the monastic code,🔽if one is speaking in order to stop someone from engaging in a wrong view of the precepts of the bodhisattva,🔽if one is speaking in order to stop someone from engaging in a wrong view of the precepts of the pratyekabuddha,🔽if one is speaking in order to stop someone from engaging in a wrong view of the precepts of the śrāvaka,🔽if one is speaking in order to stop someone from engaging in a wrong view of the precepts of the ascetic,🔽if one is speaking in order to stop someone from engaging in a wrong view of the precepts of the upāsaka,

original: 'tshir bar byed pa dang / gal te g-ya' sgog par byed pa dang zhes 'tshir ba dang g-ya' sgog par yang byed ces bya ba 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'tshir bar byed pa dang / gal te g-ya' sgog par byed pa dang zhes 'tshir ba dang g-ya' sgog par yang byed ces bya ba 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: if one is speaking in order to stop someone from engaging in a wrong view of the precepts of the upāsikā,🔽if one is speaking in order to stop someone from engaging in a wrong view of the precepts of the śikṣamāṇā,🔽if one is speaking in order to stop someone from engaging in a wrong view of the precepts of the śrāmaṇerī,

original: gal te nags su mes gtong bar byed pa dang / gal te 'bras ma smin pa brtol bar byed pa dang / gal te yan lag gcod par byed pa dang ; gal te yan lag 'bigs bar byed na de'i tshe yang phyogs dang mthun pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te nags su mes gtong bar byed pa dang / gal te 'bras ma smin pa brtol bar byed pa dang / gal te yan lag gcod par byed pa dang ; gal te yan lag 'bigs bar byed na de'i tshe yang phyogs dang mthun pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If one sets fire to a forest, if one opens an unripe fruit, if one cuts a limb, or if one pierces a limb, then it should be understood that it is similar to the case of the directions.🔽The text of the Vinaya on the topic of killing

original: nan 'chir ba'i gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
analyzed: nan 'chir ba'i gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
translated: says:

original: dge slong rnams kyis dge slong dgon pa ba zhig bos te /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis dge slong dgon pa ba zhig bos te /
translated: “Monks, some monks called out to a monk in the forest:

original: dgon pa pa khyim bdag de dge 'dun dbyar gnas pa la gos dag da ltar me 'bul la khyod kyang khyim der 'gro bas khyod kyis bzlog pa yin snyam zhes dris pa dang / des smras pa /
analyzed: dgon pa pa khyim bdag de dge 'dun dbyar gnas pa la gos dag da ltar me 'bul la khyod kyang khyim der 'gro bas khyod kyis bzlog pa yin snyam zhes dris pa dang / des smras pa /
translated: ‘Forest monk, the householder is now offering robes to the saṅgha who are staying in the rainy season. You are going to that house, so you should stop him.’

original: shes ldan dag ma bzlog go //
analyzed: shes ldan dag ma bzlog go //
translated: He said, ‘Sirs, I did not stop him.’

original: de dag na re 'di mi smras deng la sgo 'phar gyis 'tshir shig ces smras pa dang / de sgo 'phar gyis btsir ba na shi nas de dag 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ;
analyzed: de dag na re 'di mi smras deng la sgo 'phar gyis 'tshir shig ces smras pa dang / de sgo 'phar gyis btsir ba na shi nas de dag 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ;
translated: When he was crushed by the door, he died. They felt regret and the Bhagavān said,

original: pham pa'i ltung ba ni med de /
analyzed: pham pa'i ltung ba ni med de /
translated: “There is no defeat,

original: dman pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dman pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: but there is a serious offense.”

original: g-ya' sgog pa la sogs pa gzhung ni /
analyzed: g-ya' sgog pa la sogs pa gzhung ni /
translated: The text on scratching, farting, and so on

original: bcu bdun sde rnams kyis ga ga tshil byas pa nas /
analyzed: bcu bdun sde rnams kyis ga ga tshil byas pa nas /
translated: is from the story of the group of seventeen who scratched their testicles

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: and the Bhagavān said,

original: yang dge slong gis ga ga tshil mi bya'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gis ga ga tshil mi bya'o //
translated: “A monk should not scratch his testicles.

original: byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If he does, he commits an offense entailing confession.”

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni rnam pa de lta bu gzhan dag la blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni rnam pa de lta bu gzhan dag la blta bar bya ste /
translated: The words “and so on” should be understood to refer to other similar cases.

original: dper na phran tshegs las nye dags sha za'i bu gcig zlos gar mkhan la btsongs pa nas /
analyzed: dper na phran tshegs las nye dags sha za'i bu gcig zlos gar mkhan la btsongs pa nas /
translated: For example, in the Kṣudraka Collection, when Upāli sold a son of a cannibal to an actor,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Bhagavān said,🔽“A monk should not sell a human being.

original: dge slong gis skra can btsong par mi bya'o//
analyzed: dge slong gis skra can btsong par mi bya'o//
translated: A monk should not sell his hair.

original: zhes bya ba sogs pa'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba sogs pa'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
translated: This is the text up to here.

original: nags mes gtong zhes bya ba'i gzhung ni 'dir dge slong dag nags tshal gyi nang du dong ste /
analyzed: nags mes gtong zhes bya ba'i gzhung ni 'dir dge slong dag nags tshal gyi nang du dong ste /
translated: The text “One should not set a forest fire” is as follows: Monks went into a forest

original: bsam gtan byed pa dang / drug sde rnams kyis rlung la brten nas nags kyi ngos gsum nas ni mes btang /
analyzed: bsam gtan byed pa dang / drug sde rnams kyis rlung la brten nas nags kyi ngos gsum nas ni mes btang /
translated: and practiced concentration. The group-of-six monks set a forest fire on three sides,

original: ngos gcig tu ni rang dag dong nas 'khod do ;
analyzed: ngos gcig tu ni rang dag dong nas 'khod do ;
translated: and on one side they themselves went and sat down.

original: ; dge slong rnams kyi sa nags kyi mes nags sreg cing 'byung ba mthong nas stan dag las langs te /
analyzed: ; dge slong rnams kyi sa nags kyi mes nags sreg cing 'byung ba mthong nas stan dag las langs te /
translated: The monks saw the forest burning with a forest fire and got up from their seats.

original: rings pa rings par dong ban drug sde rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: rings pa rings par dong ban drug sde rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The group-of-six monks said,🔽“You miserly ones, you should stop it like this.”

original: 'jungs pa dag khyer de ltar bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du rgya cher 'byung ba nas /
analyzed: 'jungs pa dag khyer de ltar bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du rgya cher 'byung ba nas /
