translated: If the value is incomplete, there is a minor offense.

original: mi ma yin pa rnams kyi yin na 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa rnams kyi yin na 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If you steal a golden garland for the sake of protecting non-humans, there is a serious offense.🔽If the value is complete, there is a serious offense.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi ma yin pa'o //
translated: If the value is incomplete, there is a minor offense.🔽If you steal a golden garland for the sake of protecting non-humans, there is a serious offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: If the value is complete, there is a serious offense.🔽If the value is incomplete, there is a minor offense.

original: skyes bu ma pham pa blun po de rang gi gos rnyed pa dag gis nyes pa spom po 'byung ngo zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu ma pham pa blun po de rang gi gos rnyed pa dag gis nyes pa spom po 'byung ngo zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If you steal a golden garland for the sake of protecting non-humans, there is a serious offense.🔽If the value is complete, there is a serious offense.🔽If the value is incomplete, there is a minor offense.🔽If you steal a golden garland for the sake of

original: ma byin zhes bya ba ni 'dir gzhung las /
analyzed: ma byin zhes bya ba ni 'dir gzhung las /
translated: As for not given, the text says:

original: skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning gzhan rnams kyis 'di la ma byin pa yin zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med dang ma ning gzhan rnams kyis 'di la ma byin pa yin zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: It is not given by others, men, women, or eunuchs.

original: 'di yang mi gzhan gyi sa zhes bya ba kho nas grub pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di yang mi gzhan gyi sa zhes bya ba kho nas grub pa yin mod kyi /
translated: This is also established by the phrase the property of another.

original: sngon byung ba la lci rten 'dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir yang smos pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon byung ba la lci rten 'dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir yang smos pa yin no //
translated: However, it is also mentioned to prevent the idea that it is light because it happened in the past.

original: rin thang tshang ba zhes bya ba ni gal te k'ar sh'a pa na bzhi cha tshang pa'o //
analyzed: rin thang tshang ba zhes bya ba ni gal te k'ar sh'a pa na bzhi cha tshang pa'o //
translated: The full value means if the full value of four karshapana coins is reached.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gtam gyi gzhi las //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gtam gyi gzhi las //
translated: Here, the text says:

original: ma sha ka gsum brkus na mthar 'gyur lags sam /
analyzed: ma sha ka gsum brkus na mthar 'gyur lags sam /
translated: If one steals three mashaka coins, is it a defeating offense?

original: bka' stsal pa //
analyzed: bka' stsal pa //
translated: The Buddha said:

original: gang na ma sha bcu gnyis la k'ar sh'a pa na yin na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang na ma sha bcu gnyis la k'ar sh'a pa na yin na 'gyur ro //
translated: If twelve mashaka coins make one karshapana coin, then it is.

original: ma sha ka lnga las lhag par brkus na pham par 'gyur ba ma lags par 'gyur ba lags sam //
analyzed: ma sha ka lnga las lhag par brkus na pham par 'gyur ba ma lags par 'gyur ba lags sam //
translated: If one steals more than five mashaka coins, is it not a defeating offense?

original: bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Buddha said:🔽If five mashaka coins make one karshapana coin, then it is.

original: gang na ma sha ka bzhi bcu la k'ar sh'a pa na yin na 'gyur zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang na ma sha ka bzhi bcu la k'ar sh'a pa na yin na 'gyur zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If forty māṣas equal one kārṣāpaṇa, then it is.

original: zhus pa las kyang /
analyzed: zhus pa las kyang /
translated: The Questions of Milinda also says:

original: dge slong gis ma sha ka lnga las lhag pa brkus na mtha' ma lags par 'gyur lags sam /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong gis ma sha ka lnga las lhag pa brkus na mtha' ma lags par 'gyur lags sam / bka' stsal pa /
translated: “If a bhikṣu steals more than five māṣas, does he commit a pārājika offense?”

original: gang na k'ar sh'a pa na rin thang che ba yin na 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang na k'ar sh'a pa na rin thang che ba yin na 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: “If the value of the kārṣāpaṇa is high, then it is.”

original: de ltar na rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: Thus, this does not contradict the explanation in the Bases of Discipline that

original: ma sha ka lnga'am ma sha ka lnga las lhag pa zhes bya ba sogs pa 'byung ba dang yang mi 'gal ba yin te //
analyzed: ma sha ka lnga'am ma sha ka lnga las lhag pa zhes bya ba sogs pa 'byung ba dang yang mi 'gal ba yin te //
translated: “five māṣas or more than five māṣas” is the amount that constitutes a pārājika offense.

original: de ni k'ar sh'a pa na'i ba zhi cha'i mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni k'ar sh'a pa na'i ba zhi cha'i mtshon pa yin no //
translated: This is an illustration of the value of a kārṣāpaṇa.

original: de'i se na ni rma bya'i bus ma sha ka nyi shu la k'ar sh'a pa nar byas so //
analyzed: de'i se na ni rma bya'i bus ma sha ka nyi shu la k'ar sh'a pa nar byas so //
translated: In his commentary on the Treasury of Abhidharma, Sthiramati says that twenty māṣas equal one kārṣāpaṇa.

original: deng sang ni ma sha ka bcu drug la k'ar sh'a pa na yin pas ma sha ka bzhi sa mthar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: deng sang ni ma sha ka bcu drug la k'ar sh'a pa na yin pas ma sha ka bzhi sa mthar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Nowadays, sixteen māṣas equal one kārṣāpaṇa, so four māṣas is the minimum amount that constitutes a pārājika offense.

original: ma sha ka zhes bya ba ni pa na la bya'o //
analyzed: ma sha ka zhes bya ba ni pa na la bya'o //
translated: The term māṣa refers to a type of weight.

original: k'a ra sh'a pa na zhes bya ba ni na na ka la bya'o //
analyzed: k'a ra sh'a pa na zhes bya ba ni na na ka la bya'o //
translated: One kārṣāpaṇa is equal to sixteen māṣas.

original: zhus pa las ni /
analyzed: zhus pa las ni /
translated: The Inquiry of Ugra says:

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis ma sha ka lnga brkus na mthar 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa'i ma sha ka ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis ma sha ka lnga brkus na mthar 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa'i ma sha ka ji lta bu lags /
translated: “Reverend Blessed One, you have said that stealing five coins is a pārājika offense. What is the value of one coin?”

original: ma sha ka nyi shu lan na ka yin no //
analyzed: ma sha ka nyi shu lan na ka yin no //
translated: “Twenty māṣas is one kārṣāpaṇa.”

original: ma sha ka ji ltar bu lags //
analyzed: ma sha ka ji ltar bu lags //
translated: “What is the value of one māṣa?”

original: ka ka ni bzhi la bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: ka ka ni bzhi la bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: “Four kākini is one māṣa.”

original: mis bdag gir byas zhes bya ba ni bdag gir byas pa nyid bdag gir byas pa yin te /
analyzed: mis bdag gir byas zhes bya ba ni bdag gir byas pa nyid bdag gir byas pa yin te /
translated: “Owned by a human” means owned by a human.

original: mis rdzas gang la 'di ni bdag gi yin no zhes blos yongs su gzung ba zhes bya ba'i tha @92b tshig go //
analyzed: mis rdzas gang la 'di ni bdag gi yin no zhes blos yongs su gzung ba zhes bya ba'i tha @92b tshig go //
translated: The substance that a human has mentally appropriated, thinking, “This is mine,” is what is meant.

original: de ltar byas na bdag pos nor yod par shes pa'i rdzas de bdag po dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don du gnas la /
analyzed: de ltar byas na bdag pos nor yod par shes pa'i rdzas de bdag po dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don du gnas la /
translated: In this way, the meaning of the statement “The substance that the owner knows to be his” is that the substance is owned by the owner.

original: nor yod par ma shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nor yod par ma shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not mean that the owner does not know that he owns the substance.

original: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: The text of the analysis of this topic in the Abhidharmakośabhāṣya is as follows:

original: gter ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gter ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of treasure:

original: bdag po dang bcas pa dang bdag po med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po dang bcas pa dang bdag po med pa'o //
translated: with an owner and without an owner.

original: dge slong gis gsang sngags brjod cing de 'di snyam du bdag po med pa'i gter ni bdag la shog shig / bdag po dang bcas pa'i gter ni ma yin no snyam pa'i bar du sems pa las bdag po med pa'i gter 'ong la /
analyzed: dge slong gis gsang sngags brjod cing de 'di snyam du bdag po med pa'i gter ni bdag la shog shig / bdag po dang bcas pa'i gter ni ma yin no snyam pa'i bar du sems pa las bdag po med pa'i gter 'ong la /
translated: If a monk recites a mantra and thinks, “May a treasure without an owner come to me, not a treasure with an owner,” and a treasure without an owner comes,

original: ji srid du mig lam du mi snang bar 'ong gi bar du ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro mig lam du snang bar 'ong ba na ni brkus pa yin par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ji srid du mig lam du mi snang bar 'ong gi bar du ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro mig lam du snang bar 'ong ba na ni brkus pa yin par brjod par bya ste /
translated: as long as it does not appear in his field of vision, he commits an offense of wrong conduct. When it appears in his field of vision, it should be said that he has stolen it.

original: rin thang brtsi bar bya'o //
analyzed: rin thang brtsi bar bya'o //
translated: The value of the treasure should be assessed.

original: dngos po tshang na nyes ba sgom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po tshang na nyes ba sgom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If the value is complete, he commits a serious offense.

original: ma tshang na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: ma tshang na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin te /
translated: If the value is incomplete, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'dir ni bdag pos nor yod par shes pa ni bdag po dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni bdag pos nor yod par shes pa ni bdag po dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, a treasure that is known to have an owner is called “with an owner.”

original: nor yod par ma shes pa ni bdag po med pa ste ;
analyzed: nor yod par ma shes pa ni bdag po med pa ste ;
translated: A treasure that is not known to have an owner is “without an owner.”

original: dper na yul gyi bdag po 'am gter sped pa'i rigs brgyud kyis ma tshor ba'i nor lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dper na yul gyi bdag po 'am gter sped pa'i rigs brgyud kyis ma tshor ba'i nor lta bu yin no //
translated: For example, it is like wealth that is not known by the king or the family line that has hidden the treasure.

original: gang gis rdzas sbas pa de rabs chad la de rgyal pos kyang ma shes pas bdag po med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis rdzas sbas pa de rabs chad la de rgyal pos kyang ma shes pas bdag po med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the one who has hidden the wealth is not known by the king, it is called “without an owner.”

original: 'o na nor yod par ma shes kyang bdag po las las kyi lam ldang par 'dod pa yin na ci'i phyir pham par mi 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: 'o na nor yod par ma shes kyang bdag po las las kyi lam ldang par 'dod pa yin na ci'i phyir pham par mi 'gyur zhe na //
translated: But if one desires to rise from the karmic path of stealing, even though one does not know that the wealth exists, why does one not become a defeated one?

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here it is explained:

original: dper na ma sha ka lnga bas chung ba brkus pa dang 'dra bar las kyi lam chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na ma sha ka lnga bas chung ba brkus pa dang 'dra bar las kyi lam chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the karmic path is small, like stealing less than five māsakas.

original: 'dir las kyi lam yang ci'i phyir chung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir las kyi lam yang ci'i phyir chung ba yin zhe na /
translated: Here, why is the karmic path small?

original: bdag gir bya ba ma skyes pa nyid kyis brkus pa'i yan lag ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gir bya ba ma skyes pa nyid kyis brkus pa'i yan lag ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the branch of stealing is incomplete due to the mere non-arising of ownership.

original: ci'i phyir bdag gir bya ba med na brkus par 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag gir bya ba med na brkus par 'gyur zhe na //
translated: Why does one become a thief if there is no ownership?

original: rdzas de bdag po de dang 'brel ba nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas de bdag po de dang 'brel ba nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the substance remains in a state of connection with that owner.

original: 'dir shes par byed pa'i gzhung ni 'dul byed las //
analyzed: 'dir shes par byed pa'i gzhung ni 'dul byed las //
translated: The text that causes understanding here is the Vinayaksudraka:🔽A certain monk who was sick said to his attendants, “Prepare three types of pastries and barley soup, offer them to the saṅgha and I will also use them.”

original: dge slong nad pa zhig yod pa des nad g-yog rnams la khur ba sna gsum pa dang nas thug dag sgrubs shig dang / dge 'dun la yang 'bul bar bya zhing bdag gis kyang spyad par bya'o zhes smras na sdes de rnams 'god pa'i rgyu dag byin pa dang /
analyzed: dge slong nad pa zhig yod pa des nad g-yog rnams la khur ba sna gsum pa dang nas thug dag sgrubs shig dang / dge 'dun la yang 'bul bar bya zhing bdag gis kyang spyad par bya'o zhes smras na sdes de rnams 'god pa'i rgyu dag byin pa dang /
translated: The saṅgha gave them the causes for preparing those.

original: de dag 'di snyam du bdag cag la khur ba sna gsum pa dang nas thug ci dgos kyi /
analyzed: de dag 'di snyam du bdag cag la khur ba sna gsum pa dang nas thug ci dgos kyi /
translated: They thought, “What do we need with three types of pastries and barley soup?

original: bdag cag gi 'di la khur ba sna gsum dang nas thug dag byin la gser gyi dong tshe dag bgo bar bya'o snyam du sems pa @93a * //
analyzed: bdag cag gi 'di la khur ba sna gsum dang nas thug dag byin la gser gyi dong tshe dag bgo bar bya'o snyam du sems pa @93a * //
translated: Let us give the saṅgha gold coins and distribute them.”

original: las re zhig na de dag 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: las re zhig na de dag 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then they developed regret and the Bhagavān said,

original: pham pa'i ltung ba ni med de /
analyzed: pham pa'i ltung ba ni med de /
translated: “There is no offense entailing expulsion.

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It becomes a serious transgression.”

original: 'dir dge 'dun gang la rdzas de phul ba de dag gis ma shes pa'i phyir bdag gir bya ba med pa ni pham pa mi skyed pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir dge 'dun gang la rdzas de phul ba de dag gis ma shes pa'i phyir bdag gir bya ba med pa ni pham pa mi skyed pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the reason why the defeat is not incurred is that the Saṅgha to whom the substance is offered does not know about it, and not for any other reason.

original: 'on kyang dge 'dun la 'bul lo zhes smras pa'i phyir de ni sbyin bdag las brkus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang dge 'dun la 'bul lo zhes smras pa'i phyir de ni sbyin bdag las brkus pa yin gyi /
translated: But since he said, “I offer to the Saṅgha,” he stole it from the donor.

original: dge 'dun las ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dge 'dun las ma yin no zhe na /
translated: He did not steal it from the Saṅgha.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te re zhig dge 'dun la byin no zhes blos brtul nas de dag gis bgos nas de'i tshe sbyin pa po las brkus so zhes bya ba'i rtog pa'i skabs med pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te re zhig dge 'dun la byin no zhes blos brtul nas de dag gis bgos nas de'i tshe sbyin pa po las brkus so zhes bya ba'i rtog pa'i skabs med pa yin te /
translated: If he has the thought, “I give to the Saṅgha,” and they distribute it, then at that time there is no opportunity for the thought, “I stole it from the donor.”

original: don gyis na des rdzas de yongs su btang ba yin no //
analyzed: don gyis na des rdzas de yongs su btang ba yin no //
translated: In fact, he has given away that substance.

original: de lta bas na 'di dge 'dun la 'bul lo zhes bya ba'i tshig ni brim pa'i bsam pa yin par rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di dge 'dun la 'bul lo zhes bya ba'i tshig ni brim pa'i bsam pa yin par rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the words “I offer to the Saṅgha” should be understood to mean the thought of distribution.

original: dge 'dun la dbul lo zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun la brim mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge 'dun la dbul lo zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun la brim mo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “I offer to the Saṅgha” means “I distribute to the Saṅgha.”

original: de kho na'i phyir dge 'dun la zhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de kho na'i phyir dge 'dun la zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: For that reason alone, it is said, “for the sake of the Saṅgha.”

original: gzhan du na ni dge 'dun gyi phyir zhes yang dag par sbyin pa'i gzhi smra ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni dge 'dun gyi phyir zhes yang dag par sbyin pa'i gzhi smra ba'i rigs so //
translated: Otherwise, it would be correct to say, “for the sake of the donor.”

original: de lta bas na dge 'dun kho na las brkus pa yin gyi sbyin pa po las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dge 'dun kho na las brkus pa yin gyi sbyin pa po las ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is only from the Saṅgha that the theft is committed, not from the donor.

original: sbyin pa po las brkus pa yin na ni pham par thal bar 'gyur ba yin pas nyes pa sbom por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa po las brkus pa yin na ni pham par thal bar 'gyur ba yin pas nyes pa sbom por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the theft is from the donor, then it would follow that there would be a defeat, and it would not be a serious violation.

original: gal te 'dir nyes pa sbom por zhes gsungs pa ni sbyor ba la yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'dir nyes pa sbom por zhes gsungs pa ni sbyor ba la yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the serious violation here is in the preparation,

original: de ni de gtams pa brkus pa yin te 'dir thag bcad pa brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de gtams pa brkus pa yin te 'dir thag bcad pa brkus pa yin no //
translated: then it is the theft of what has been entrusted to the Saṅgha, and here it is the theft of what has been decided.

original: thag ma bcad par ni bgo bar yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: thag ma bcad par ni bgo bar yang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not appropriate to distribute what has not been decided.

original: de lta bas na dge 'dun gyis ma shes pa'i phyir bdag gir bya ba med pas nyes pa sbom po zhes gsungs pa 'di nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dge 'dun gyis ma shes pa'i phyir bdag gir bya ba med pas nyes pa sbom po zhes gsungs pa 'di nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is definite: it is said to be a serious violation because the Saṅgha does not know, and there is no appropriation.

original: 'o na yang dge slong ma gang gis skye dgu mang po'i rnyed pa bsdos pa bdag gir byed na ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa de ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: 'o na yang dge slong ma gang gis skye dgu mang po'i rnyed pa bsdos pa bdag gir byed na ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa de ji lta bu yin /
translated: But it is said, “If any nun appropriates the property of many people, she commits an offense.”

original: 'dir skye dgu mang po zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma'i dge 'dun yin par dgongs so//
analyzed: 'dir skye dgu mang po zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma'i dge 'dun yin par dgongs so//
translated: Here, “many people” means the community of nuns.🔽Thus, the Bhiksuni-vinaya states:

original: de ltar yang dge slong ma'i rnam par 'byed pa las kyang dge slong ma sbom dga' mos btsun mo phreng ldan ma la bcom ldan 'das kyis kho mo cag la zla mtshan gyi 'dzag snod gnang na de yang kho mo cag la mi bdog gi de sbyin pa'i
analyzed: de ltar yang dge slong ma'i rnam par 'byed pa las kyang dge slong ma sbom dga' mos btsun mo phreng ldan ma la bcom ldan 'das kyis kho mo cag la zla mtshan gyi 'dzag snod gnang na de yang kho mo cag la mi bdog gi de sbyin pa'i
translated: The nun Upacala said to Queen Mallika, “The Blessed One has given us a receptacle for menstrual discharge, but we do not have one. It would be appropriate to give us one.”

original: rigs so zhes smras pa dang / des gos sgrom gang dge slong ma thams cad @93b la byin na sbom dga' mos de bdag gir byas so //
analyzed: rigs so zhes smras pa dang / des gos sgrom gang dge slong ma thams cad @93b la byin na sbom dga' mos de bdag gir byas so //
translated: She gave a box of clothes to all the nuns, but Upacala appropriated it for herself.

original: dge slong ma rnams kyis thos nas btsun mo phreng ldan ma la smras pa dang / bdag gis khyed la gos sgrom gang sbom dga' mo'i lag tu byin no zhes bya ba'i bar du smras so //
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kyis thos nas btsun mo phreng ldan ma la smras pa dang / bdag gis khyed la gos sgrom gang sbom dga' mo'i lag tu byin no zhes bya ba'i bar du smras so //
translated: The nuns heard about this and told Queen Mālādhara, who said, “I gave a box of clothing to Bhadrā.”

original: de nas dge slong ma rnams kyis sbom dga' mo la bslangs na de ma ster nas ltung byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin pa ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: de nas dge slong ma rnams kyis sbom dga' mo la bslangs na de ma ster nas ltung byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin pa ji lta bu yin /
translated: Then the nuns asked Bhadrā for the clothing, but she refused to give it to them.🔽The Buddha said, “You have committed a downfall.”

original: de lta bas na 'dir dge slong ma gang dag la byin pa de dag gis ma shes na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir dge slong ma gang dag la byin pa de dag gis ma shes na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur la /
translated: If the nuns to whom the clothing was given did not know about it, they committed a serious transgression.

original: shes shing thag bcad na pham par 'gyur ba yin na ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa de ci'i phyir yin pa smros shig /'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: shes shing thag bcad na pham par 'gyur ba yin na ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa de ci'i phyir yin pa smros shig /'dir bshad pa /
translated: If they knew about it and decided to keep it, they committed a defeating offense.

original: sbom dga' mos bcom ldan 'das kyis kho mo cag la gnang ngo zhes smras pa'i shan gyis bdag nyid la bsdos pa yin la /
analyzed: sbom dga' mos bcom ldan 'das kyis kho mo cag la gnang ngo zhes smras pa'i shan gyis bdag nyid la bsdos pa yin la /
translated: Bhadrā said, “The Blessed One has given it to me.”

original: btsun mo phreng ldan ma yang de dge 'dun gyi ched du slong ba ma yin par nges pa skyes pas des dge 'dun gyi phyir byin no //
analyzed: btsun mo phreng ldan ma yang de dge 'dun gyi ched du slong ba ma yin par nges pa skyes pas des dge 'dun gyi phyir byin no //
translated: Also, Queen Mālikā did not give it to the Saṅgha for the sake of the Saṅgha, but she gave it to the Saṅgha because she was certain that it was for the sake of the Saṅgha.

original: de'i phyir bdag gis 'di rnyed do snyam du nges par rtog pa'i dbang gis bdag gir byas kyang pham par rnam par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gis 'di rnyed do snyam du nges par rtog pa'i dbang gis bdag gir byas kyang pham par rnam par mi gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, although she appropriated it with the thought, “I will obtain this,” she was not established as having committed a root downfall.

original: 'o na yang dge slong ma gang gis dge 'dun gyi rnyed par bsdos pa gang zag bdag gir sngo bar byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes 'byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na yang dge slong ma gang gis dge 'dun gyi rnyed par bsdos pa gang zag bdag gir sngo bar byed na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes 'byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: But if a fully ordained nun appropriates for herself a gift intended for the Saṅgha, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: 'dir yang ma byin par len pa'i skyon med de /
analyzed: 'dir yang ma byin par len pa'i skyon med de /
translated: Here, there is no fault of stealing.

original: sbyin pa po mngon pa'i phyir dang / brku sems dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa po mngon pa'i phyir dang / brku sems dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the donor is manifest and because there is no thought of stealing.

original: snga ma shos ni shan gyis phyi ma sbyin pa por mngon pas bye brag yod do //
analyzed: snga ma shos ni shan gyis phyi ma sbyin pa por mngon pas bye brag yod do //
translated: The former is different from the latter because the donor is manifest.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa bdag gir bya ba ni bsdos pa bsgyur ba dang 'dra ba yin gyi bsdos pa bsgyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa bdag gir bya ba ni bsdos pa bsgyur ba dang 'dra ba yin gyi bsdos pa bsgyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The appropriation of that is like the transformation of a debt, but it is not the transformation of a debt.

original: gzhan yang bsdos pa ni dge slong dang thun mong ba yin la bdag gir byed pa ni thun mong ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bsdos pa ni dge slong dang thun mong ba yin la bdag gir byed pa ni thun mong ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, a debt is common to all monks, but appropriation is not common,

original: dge slong ma rnams kho na'i yin no //
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kho na'i yin no //
translated: because it is only for the nuns.

original: de bzhin du bsngos pa ni bdag gir ma byas pa bdag gir bya ba'i phyir bsngo ba yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsngos pa ni bdag gir ma byas pa bdag gir bya ba'i phyir bsngo ba yin la /
translated: Similarly, a dedication is a dedication for the purpose of appropriating that which has not been appropriated.

original: bdag gir byed pa ni rang gir byas pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: bdag gir byed pa ni rang gir byas pa nyid yin te /
translated: Appropriation is the act of making it one’s own.

original: khyad par ni de yin no //
analyzed: khyad par ni de yin no //
translated: This is the difference.

original: ha cang rgya cher byas pas chog go //
analyzed: ha cang rgya cher byas pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this extensive discussion.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir bdag pos nor yod par ma shes pa bdag po med pa'i gter gang yin pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir bdag pos nor yod par ma shes pa bdag po med pa'i gter gang yin pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Why does the Buddha say that stealing a treasure that belongs to no one,🔽when one does not know that it belongs to someone, is a serious offense,

original: dgon pa sus kyang ma bsnams pa na yod pa de brkus na 'di nyes pa sbom po zhes gsungs pa mi mngon zhe na /
analyzed: dgon pa sus kyang ma bsnams pa na yod pa de brkus na 'di nyes pa sbom po zhes gsungs pa mi mngon zhe na /
translated: as in the case of a treasure in an uninhabited forest?

original: mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is not tenable.

original: de na yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nyid kyis ma byin par len pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de na yongs su 'dzin pa med pa nyid kyis ma byin par len pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Since there is no ownership there, there is no stealing.

original: dper na byang gi sgra mi snyan @94a * //🔽gyi bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na byang gi sgra mi snyan @94a * // gyi bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like in Uttarakuru.

original: gal te brku sems skyes na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te brku sems skyes na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur te /
translated: If one generates the thought to steal, one commits a serious violation,

original: dngos gzhi'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis yan lag rnams 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis yan lag rnams 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the branches are complete through the main part of the thought.

original: dur khrod mi dbang bsos snyoms ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: dur khrod mi dbang bsos snyoms ma gtogs pa //
translated: Except for the charnel ground and the king’s property.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdzas de yang gal te dur khrod pa dang mi dbang ba'i bsod snyoms las gzhan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdzas de yang gal te dur khrod pa dang mi dbang ba'i bsod snyoms las gzhan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that if the object is from the charnel ground or the king’s property, it is not a downfall.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
translated: Here the text of Vinayaviniscaya reads:🔽“Monks, taking cloth from a charnel ground that is owned, or from a king’s property, is not a downfall.

original: dge slong rnams kyis yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa'i dur khrod nas gos ma byin pa dag len pa dang / rigs ngan dag na re btsun pa dag bdag cag mkhar lan gyi las cung zad ci bgyid pa de thams cad 'di'i phyir bgyid na /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa'i dur khrod nas gos ma byin pa dag len pa dang / rigs ngan dag na re btsun pa dag bdag cag mkhar lan gyi las cung zad ci bgyid pa de thams cad 'di'i phyir bgyid na /
translated: Some low caste people said, ‘O monks, we do all kinds of work for wages for his sake.

original: khyed kyis bdag gi gos 'phrog gam zhes de dag 'phya ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: khyed kyis bdag gi gos 'phrog gam zhes de dag 'phya ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong gis yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa'i dur khrod nas gos blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa'i dur khrod nas gos blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: A monk should not take robes from a cemetery with an owner.

original: gang zhig len par byed na dman pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no ;
analyzed: gang zhig len par byed na dman pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no ;
translated: If one takes them, it is a serious offense for a monk.

original: ; kha cig na re de la dur khrod rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ; kha cig na re de la dur khrod rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Some say there are two types of cemeteries:

original: 'di bdag kho na'i yin no zhes bdag gir byas pa dang / gnas yongs su 'dzin pas 'thob par nges pa'o //🔽'dir bdag gir byas pa rku na mthar 'gyur bar 'dod la /
analyzed: 'di bdag kho na'i yin no zhes bdag gir byas pa dang / gnas yongs su 'dzin pas 'thob par nges pa'o // 'dir bdag gir byas pa rku na mthar 'gyur bar 'dod la /
translated: one is marked as belonging to a particular person, and the other is obtained by the right of residence.

original: 'thob par nges pa zhig brkus na dman pa sbom por 'dod par bya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: 'thob par nges pa zhig brkus na dman pa sbom por 'dod par bya'o zhes zer te /
translated: Here, if one steals what is marked as belonging to a particular person, it is considered a serious offense.🔽If one steals what is obtained by the right of residence, it is considered a serious offense for a monk.

original: 'thob par nges pa ni mkhar lan byed pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: 'thob par nges pa ni mkhar lan byed pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: What is obtained by the right of residence is due to the power of repaying a debt and so on.

original: de'i phyir rigs ngan gang dag gis rdzas de 'thob par nges pa de dag gis de yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs ngan gang dag gis rdzas de 'thob par nges pa de dag gis de yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, those of low caste who are certain to obtain that substance are those who have possession of it.

original: 'o na 'thob par nges pa nyid kyang sho gam dang 'dra bar pham par 'gyur mod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na 'thob par nges pa nyid kyang sho gam dang 'dra bar pham par 'gyur mod ce na /
translated: But if it is certain that one will obtain it, then it is like a toll and one will be defeated.

original: de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste /
translated: That is not correct.

original: sho gam ni bskyis pa dang 'dra bar gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: sho gam ni bskyis pa dang 'dra bar gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: The toll is like a debt and must be paid.

original: dur khrod kyi rdzas ni phongs pa nyid yin pas sbyin par bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: dur khrod kyi rdzas ni phongs pa nyid yin pas sbyin par bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: But the substance of the charnel ground is like a gift because it is for the poor.

original: de'i ched du snying brtse ba med par mkhar lan la sogs pa byed du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i ched du snying brtse ba med par mkhar lan la sogs pa byed du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of that, one is made to do usury and so on without compassion.

original: de lta bas na gnas yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na gnas yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is because of the possession of the place.

original: 'thob par nges pa nyid yin du zin kyang 'thob pa dang ldan pa rnams la rdzas de lag tu ma thob pas 'di ni bdag gi'o zhes bdag gir byed pa'i blo med pa'i phyir ltung ba chung ba yin par bstan to /
analyzed: 'thob par nges pa nyid yin du zin kyang 'thob pa dang ldan pa rnams la rdzas de lag tu ma thob pas 'di ni bdag gi'o zhes bdag gir byed pa'i blo med pa'i phyir ltung ba chung ba yin par bstan to /
translated: Even if it is certain that one will obtain it, since the substance is not in the hand of those who possess it, it is taught that the downfall is slight because there is no thought of possession, thinking, this is mine.

original: slob dpon gyi zhal nas gal te de lta yin na bdag gir byas pa zhes bya ba kho nas grub pas dur khrod pa zhes bstan pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi zhal nas gal te de lta yin na bdag gir byas pa zhes bya ba kho nas grub pas dur khrod pa zhes bstan pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Master says: If that is so, then since it is established by the mere phrase “that which is appropriated,” it would be meaningless to teach “charnel ground.”

original: @94b de lta bas na 'jig rten na ni dur khrod kyi rdzas ni tha chad yin pas mngon par zhe na pa shin tu zhan pa'i phyir dman pa sbom por 'gyur bar bshad pa'i ched du dur khrod pa zhes gsungs so zhes 'chad de /
analyzed: @94b de lta bas na 'jig rten na ni dur khrod kyi rdzas ni tha chad yin pas mngon par zhe na pa shin tu zhan pa'i phyir dman pa sbom por 'gyur bar bshad pa'i ched du dur khrod pa zhes gsungs so zhes 'chad de /
translated: Therefore, since in the world charnel ground substances are the most vile, it is said that they are inferior and coarse in order to explain that strong aversion for them is weak.

original: dngos po tshang na de chung ba yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po tshang na de chung ba yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: If the substance is complete, it should be understood that it is small.

original: mi dbang ba'i bsod snyoms ni dbang ba ma yin pa zhes bya ste /🔽dper na dge tshul rnags kyi'o zhes sbyin par byed pa na dge slong gis de'i nang du gtogs par byas te /
analyzed: mi dbang ba'i bsod snyoms ni dbang ba ma yin pa zhes bya ste / dper na dge tshul rnags kyi'o zhes sbyin par byed pa na dge slong gis de'i nang du gtogs par byas te /
translated: Food not belonging to oneself is called “not belonging to oneself.”

original: len par byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: len par byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when a novice monk gives, a fully ordained monk includes it in his own and takes it.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
translated: Here the text is from the Vinaya.

original: dge slong gis 'bras chan gyi bsod snyoms mi dbang ba blangs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong gis 'bras chan gyi bsod snyoms mi dbang ba blangs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dman pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dman pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: “It is a serious offense for a monk.”

original: de bzhin du phye'i bsod snyoms dang / nas chan gyi bsod snyoms dang / bca' ba'i bsod snyoms la sogs pa thams cad la yang dman pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du phye'i bsod snyoms dang / nas chan gyi bsod snyoms dang / bca' ba'i bsod snyoms la sogs pa thams cad la yang dman pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, it is a serious offense for a monk to take a meal of flour, a meal of barley, a meal of cooked vegetables, and so on.

original: ci'i phyir mthar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mthar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it not a defeating offense?

original: 'dir lan bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir lan bshad pa /
translated: The answer is:

original: na na ka lta bu'i nor lan pa la zhen pa gang yin pa de lta bu kha zas la ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: na na ka lta bu'i nor lan pa la zhen pa gang yin pa de lta bu kha zas la ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: It is not like the case of a monk who is attached to wealth, such as a house.

original: bsam pa zhan pa'i phyir des /
analyzed: bsam pa zhan pa'i phyir des /
translated: Because the intention is weak.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gi phyir nyes pa sbom po kho nar mngon gyi rin thang ma tshang ba'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang gi phyir nyes pa sbom po kho nar mngon gyi rin thang ma tshang ba'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: It is only a serious offense, not a defeating offense, because it is a matter of worldly convention, not because of the value of the food.

original: rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ma gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the Buddha did not say, “The value of the food should be calculated.”

original: gzhan gyi don ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi don du ma gsungs pa'i phyir dang / brkus par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don ma yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi don du ma gsungs pa'i phyir dang / brkus par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not because it is not for the benefit of others, because it is not taught for the benefit of others, and because it is not stealing.

original: mi dbang bar len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dbang bar len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is taken without a master.

original: bsams pa zhes bya ba ni ma bsams pa las ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsams pa zhes bya ba ni ma bsams pa las ltung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is said that if one does not intend to steal, there is no downfall.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
translated: Here is the text from the Vinaya:

original: dge slong gis gros rdol ba ma byin par blangs te ;
analyzed: dge slong gis gros rdol ba ma byin par blangs te ;
translated: A monk took a piece of cloth without it being given to him.

original: des de phye ba dang de'i nang nas rin thang chen po ri ba'i snam bu zhig byung nas de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: des de phye ba dang de'i nang nas rin thang chen po ri ba'i snam bu zhig byung nas de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: He opened it and a valuable cloth appeared. He felt regret, and the Blessed One said:

original: gos rdol ba'i rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gos rdol ba'i rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The value of the torn cloth should be assessed.

original: gang de nyid ces bya ba ni gang kho na mngon par byas pa de nyid gal te yin na'o//
analyzed: gang de nyid ces bya ba ni gang kho na mngon par byas pa de nyid gal te yin na'o//
translated: That very one means that if it is the very one that was intended.

original: 'dra bar 'khrul bas ma bsams pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dra bar 'khrul bas ma bsams pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not the case that there is no downfall if one is confused by similarity, this is the meaning.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /
translated: Here, the text is the question:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis shing pa la las bgyis pa'i gos rku bar 'tshal la /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis shing pa la las bgyis pa'i gos rku bar 'tshal la /
translated: “Venerable! If a monk wishes to steal cloth made from cotton tree down

original: des gso ras brkus na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: des gso ras brkus na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: and he steals a blanket, what is the offense?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: He said:

original: dman pa sbom por 'gyur ro //🔽'o na de ma bsams @95a * //
analyzed: dman pa sbom por 'gyur ro // 'o na de ma bsams @95a * //
translated: “It is a serious offense for a monk.”

original: pa yin mod ce na /
analyzed: pa yin mod ce na /
translated: “But he did not think of it as a blanket.”

original: gal te de lta yin du zin kyang 'on kyang 'di brku'o snyam du'i bsam pa yod pa'i phyir bsam pa nyid yin pa snyam du dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta yin du zin kyang 'on kyang 'di brku'o snyam du'i bsam pa yod pa'i phyir bsam pa nyid yin pa snyam du dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Even though that is so, since the thought ‘I will steal this’ is present, it is thought.”

original: de lta bas na de bsal ba'i phyir smos pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de bsal ba'i phyir smos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in order to eliminate that doubt, he said:

original: 'dir yang shing bal las byas pa'i brku ba'i sbyor ba las sbom por gsungs kyi gso ras la ni ltung ba med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang shing bal las byas pa'i brku ba'i sbyor ba las sbom por gsungs kyi gso ras la ni ltung ba med pa kho na'o //
translated: “Here, a serious offense is declared for the preparation of stealing cloth made from cotton tree down, but there is no offense for a blanket.

original: de la yang gal te brku ba'i sems bskyed na dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du ltung ba ma bzlog pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la yang gal te brku ba'i sems bskyed na dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du ltung ba ma bzlog pa nyid yin no //
translated: If he generates the thought to steal it, then the offense is not averted, just as with the object.”

original: sbyor ba gcig pu yis zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig pu yis zhes bya ba las /
translated: “By a single preparation” means:

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
translated: Here the treatise is the Vinaya Kṣudraka-vastu,🔽which states:

original: dge slong gis dge slong la smras pa //
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong la smras pa //
translated: A monk said to another monk,

original: tshe dang ldan pa tshur shog / chung ngu chung du nas ma byin par blangs na ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa tshur shog / chung ngu chung du nas ma byin par blangs na ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Venerable, come! If you steal something small, there will be no downfall.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sbyor ba gcig la rin thang brtsi bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig la rin thang brtsi bar bya'o //
translated: “The value should be calculated for a single action.

original: dngos po tshang na mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po tshang na mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the object is complete, there is a root downfall.

original: ma tshang na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: ma tshang na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If it is incomplete, there is a serious violation.”

original: bdag gi don du zhes bya ba ni rang gi ched du'o ;
analyzed: bdag gi don du zhes bya ba ni rang gi ched du'o ;
translated: “For one’s own sake” means for oneself.

original: gzhan gyi ched du ni ltung ba chung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ched du ni ltung ba chung ba nyid yin no //
translated: “For the sake of others” means there is a minor downfall.🔽Here the treatise is the Questions of Revata,

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /
translated: which states:

analyzed: gnas gang nas bskyod pa nyid kyi rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //

original: dad pas rgyal ba'i ring bsrel rku //
analyzed: dad pas rgyal ba'i ring bsrel rku //

analyzed: de min zhes bya ba ni gal te des dad pa'i rgyus ni sangs rgyas kyi ring bsrel rku ba ma yin na de'i tshe bsnyil bar bya ba yin no //
translated: But if one steals them through lack of faith, one is expelled.

analyzed: 'tsho ba'i phyir rku na ni mthar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /

analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis ston pa'i ring bsrel brku ba'i sems kyis rku bar bgyid na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “Venerable! If a monk steals the relics of the Teacher with the intention to steal, what does he become?”

analyzed: nye ba 'khor gal te 'tsho ba'i bsam pas brku la gal te dngos po tshad na pham par 'gyur ro//
translated: “Upāli! If he steals with the intention to make a living and if the value is complete, he becomes one who is expelled.

original: dngos po ma tshang na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po ma tshang na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //

analyzed: mi brku'o snyam pa la rku 'phrog bgyid na cir 'gyur lags / bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa ji lta bu yin zhe na /

original: don de ni drang bar bya ba yin te /

original: // / bam po gsum pa /
analyzed: // / bam po gsum pa /

original: yan lag lhag ma nyams pas chung bar 'gyur //

original: rmi lam la sogs dag la nyes pa med //

translated: Likewise, if one destroys a net, a curtain, etc., which are attached to something, it is a minor offense.

original: mi dbang ba'i bsod snyoms zhes bya ba smos pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi tshul gyis zhes bya ba rgyu yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dbang ba'i bsod snyoms zhes bya ba smos pa ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi tshul gyis zhes bya ba rgyu yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The expression “alms which are not given” is in order to show that this is according to worldly convention.

original: gzhan gyi gos la byin bzhin spyod pa dang // sman dang sngags kyis sbyin du 'jug pa dang // sdug pa 'phrog phyir 'dam par byed pa dang // gzhan phyir blangs nas 'ged byed na yang 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gos la byin bzhin spyod pa dang // sman dang sngags kyis sbyin du 'jug pa dang // sdug pa 'phrog phyir 'dam par byed pa dang // gzhan phyir blangs nas 'ged byed na yang 'gyur //
translated: One commits a transgression by using the robe of another without permission, by having another give what one is to receive, by taking by force what belongs to another, and by dividing what has been dedicated to a group.

original: gzhan gyi gos la phongs pa med par 'thob pa bzhin du longs spyod na chung ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi gos la phongs pa med par 'thob pa bzhin du longs spyod na chung ba yin te /
translated: If one uses the robe of another without permission, it is a minor transgression.

original: longs spyod kyi snying po spyad pa'i phyir 'di ni rku ba dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: longs spyod kyi snying po spyad pa'i phyir 'di ni rku ba dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: Because one enjoys the essence of the robe, this is similar to stealing.

original: ma gnang bar longs spyad na kha na ma tho ba shin tu lci bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ma gnang bar longs spyad na kha na ma tho ba shin tu lci bar rig par bya'o //
translated: If one uses it without permission, one should understand that the transgression is very grave.

original: sngags dang sman gyi dbang du byas te sbyin du 'jug na yang chung ba yin no //🔽mgu bar bya ba'i phyir me tog la sogs pa gang byin pa de'i rgyus rnyed pa'i phyir bsam pa log pa byung na 'tsho ba log par gtogs pa'i nyes pa bslang ba yin te /
analyzed: sngags dang sman gyi dbang du byas te sbyin du 'jug na yang chung ba yin no // mgu bar bya ba'i phyir me tog la sogs pa gang byin pa de'i rgyus rnyed pa'i phyir bsam pa log pa byung na 'tsho ba log par gtogs pa'i nyes pa bslang ba yin te /
translated: If one gives it under the influence of mantra and medicine, it is a minor fault.

original: rku bar gtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rku bar gtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If one gives flowers, etc. for the sake of pleasing, and then, with a perverted intention, one uses the profit from that, one incurs the fault of perverted livelihood, but not the fault of stealing.

original: ci 'dod pa de rku'o snyam pa'i bsam pas 'dam par byed na yang chung ba kho nar 'gyur ro //🔽dge 'dun @97a * //
analyzed: ci 'dod pa de rku'o snyam pa'i bsam pas 'dam par byed na yang chung ba kho nar 'gyur ro // dge 'dun @97a * //
translated: If one gives it with the intention of stealing what is desired, it is a minor fault.

original: gyi ston mo'i ched du bya bar de ltar sbyin bdag las rdzas blangs nas gang zag rnams kyis 'god na chung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gyi ston mo'i ched du bya bar de ltar sbyin bdag las rdzas blangs nas gang zag rnams kyis 'god na chung ba nyid yin no //
translated: If one gives it to the Saṅgha for the sake of a feast, and then the individuals use it, it is a minor fault.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
translated: Here, the text of Vinītadeva states:

original: nad pas nad g-yog rnams kyi lag tu dge 'dun ston mo gsol ba'i phyir 'god pa'i rgyu dag byin pa dang de rnams kyis bgos pa nis sbom po'o zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: nad pas nad g-yog rnams kyi lag tu dge 'dun ston mo gsol ba'i phyir 'god pa'i rgyu dag byin pa dang de rnams kyis bgos pa nis sbom po'o zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The sick person gives the cause for the distribution of the Saṅgha feast to the hands of the nurses, and they distribute it.

original: 'dir ni bdag po dge 'dun gyis nor yod par ma shes pas sbom por gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir ni bdag po dge 'dun gyis nor yod par ma shes pas sbom por gsungs te /
translated: Here, the master, the Saṅgha, does not know that there is wealth, so it is said to be a grave sin.

original: pham pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pham pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a defeat.

original: phyogs bzhi'i 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi nor dag las //
analyzed: phyogs bzhi'i 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi nor dag las //
translated: If one steals the wealth of the noble assembly of the four directions,

original: phyogs bzhi po yi don du rku na nyams //🔽dur khrod sa ni yongs 'dzin bcas pa nas //
analyzed: phyogs bzhi po yi don du rku na nyams // dur khrod sa ni yongs 'dzin bcas pa nas //
translated: one is defeated for the sake of the four directions.🔽If one steals the robes and so forth from the cemetery,

original: gos la sogs pa rku na'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gos la sogs pa rku na'ang de bzhin no //
translated: it is the same.

original: dge slong gang dag gi phyogs bzhi po de dag ni phyogs bzhi'o //
analyzed: dge slong gang dag gi phyogs bzhi po de dag ni phyogs bzhi'o //
translated: The four directions of the monks are the four directions.

original: de dag gi tshogs ni phyogs bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi tshogs ni phyogs bzhi pa ste /
translated: Their assembly is the four directions.

original: phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi rdzas phyogs bzhi pa'i ched kho nar rku bar byed na rnam par nyams pa yin te /
analyzed: phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi rdzas phyogs bzhi pa'i ched kho nar rku bar byed na rnam par nyams pa yin te /
translated: If one steals the wealth of the Saṅgha of the four directions for the sake of the four directions, one is defeated.

original: nyes byas chung du nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyes byas chung du nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a minor offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
translated: Here the text of the Vinaya Verses states:🔽A resident monk, with the thought to steal, moved the property of the Saṅgha of the four directions from one place to another.

original: dge slong gnyug mar gnas pa zhig gis phyogs bzhi pa'i dge 'dun gyi yo byad rnams brku ba'i sems kyis gnas nas gnas su spags nas de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong gnyug mar gnas pa zhig gis phyogs bzhi pa'i dge 'dun gyi yo byad rnams brku ba'i sems kyis gnas nas gnas su spags nas de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: When he felt regret, the Bhagavān said,

original: pham pa'i ltung ba ni med de /
analyzed: pham pa'i ltung ba ni med de /
translated: “There is no offense entailing expulsion,

original: nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: but there is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: gal te zhes pa'i gzhung las ni sbom po zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: gal te zhes pa'i gzhung las ni sbom po zhes bya ba 'byung ste /
translated: The text of the Ched du gcod pa states, “It is a serious offense.”

original: de'i tshe ni chung ba zhes bya ba dang / rnam par nyams pa zhes bya ba'i don du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni chung ba zhes bya ba dang / rnam par nyams pa zhes bya ba'i don du bshad pa yin no //
translated: At that time, it is explained that the term “minor” refers to “degraded” and “degraded” refers to “destroyed.”

original: ci ste sde la sogs pa tha dad pa'i bdag po tha dad pa'i gnas su sbed par byed cing der yang de bdag po rnams kyi khong du chud pa yin la /
analyzed: ci ste sde la sogs pa tha dad pa'i bdag po tha dad pa'i gnas su sbed par byed cing der yang de bdag po rnams kyi khong du chud pa yin la /
translated: If the property of a Saṅgha is hidden in a different place, such as a different monastery, and the owners there do not know about it,

original: gal te de'i tshe na rin thang tshang na pham pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gal te de'i tshe na rin thang tshang na pham pa kho na yin te /
translated: If the value is complete at that time, there is only a defeat.

original: dge 'dun ni spun dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun ni spun dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Sangha is like a brother.

original: ji ste khong du ma chud na de'i tshe sbom po yin te /
analyzed: ji ste khong du ma chud na de'i tshe sbom po yin te /
translated: If it is not understood, then it is a serious violation.

original: gzhan gyi don nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar gnas pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya bar gnas pas so //
translated: Because it is for the sake of others.

original: de bzhin du dur khrod yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa nas rku na chung ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dur khrod yongs su 'dzin pa dang bcas pa nas rku na chung ba kho na yin no //
translated: In the same way, if one steals from a charnel ground that is owned, it is only a minor offense.

original: dur khrod smos pa ni 'dir tha chad yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: dur khrod smos pa ni 'dir tha chad yin pa'i phyir //
translated: The mention of charnel grounds is because they are the lowest here.

original: mngon par zhen pa chung ba nyid kyis rku ba ma rdzogs pa nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa chung ba nyid kyis rku ba ma rdzogs pa nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to show that the stealing is incomplete due to the small attachment.

original: da ni rku ba'i dbye ba bstan par bya //
analyzed: da ni rku ba'i dbye ba bstan par bya //
translated: Now the classification of stealing should be taught.

original: sa ni gal te brtsad pas grvar @97b phrogs na //
analyzed: sa ni gal te brtsad pas grvar @97b phrogs na //
translated: If one steals a field by dispute,

original: gang tshe khyim pas de sbyor btang tshe ste //
analyzed: gang tshe khyim pas de sbyor btang tshe ste //
translated: when the householder gives up the effort,

original: gal te slar ni rgyal ba nyid na brkus //
analyzed: gal te slar ni rgyal ba nyid na brkus //
translated: if he wins it back, he has stolen.

original: da ni rku ba'i dbye ba rab tu bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni rku ba'i dbye ba rab tu bstan par bya'o //
translated: Now the classification of stealing should be taught.

original: de la gal te brtsad pas grar phrogs la /
analyzed: de la gal te brtsad pas grar phrogs la /
translated: If he is defeated in the debate, he is defeated in the theft.

original: brtsad pa de yang gal te 'og zur 'gyed na der gang gi tshe shags zlas sbyor ba btang ba de'i tshe brkus pa yin par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: brtsad pa de yang gal te 'og zur 'gyed na der gang gi tshe shags zlas sbyor ba btang ba de'i tshe brkus pa yin par khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: And if the debate is postponed, then when the debate is resumed, he should understand that he has been defeated in the theft.

original: de'i tshe kho na mthar 'gyur bar shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i tshe kho na mthar 'gyur bar shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that he should understand that he has been defeated at that very time.

original: ci ste slar brtsad pa de bgyi na de'i tshe ni rgyal bar gyur pa kho na na brkus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ci ste slar brtsad pa de bgyi na de'i tshe ni rgyal bar gyur pa kho na na brkus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: But if the debate is resumed, then he should understand that he has been defeated in the theft only if he is defeated.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: dge slong dag zhal ce ba rnams kyi bdag po ni rgyal po yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag zhal ce ba rnams kyi bdag po ni rgyal po yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: “Monks, the king is the master of those who are in dispute.”

original: yongs su bskor ba'i dbang gis rku byed na //🔽gang tshe mtshams kyi sgo dang 'byor na brkus //
analyzed: yongs su bskor ba'i dbang gis rku byed na // gang tshe mtshams kyi sgo dang 'byor na brkus //
translated: If one steals by the power of a command,🔽when one reaches the door of the boundary, one has stolen.

original: yongs su bskor bas rku na gang gi tshe mtshams kyi sgo dang sgo 'byor bar gyur pa de'i tshe brkus pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su bskor bas rku na gang gi tshe mtshams kyi sgo dang sgo 'byor bar gyur pa de'i tshe brkus pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: If one steals by a command, then when one reaches the door of the boundary, one should understand that one has stolen.

original: brda yi sbyor bas mi la rku byed na //
analyzed: brda yi sbyor bas mi la rku byed na //
translated: If one steals from a human by means of a sign,

original: brda grub pa yi dbang gis ltung ba yin //
analyzed: brda grub pa yi dbang gis ltung ba yin //
translated: one is said to have committed a downfall by the power of the sign.

original: brdas ni rku na brda grub pa kho na brkus par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: brdas ni rku na brda grub pa kho na brkus par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: If one steals by means of a sign, one is said to have committed the actual act of stealing by the power of the sign.

original: de la rnam pa mang po dag gis mi rku ba yin te /🔽mi 'dod bzhin du yang drang ba dang / gdeg pa gnyis dang / 'jigs pa'i mtshan mas spo ba dang / sngags dang sman dag gis rmongs par byas pa dang / bcings pa thar bar byas pa dang ; gnyid kyis log pa na ma tshor bar 'degs pa la sogs pa rnam par gcad pa'i phyir brda zhes smos so //🔽mi rku ba la rnam pa gsum ste /🔽man ngag gis dang / brdas dang / mtshan mas so //
analyzed: de la rnam pa mang po dag gis mi rku ba yin te / mi 'dod bzhin du yang drang ba dang / gdeg pa gnyis dang / 'jigs pa'i mtshan mas spo ba dang / sngags dang sman dag gis rmongs par byas pa dang / bcings pa thar bar byas pa dang ; gnyid kyis log pa na ma tshor bar 'degs pa la sogs pa rnam par gcad pa'i phyir brda zhes smos so // mi rku ba la rnam pa gsum ste / man ngag gis dang / brdas dang / mtshan mas so //
translated: There are many ways in which one does not steal:

original: gsum po 'di dag tu ni rang dag 'dun pa kho nas brkus pa nyid yin par dgongs so //🔽de la man ngag ni 'dus pa la sogs pa'o //🔽mtshan ma ni rtags te /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag tu ni rang dag 'dun pa kho nas brkus pa nyid yin par dgongs so //🔽de la man ngag ni 'dus pa la sogs pa'o //🔽mtshan ma ni rtags te /

original: sgra dang kha spu bregs nas ring po ma lon pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra dang kha spu bregs nas ring po ma lon pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: for example, a person who has recently shaved his beard.

original: brda ni snga dro la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brda ni snga dro la sogs pa'o //
translated: A sign is the morning, etc.

original: man ngag la sogs pa gsum po 'di dag don tha dad pa nyid yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: man ngag la sogs pa gsum po 'di dag don tha dad pa nyid yin du zin kyang /
translated: Although these three, the sign, etc., are different in meaning,

original: de dag gis nye bar mtshon par bya ba de yang snga dro la sogs pa ni bye brag yin pas brda zhes bya ba'i sgras spyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis nye bar mtshon par bya ba de yang snga dro la sogs pa ni bye brag yin pas brda zhes bya ba'i sgras spyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: the object that they illustrate, the morning, etc., is a particular, and is indicated by the word sign.🔽When you have done this and that, look, and then come to me.

original: gang gi tshe khyod kyis 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig na ltos shig dang / de'i tshe khyod nga'i drung du phrad du shog shig ces bya ba gang yin pa de ni brda byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyod kyis 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig na ltos shig dang / de'i tshe khyod nga'i drung du phrad du shog shig ces bya ba gang yin pa de ni brda byas pa yin no //
translated: This is a sign.

original: de ni gang gi tshe grub pa de'i tshe mi brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha @98a * //
analyzed: de ni gang gi tshe grub pa de'i tshe mi brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha @98a * //
translated: When that is accomplished, it is not stolen.

original: tshig go // rnam pa gzhan dag la yang mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs nas brkus par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshig go // rnam pa gzhan dag la yang mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs nas brkus par rig par bya ste /
translated: In other cases, one should understand stealing by analogy with the characteristics.

original: dper na sngags kyis drangs nas gter dang 'dra bar snang bar 'ong ba na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na sngags kyis drangs nas gter dang 'dra bar snang bar 'ong ba na brkus pa yin no //
translated: For example, when a treasure appears as if drawn forth by a mantra, it is stolen.

original: khyu las bkar ba dang bcings pa zhig yin na mi snang bar gyur pa na brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: khyu las bkar ba dang bcings pa zhig yin na mi snang bar gyur pa na brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: If it is stolen from a herd, and it disappears, it is stolen.

original: dud 'gror gyur pa bcings las rku pa na //
analyzed: dud 'gror gyur pa bcings las rku pa na //
translated: If an animal is stolen from a pen,

original: bcings bkrol tsam gyis brkus par shes par bya //🔽khyu las bkar dang bcings pas rku ba na //🔽khyu las mi snang gyur na brkus pa yin //
analyzed: bcings bkrol tsam gyis brkus par shes par bya // khyu las bkar dang bcings pas rku ba na // khyu las mi snang gyur na brkus pa yin //
translated: it is stolen by merely freeing it from the pen.🔽If it is stolen from a herd,🔽it is stolen when it disappears from the herd.

original: dud 'gro bcings pa las rku na bcings pa las bkrol ba kho nas brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: dud 'gro bcings pa las rku na bcings pa las bkrol ba kho nas brkus pa yin no //
translated: If an animal is stolen from a pen, it is stolen by merely freeing it from the pen.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text states:

original: dge slong gis rngon shor ba'i rim mar ri dgas bcings pa bkrol ba las ri dags kyi rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gis rngon shor ba'i rim mar ri dgas bcings pa bkrol ba las ri dags kyi rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If a monk frees a deer bound by a hunter’s trap, he should be made to pay the value of the deer.

original: bkrol pa kho na las rin thang brtsi ba'i rim pa smos pa'i phyir bkrol ba nyid na brkus pa yin par dgongs pa yin no zhes bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: bkrol pa kho na las rin thang brtsi ba'i rim pa smos pa'i phyir bkrol ba nyid na brkus pa yin par dgongs pa yin no zhes bya bar mngon no //
translated: The intention is that it is theft when it is untied, because the stages of calculating the value are mentioned.

original: bcings pa las sam khyu las bkar bas dud 'gro rkun khyu las mi snang bar gyur ba kho na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: bcings pa las sam khyu las bkar bas dud 'gro rkun khyu las mi snang bar gyur ba kho na brkus pa yin no //
translated: When one steals an animal from a herd or a bird from a flock, it is theft when it is no longer visible.

original: gcig pu zhig las rku na ni gnas gang nas bskyod pa de nas mi snang bar gyur ba na brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs pas rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gcig pu zhig las rku na ni gnas gang nas bskyod pa de nas mi snang bar gyur ba na brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni rigs pas rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: If one steals an animal that is not part of a herd, then it is theft when it is no longer visible from the place where it was moved.

original: gal te bla ma'i gos la sogs khyer nas //🔽gom pa bskyed dam yang na 'bri byed pas //
analyzed: gal te bla ma'i gos la sogs khyer nas // gom pa bskyed dam yang na 'bri byed pas //
translated: If one steals the robes and so on of a guru,🔽one commits the actual basis of a heinous act🔽if one moves one foot or if one cuts the cloth.🔽If one steals a fence or a wall,

original: re lde la sogs phag tu mi snang song //
analyzed: re lde la sogs phag tu mi snang song //
translated: it is the actual basis if one moves it out of sight.🔽If one steals a house,

original: dngos gzhi'o mngon sum phrogs pa'ang de dang 'dra //🔽'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: dngos gzhi'o mngon sum phrogs pa'ang de dang 'dra // 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: it is the actual basis if one moves it out of sight.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge mentions:🔽If one steals a fence or a wall,🔽it is the actual basis if one moves it out of sight.🔽If one steals a house,🔽it is the actual basis if one moves it out of sight.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon dag lam du zhugs pa la gos rnams ni de rnams kyis slob ma'i lag na yod pa dang / de rnams de la brku sems nye bar gnas shing de dag gom pa 'bri bar byed pa dang / gom pa re re la nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon dag lam du zhugs pa la gos rnams ni de rnams kyis slob ma'i lag na yod pa dang / de rnams de la brku sems nye bar gnas shing de dag gom pa 'bri bar byed pa dang / gom pa re re la nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: When the preceptor and master are on the road, the robes are in the hands of the disciples, and if the preceptor and master have the thought to steal them and take a step, they commit an offense of wrong conduct for each step.

original: nam mig sngar snang bar 'ong gi bar du nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam mig sngar snang bar 'ong gi bar du nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are in the range of sight, they commit a serious offense.

original: mig sngar sdang bar mi 'ong ba na phrogs pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: mig sngar sdang bar mi 'ong ba na phrogs pa yin no zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If they are not in the range of sight, it is said that they are stolen.

original: de ltar na gom pa bskyed pa dang gom pa 'bri ba dag gis re lde dang nags khung la sogs pa dag tu mi snang bar song ba las dngos gzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na gom pa bskyed pa dang gom pa 'bri ba dag gis re lde dang nags khung la sogs pa dag tu mi snang bar song ba las dngos gzhir 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the basis is when they are out of sight in a fence, a forest, and so on, through taking a step or through taking a step.

original: rkun ma ni nam snang ba de'i bar du brku ba'i blo mi skye bas so //
analyzed: rkun ma ni nam snang ba de'i bar du brku ba'i blo mi skye bas so //
translated: This is because the thief does not generate the mind to steal until he is in the range of sight.

original: mngon sum phrogs @98b pa'ang de dang 'dra zhes bya ba ni mi snang bar song ba las dngos gzhir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon sum phrogs @98b pa'ang de dang 'dra zhes bya ba ni mi snang bar song ba las dngos gzhir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Similarly, it is said that stealing by direct action is like that.

original: 'dul byed las /
analyzed: 'dul byed las /
translated: The Vinaya Verses says:

original: dge slong gis khyim pa'i gos shig blangs so //
analyzed: dge slong gis khyim pa'i gos shig blangs so //
translated: A monk took a householder’s garment.

original: des de blangs nas song ba dang / khyim pa des mthong nas des de la smras pa /
analyzed: des de blangs nas song ba dang / khyim pa des mthong nas des de la smras pa /
translated: After taking it, he went away and the householder saw him and said,🔽“Venerable, do not take the garment.”

original: btsun pa gos ma bsnams shig ces smras pa dang / yid kyis bltas te khyer te 'ong zhes smras nas /
analyzed: btsun pa gos ma bsnams shig ces smras pa dang / yid kyis bltas te khyer te 'ong zhes smras nas /
translated: He said, “I will look at it mentally and return it.”

original: de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: When he generated regret, the Bhagavān said,🔽“There is no offense entailing expulsion, but there is a serious offense.”

original: pham pa'i ltung ba ni med de dman pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yang 'dir ltung ba med par gsungs pa'i rgyu ni snang ba med par ma song ba las gzhan pa mi snang ngo //
analyzed: pham pa'i ltung ba ni med de dman pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yang 'dir ltung ba med par gsungs pa'i rgyu ni snang ba med par ma song ba las gzhan pa mi snang ngo //
translated: The reason that this is said to be a non-offense is that it is not non-apparent.

original: sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir na nyes pa sbom por gsungs so zhes bya ba'i don 'di rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir na nyes pa sbom por gsungs so zhes bya ba'i don 'di rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the statement that it is a serious offense is that it is a serious offense because it is preparation.

original: gru zhig chu 'dal ba 'am thang las sam //
analyzed: gru zhig chu 'dal ba 'am thang las sam //
translated: If one steals a boat on calm water or on land,

original: chu bo'i rgyun phyogs rku na'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: chu bo'i rgyun phyogs rku na'ang de bzhin no //
translated: or if one steals it on a river, going with the current, it is the same.

original: klung sogs 'gram mi snang la zhing du na //🔽de bzhin snang las pha rol phyin 'dir brkus //
analyzed: klung sogs 'gram mi snang la zhing du na // de bzhin snang las pha rol phyin 'dir brkus //
translated: But if one steals it on a river, etc., where the other bank is not visible,🔽then it is stolen when one is out of sight of the bank.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni mi snang bar gyur pa na brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni mi snang bar gyur pa na brkus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word “then” means “when one is out of sight of the bank.”

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: bshad pa / chu 'dal ba ste /🔽chu 'gram pa dang / thang dang chu bo'i rgyun phyogs la yang rung ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / chu 'dal ba ste / chu 'gram pa dang / thang dang chu bo'i rgyun phyogs la yang rung ste /
translated: The verse says, “on calm water.”

original: mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na brkus pa yin no //🔽chu bo 'am rgya mtsho gang las pha rol gyi 'gram mi mngon pa'i thad ka 'dal ba de la yang mi snang bar gyur pa kho na na brkus ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi snang bar gyur pa nyid na brkus pa yin no // chu bo 'am rgya mtsho gang las pha rol gyi 'gram mi mngon pa'i thad ka 'dal ba de la yang mi snang bar gyur pa kho na na brkus ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: On a river, on land, or on a river, going with the current, it is stolen when one is out of sight of the bank.🔽But if one steals a boat on a river or ocean where the other bank is not visible, it is stolen when one is out of sight of the bank.

original: chu bo la sogs pa 'gram snang ba la ni pha rol gyi 'gram du phyin pa kho na na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: chu bo la sogs pa 'gram snang ba la ni pha rol gyi 'gram du phyin pa kho na na brkus pa yin no //
translated: But if one steals a boat on a river, etc., where the other bank is visible, it is stolen when one reaches the other bank.

original: rgyun las bzlog par gru ni 'dren byed na //🔽gru tshugs thal ba las ni brkus pa yin //
analyzed: rgyun las bzlog par gru ni 'dren byed na // gru tshugs thal ba las ni brkus pa yin //
translated: If the boat is pulled upstream, the theft is of the distance that is passed over.🔽If the boat is pulled upstream, the theft is of the distance that is passed over.🔽The distance that is passed over is the distance that the boat is pulled upstream.

original: rgyun las bzlog phyogs su gru 'dren na gru tshugs las 'das pa kho na na brkus pa yin no //🔽gru tshugs ni gru pha rol du bkri ba'i phyir lam ji srid du rgyun las bzlog phyogs su bkri bar bya ba de yin te /🔽de ni gru de'i rgyu ba'i sa yin pa'i phyir gnas pa yin no /
analyzed: rgyun las bzlog phyogs su gru 'dren na gru tshugs las 'das pa kho na na brkus pa yin no // gru tshugs ni gru pha rol du bkri ba'i phyir lam ji srid du rgyun las bzlog phyogs su bkri bar bya ba de yin te / de ni gru de'i rgyu ba'i sa yin pa'i phyir gnas pa yin no /
translated: The distance that is passed over is the place where the boat moves, because it is the place where the boat moves.

original: gru tshugs med na gdags pa'i tshad gnas pa yin par rtogs par bya'o /🔽gsang sngags dag gis brku bya rku byed na //
analyzed: gru tshugs med na gdags pa'i tshad gnas pa yin par rtogs par bya'o / gsang sngags dag gis brku bya rku byed na //
translated: If there is no distance that is passed over, the measure of the distance that is passed over should be understood to be the place.🔽If one steals by means of spells, the theft is of what appears before one’s eyes.🔽If one steals an object by means of spells, the theft is of the object that is seen.

original: rang gi mig sngar snang na de brkus yin //
analyzed: rang gi mig sngar snang na de brkus yin //
translated: If one steals by means of spells, the theft is of what appears before one’s eyes.🔽If one steals by means of spells, the theft is of what appears before one’s eyes.🔽If one steals by means of spells, the theft is of what appears before one’s eyes.🔽If one steals by means of spells, the theft is of what appears before one’s eyes.🔽If one steals by means of spells, the theft is of what appears before one’s eyes.🔽If one steals by means of spells, the theft is of what appears before one’s eyes.🔽If one steals by means of spells, the theft is of what appears before one’s eyes.🔽If one steals by means of spells, the theft is of what appears before one’s eyes.🔽If one steals by means of spells, the theft is of what appears before one’s eyes.🔽If one steals by means of spells, the theft is of what appears before one’s eyes.🔽If one steals by means of spells, the theft is of what appears before one’s eyes.🔽If one steals by means of spells, the theft is of what appears before one’s eyes.🔽If one steals by means of spells, the theft is of what appears before one’s eyes.🔽If one steals by means of spells, the theft is of what appears before one’s eyes.🔽If one steals by means of spells, the theft is of what appears before one’s eyes.🔽If one steals by means of spells, the theft is of what appears before one’s eyes.

original: gsang sngags dag gis rdzas brku bar bya ba rku ba na rdzas de mthong ba kho na na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: gsang sngags dag gis rdzas brku bar bya ba rku ba na rdzas de mthong ba kho na na brkus pa yin no //
translated: If one steals by means of spells, the theft is of what appears before one’s eyes.

original: rdzas kyi steng cha sbying bar byed na ni //🔽@99a * // gnas kyi steng cha las 'das brkus pa yin //
analyzed: rdzas kyi steng cha sbying bar byed na ni //🔽@99a * // gnas kyi steng cha las 'das brkus pa yin //
translated: If one steals by means

original: lus kyi rgyan ni bkrol ba nyid na yin //
analyzed: lus kyi rgyan ni bkrol ba nyid na yin //
translated: The body ornament is when one has already removed it.

original: sho gam dag ni sa nyid sa 'das na'o //
analyzed: sho gam dag ni sa nyid sa 'das na'o //
translated: The toll is when one has already passed the toll station.

original: rdzas kyi steng gi cha sbying bas rku ba na gnas kyi steng gi cha las thal na brkus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyi steng gi cha sbying bas rku ba na gnas kyi steng gi cha las thal na brkus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: When one steals by removing a portion of the substance, one should understand that it is stolen when one has removed it from the place.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: zong sbying ba'i phyir khri las ldang ba nas 'dam rko zhing phyis brku'o snyam pa las dngos po tshang na pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zong sbying ba'i phyir khri las ldang ba nas 'dam rko zhing phyis brku'o snyam pa las dngos po tshang na pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one rises from one’s seat in order to remove the goods, digs the mud, and thinks “I will steal later,” if the entity is complete, one commits a pārājika.
