original: dngos po ma tshang na dman pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po ma tshang na dman pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If the entity is incomplete, one commits a serious offense.🔽If one says “I will steal later,” it is illogical that the substance is stolen when one has passed the water or mud of the place.

original: gal te phyis brku'o zhes bya ba smos pa'i phyir rdzas kyi steng gnas kyi steng chu 'am 'dam las 'das pa na brkus pa yin par mi rigs so zhe na de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: gal te phyis brku'o zhes bya ba smos pa'i phyir rdzas kyi steng gnas kyi steng chu 'am 'dam las 'das pa na brkus pa yin par mi rigs so zhe na de ni mi rung ste /
translated: That is illogical.

original: rku ba ni 'dir bskur ba la sbyar gyi /
analyzed: rku ba ni 'dir bskur ba la sbyar gyi /
translated: Here, stealing is applied to the act of carrying off,

original: brku ba dngos la ma yin no //
analyzed: brku ba dngos la ma yin no //
translated: but not to the actual stealing.

original: de bas na phyis brku 'o zhes bya ba ni 'di'i phyis bskur ro zhes bya ba'i don du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na phyis brku 'o zhes bya ba ni 'di'i phyis bskur ro zhes bya ba'i don du gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the phrase “later stealing” means “stealing later.”

original: de ltar yang 'dul ba mdo las /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dul ba mdo las /
translated: The Vinaya Verses declares:

original: phyis brku ba'i blo gang yin pa de ni blang ba yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: phyis brku ba'i blo gang yin pa de ni blang ba yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: “The later thought to steal is the taking.”

original: lus la rgyan btags pa rnams ni bkrol ba kho na na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: lus la rgyan btags pa rnams ni bkrol ba kho na na brkus pa yin no //
translated: When ornaments are attached to the body, they are stolen only when they are removed.

original: bkrol ba kho na na gnas gzhan du spos pa yin par rnam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: bkrol ba kho na na gnas gzhan du spos pa yin par rnam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: When they are removed, they are established as moved to another location.

original: 'di ltar de ni btags pa yin gyi bzhag pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir btags pa las bkrol ba 'dir brkus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni btags pa yin gyi bzhag pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir btags pa las bkrol ba 'dir brkus pa yin gyi /
translated: Because they are attached, not placed, therefore they are stolen when they are removed from where they are attached.

original: gdags pa'i sa bsnor bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gdags pa'i sa bsnor bas ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not stolen by moving them from the place of attachment.

original: gser gyi gdu bu la sogs pa thogs te 'dug pa ni dpung mgo la thug par phyin kyang btags pa bkrol ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gser gyi gdu bu la sogs pa thogs te 'dug pa ni dpung mgo la thug par phyin kyang btags pa bkrol ba ma yin no //
translated: If a person is wearing a golden bracelet, etc., it is not removed even though it reaches the shoulder.

original: sho gam dag ni sa nyid 'das na brkus pa'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sho gam dag ni sa nyid 'das na brkus pa'o zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When a toll is passed, it is stolen when one passes the toll station.

original: sa nyid ces bya ba ni 'dir sho gam gyi skabs yin pa'i phyir sho gam gyi gnas su rig par bya'o //🔽de yang gang tshun chad phyin nas sho gam gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin pa de tshun chad yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sa nyid ces bya ba ni 'dir sho gam gyi skabs yin pa'i phyir sho gam gyi gnas su rig par bya'o // de yang gang tshun chad phyin nas sho gam gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin pa de tshun chad yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The ground is the area within which a tax is levied.

original: sho gam gyis de las 'das pa ni sho gam bcad pa'i sho gam gyis de las thal ba yin te /
analyzed: sho gam gyis de las 'das pa ni sho gam bcad pa'i sho gam gyis de las thal ba yin te /
translated: One who passes beyond the ground is one who passes beyond the area within which a tax is levied.

original: sa phyogs gzhan las de thal bas ni sho gam brkus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sa phyogs gzhan las de thal bas ni sho gam brkus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One who passes beyond the ground is not one who steals the tax.

original: gal te yang ji ltar na sho gam bcad pa 'das na sho gam 'das pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang ji ltar na sho gam bcad pa 'das na sho gam 'das pa yin zhe na /
translated: If one passes beyond the ground, how can one pass beyond the tax?

original: sho gam ni sho gam bcad pa'i cha yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sho gam ni sho gam bcad pa'i cha yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault, because the tax is a part of the ground.

original: sa nyid ces bya ba ci dgos she na rdzu 'phrul @99b gyis nam mkha' las thal na ltung ba med par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sa nyid ces bya ba ci dgos she na rdzu 'phrul @99b gyis nam mkha' las thal na ltung ba med par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: What is the point of mentioning the ground? It is taught that one does not incur an offense if one passes beyond the ground by means of supernormal power and through the air.

original: rgyal po ni sa la dbang ba yin gyi nam mkha' la dbang ba ma yin pas so //
analyzed: rgyal po ni sa la dbang ba yin gyi nam mkha' la dbang ba ma yin pas so //
translated: The king has power over the earth, not over the sky.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /
translated: Here is the text of the Vinaya:🔽“Lord, if a bhikṣu passes through customs in the sky, what is the offense?”

original: btsun pa dge slong gis nam mkha' las sho gam 'da' bar bgyid na cir 'gyur lags gal te rdzu 'phrul gyis 'da' bar byed na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis nam mkha' las sho gam 'da' bar bgyid na cir 'gyur lags gal te rdzu 'phrul gyis 'da' bar byed na ltung ba med do //
translated: “If he passes through by means of his supernormal powers, there is no offense.

original: 'on te rnam pa gzhan dag gis na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te rnam pa gzhan dag gis na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: But if he passes through by some other means, there is a grave offense.”

original: 'dir rdzu 'phrul zhes spyir bstan pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa las byung ba dang / las las skyes pa dang / gsang sngags dang sman gyis byas pa'i rdzu 'phrul gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir rdzu 'phrul zhes spyir bstan pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa las byung ba dang / las las skyes pa dang / gsang sngags dang sman gyis byas pa'i rdzu 'phrul gzung ngo //
translated: Here, because the term “supernormal powers” is a general term, it refers to the supernormal powers that arise from the higher knowledges, those that arise from karma, and those that are created by spells and medicine.

original: sho gam gyi sa smos pa ni sa gzhan nas sho gam bcad pa 'das na nyes pa med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sho gam gyi sa smos pa ni sa gzhan nas sho gam bcad pa 'das na nyes pa med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “customs station” is mentioned because there is no offense if one passes through customs on another level.

original: sa nyid ces bya ba'i nyid ces bya ba ci dgos she na /
analyzed: sa nyid ces bya ba'i nyid ces bya ba ci dgos she na /
translated: What is the purpose of the term “itself” in “the earth itself”?

original: gal te sho gam gyi sa'i gnas su lus kyi lag pas dbul ba la sogs pa lag pa'i phyag rgyas sam /
analyzed: gal te sho gam gyi sa'i gnas su lus kyi lag pas dbul ba la sogs pa lag pa'i phyag rgyas sam /
translated: If one passes through the customs area without touching the body, hand, etc.

original: ngag gis gsang sngags brjod pa la sogs pas sam /🔽yid kyis rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba la sogs pas sho gam bcad pa lus la'am lus dang 'brel pa la 'am gang la yang ma reg par nam mkha' las sho gam gyi sa las 'da' bar byed na de na sho gam ma sha ka lnga la
analyzed: ngag gis gsang sngags brjod pa la sogs pas sam / yid kyis rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba la sogs pas sho gam bcad pa lus la'am lus dang 'brel pa la 'am gang la yang ma reg par nam mkha' las sho gam gyi sa las 'da' bar byed na de na sho gam ma sha ka lnga la
translated: with the body, or without speaking mantras, etc.🔽with the voice, or without manifesting supernatural powers, etc.

original: sogs pa yod du zin kyang sbom po yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sogs pa yod du zin kyang sbom po yin par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: with the mind, and one passes through the customs area without touching anything, then even if there is a five māṣa tax, etc.🔽it is a grave offense.

original: gang zhig nam mkha' la 'dug nas 'da' bar byed na de la ni ltung ba med pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //🔽de lta bas na sa zhes smos pa'i phyir gang zhig yod /
analyzed: gang zhig nam mkha' la 'dug nas 'da' bar byed na de la ni ltung ba med pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o // de lta bas na sa zhes smos pa'i phyir gang zhig yod /
translated: If one passes through the air, there is no offense.

original: sho gam gyi sa dang ma 'brel ba de la ni ltung ba med pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sho gam gyi sa dang ma 'brel ba de la ni ltung ba med pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since the term “ground” is mentioned, if one passes through the customs area without touching the ground, there is no offense.

original: gal te lus kyis sam lus dang 'brel pas sam bzhon pas sho gam gzhal ba 'da' bar byed pa ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lus kyis sam lus dang 'brel pas sam bzhon pas sho gam gzhal ba 'da' bar byed pa ltung bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one passes through a tollgate by means of a vehicle, or by means of a body or a body and a vehicle, one does not incur the transgression.

original: skyon du mi 'gyur te sa ni brgyud pas gzhi nyid du 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon du mi 'gyur te sa ni brgyud pas gzhi nyid du 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no fault, because the ground is indirectly related to the offense.

original: dud 'gro gang zhig sho gam gyi gnas su phyin pa las lam sgyur nas 'da' bar byed na de ni re zhig sa de las 'das pa yin par the tshom med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: dud 'gro gang zhig sho gam gyi gnas su phyin pa las lam sgyur nas 'da' bar byed na de ni re zhig sa de las 'das pa yin par the tshom med pa kho na yin no //
translated: If an animal reaches the tollgate and then turns back, there is no doubt that it has passed through the tollgate.

original: slar log ste lam gzhan nas 'gro na ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: slar log ste lam gzhan nas 'gro na ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: But if it turns back and goes by another path, how can it be known that it has passed through the tollgate?

original: 'jig rten gyi lugs kyi dbang gis rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi lugs kyi dbang gis rtogs par bya ste /
translated: It can be known by the rule of the world.

original: gal te sar phyin pa las slar log kyang ga zhal bar bya ba nyid yin na slar log pa'i rdzas de 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te sar phyin pa las slar log kyang ga zhal bar bya ba nyid yin na slar log pa'i rdzas de 'das pa yin no //
translated: If, after reaching the ground, it turns back, it is still subject to the toll. But if it turns back and goes by another path, it is not subject to the toll.

original: gal te bskur @100a * //
analyzed: gal te bskur @100a * //
translated: If it is sent back,

original: bar bya ba nyid yin na de'i tshe 'das pa ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bar bya ba nyid yin na de'i tshe 'das pa ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood that it is not subject to the toll.

original: sho gam gyi gnas kyis ni sa bye brag tu 'byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sho gam gyi gnas kyis ni sa bye brag tu 'byed pa yin te /
translated: The place of the tax is the distinction of the place.

original: sa gzhan las 'da' bar byed pa la ni ltung ba med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa gzhan las 'da' bar byed pa la ni ltung ba med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is taught in order to show that there is no offense if one crosses over to another place.

original: dper na yul chos kyis sho gam gcod pa zhig yin la yul der gtogs pa'i grong gi sa'i steng las 'das na ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na yul chos kyis sho gam gcod pa zhig yin la yul der gtogs pa'i grong gi sa'i steng las 'das na ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, if a tax is imposed on a certain place, there is no offense if one crosses over to another village on that place.🔽The Exposition declares:🔽“If one causes a taxable substance to enter a road, one commits an offense entailing suspension.”

original: rnam par 'byed pa las sho gam gcod pa'i rdzas dang lam du 'jug par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa de yang lam du 'jug par byed pa la bya'i brku ba la ni mi bya bas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa las sho gam gcod pa'i rdzas dang lam du 'jug par byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa de yang lam du 'jug par byed pa la bya'i brku ba la ni mi bya bas nyes pa med do //
translated: This refers to causing it to enter a road, not to stealing it, so there is no offense.

original: 'dir 'jig rten pa'i lugs kyis rnam par gzhag pa yin pas 'dul ba las sho gam gyi mtshan nyid ma gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten pa'i lugs kyis rnam par gzhag pa yin pas 'dul ba las sho gam gyi mtshan nyid ma gsungs so //
translated: Since this is a worldly system, the characteristics of a tax are not taught in the scriptures on discipline.

original: 'jig rten na ni lugs kyis zong kho na sho gam gcod par rigs so zhes 'jog ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni lugs kyis zong kho na sho gam gcod par rigs so zhes 'jog ste /
translated: In the world, it is established that only goods are taxed.

original: 'di ltar zong la ni nyid shu cha sho gam yin la rtsva dang shing la sogs pa dag ni drug cu cha yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar zong la ni nyid shu cha sho gam yin la rtsva dang shing la sogs pa dag ni drug cu cha yin no //
translated: Thus, goods are taxed at one-twentieth, while grass, wood, and so on are taxed at one-sixtieth.

original: zong zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa'i ched du btsong bar bya ba la bya'o //
analyzed: zong zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa'i ched du btsong bar bya ba la bya'o //
translated: Goods are those things that are sold for the sake of profit.

original: de lta bas na thong ma yin pa de ni sho gam gcad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na thong ma yin pa de ni sho gam gcad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is not goods is not taxed.

original: de'i phyir sdom brtson rnams kyi 'tsho ba'i yo byad ni sho gam gcad par 'os pa ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdom brtson rnams kyi 'tsho ba'i yo byad ni sho gam gcad par 'os pa ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the requisites for the life of those who are diligent in moral discipline are not to be taxed.

original: gal te sdom brtson rnams kyi 'tsho ba'i yo byad kyang sho dam gcad par 'os pa yin na ni lam du de 'jug par byed pa kho nar yang mi 'gyur pa zhig na /
analyzed: gal te sdom brtson rnams kyi 'tsho ba'i yo byad kyang sho dam gcad par 'os pa yin na ni lam du de 'jug par byed pa kho nar yang mi 'gyur pa zhig na /
translated: If the requisites for the life of those who are diligent in moral discipline were to be taxed, then they would not be engaged in the path.

original: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: Here, the text of the Vinaya states:

original: sho gam gcad pa'i rdzas ni lam du 'jug par yang mi bya'o zhes bkag pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: sho gam gcad pa'i rdzas ni lam du 'jug par yang mi bya'o zhes bkag pa'i phyir la /
translated: “Goods that are taxed are not to be engaged in on the path.”🔽Here, the text of the Mūlasarvâstivāda Vinaya states:

original: 'dir gzhung ni sman gyi gzhi las khyim bdag lug skyes kyis gsol pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni sman gyi gzhi las khyim bdag lug skyes kyis gsol pa /
translated: The householder Eḍaka said:🔽“Blessed One, I will give the requisites for the life of those who are diligent in moral discipline.”

original: bcom ldan 'das shul gyi bsnyun rgyags kyi ched du k'ar sh'a pan da gcig bzhes par gsol /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das shul gyi bsnyun rgyags kyi ched du k'ar sh'a pan da gcig bzhes par gsol /
translated: The Blessed One should accept one kārṣāpaṇa for the sake of provisions for the journey.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽“I will accept it.”

original: bzhes par bya'o zhes 'byung ba dang yang 'gal lo //
analyzed: bzhes par bya'o zhes 'byung ba dang yang 'gal lo //
translated: This also contradicts that.

original: de'i phyir 'dir sho gam gcad par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir de lam du zhugs par bya ba mi srid na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bstun rgyags bzhes par bka' stsal ba smra bar bya dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir sho gam gcad par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir de lam du zhugs par bya ba mi srid na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis bstun rgyags bzhes par bka' stsal ba smra bar bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, since it is impossible for him to enter the path because he is subject to customs duties here, it must be explained why the Blessed One allowed provisions for the journey.

original: de lta bas na 'jig rten na ni btsong bar bya ba kho na sho gam du gcad par 'os par grub kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'jig rten na ni btsong bar bya ba kho na sho gam du gcad par 'os par grub kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, in the world, only what is to be sold is established as subject to customs duties, not anything else.

original: bcom ldan 'das @100b kyis 'jig rten gyi lugs kyi dbang kho nas snam bu gcig rin thang chen po yin yang yo byad kyis gos nyid du byas te bskur bar bya zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @100b kyis 'jig rten gyi lugs kyi dbang kho nas snam bu gcig rin thang chen po yin yang yo byad kyis gos nyid du byas te bskur bar bya zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The Blessed One, out of deference to worldly customs alone, said that even a single cloth of great value should be given as a robe-material.

original: sdom brtson rnams kyi 'tsho ba'i yo byad ni sho gam du gcad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdom brtson rnams kyi 'tsho ba'i yo byad ni sho gam du gcad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the requisites of life of those who are diligent in the vows are not subject to taxation.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sho gam las thar bar bya ba'i phyir chur smyugs nas sam kha tshar bcad nas bskur bar bya'o zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sho gam las thar bar bya ba'i phyir chur smyugs nas sam kha tshar bcad nas bskur bar bya'o zhes gsungs she na /
translated: But why did the Lord say, “They should be carried across water or land without paying a toll”?

original: de ni nyes pa med de sho gam pa rnams kyis yo byad mang po dag mthong na /
analyzed: de ni nyes pa med de sho gam pa rnams kyis yo byad mang po dag mthong na /
translated: There is no fault, because if the toll collectors see many requisites,

original: sho gam gcad par 'os pa nyid yin par the tshom zos nas kham chu dag byed na mi rung ngo snyam du dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sho gam gcad par 'os pa nyid yin par the tshom zos nas kham chu dag byed na mi rung ngo snyam du dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: they might suspect that they are worthy of taxation and demand a toll.

original: gzhan dag na re 'di ni zong du gyur pa dag sho gam las thar par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'di ni zong du gyur pa dag sho gam las thar par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Others say that this was said in order to exempt goods from taxation.

original: 'di ni yul chos kyis bstan pa yin no //🔽yul kha cig tu gser sho gam du mi gcod de //
analyzed: 'di ni yul chos kyis bstan pa yin no // yul kha cig tu gser sho gam du mi gcod de //
translated: This is a teaching based on local conditions.🔽In some countries gold is not subject to taxation.

original: kha cig tu kha tshar gcad pa mi gcod do //
analyzed: kha cig tu kha tshar gcad pa mi gcod do //
translated: In some countries goods without fringes are not subject to taxation.

original: kha cig tu chur smyugs pa mi gcod do //
analyzed: kha cig tu chur smyugs pa mi gcod do //
translated: In some places, the toll is not a tax on water.

original: kha cig tu ni sho gam gcod de gang na kha tshar gcad pa kho na zong du byed pa dang / de bzhin du chur smyugs pa nyid la byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni sho gam gcod de gang na kha tshar gcad pa kho na zong du byed pa dang / de bzhin du chur smyugs pa nyid la byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: In some places, the toll is a tax on goods, such as where the toll is a tax on the cutting of grass, or where the toll is a tax on the use of water.🔽The Exposition declares:🔽If one carries off the goods of the Three Jewels or one’s parents, one should praise them or give the toll and then carry them off.

original: rnam par 'byed pa las dkon mchog dag gam pha ma'i ched du khyer bar byed na de dag gi bsngags pa brjod par bya ba 'am byin nas bskur bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa der yang sho gam byin nas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de ni zong🔽du gyur pa kho na la gsungs par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa las dkon mchog dag gam pha ma'i ched du khyer bar byed na de dag gi bsngags pa brjod par bya ba 'am byin nas bskur bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa der yang sho gam byin nas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de ni zong du gyur pa kho na la gsungs par khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: Since it says that one should give the toll, one should understand that this refers to goods that are being carried as merchandise.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang zong du bskur ro zhes gnang bas srid pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang zong du bskur ro zhes gnang bas srid pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One has allowed the carrying of goods as merchandise, and it is possible to do so.

original: ci ste yang nge zong nyid ni ma yin la de'i tshe gal gyis 'chu ba dag yod na sngom brtson rnams kyis rigs pa ni 'di kho na yin no zhes bya ba yin pas de nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang nge zong nyid ni ma yin la de'i tshe gal gyis 'chu ba dag yod na sngom brtson rnams kyis rigs pa ni 'di kho na yin no zhes bya ba yin pas de nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: If it is not merchandise, then if there is a tax on the person who carries it, this is the only logical reason for the tax, so that is what is being illustrated.

original: de nye bar mtshon pa sho gam byin nas zhes gsungs pa ni sbyin pa dang 'dra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir bstan par rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: de nye bar mtshon pa sho gam byin nas zhes gsungs pa ni sbyin pa dang 'dra ba nyid yin pa'i phyir bstan par rigs par bya'o //
translated: The statement “Having given a tax on the merchandise” is stated as an analogy to generosity.

original: 'dir gzhung ni rtsa ba'i bye brag tu bshad pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rtsa ba'i bye brag tu bshad pa las kyang /
translated: Here, the text of the Mūla-vibhāṣā says:

original: 'di ni mchod rten gyi dkor ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ni mchod rten gyi dkor ma yin /
translated: This is not the property of a stūpa.

original: 'di ni dge 'dun gyi dkor ma yin na de'i phyir mchod rten gyi phyir ram dge 'dun gyi phyir bskur bar bya ba gang yin pa de las ni sho gam sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dge 'dun gyi dkor ma yin na de'i phyir mchod rten gyi phyir ram dge 'dun gyi phyir bskur bar bya ba gang yin pa de las ni sho gam sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: This is not the property of the saṅgha. Therefore, a tax should not be levied on that which is given for the sake of a stūpa or the saṅgha.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de ni nyo tshong bya ba'i rgyur mi khyer @101a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / de ni nyo tshong bya ba'i rgyur mi khyer @101a * //
translated: Why is that?🔽Because it is not carried for the purpose of buying and selling.

original: pas so // zong de las zong dang 'dra ba yang mi blang ngo //
analyzed: pas so // zong de las zong dang 'dra ba yang mi blang ngo //
translated: Merchandise similar to that merchandise should not be accepted.

original: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: mchod pa'i phyir bskur gyi rnyed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //🔽'di mkhan po'i yin /
analyzed: mchod pa'i phyir bskur gyi rnyed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no // 'di mkhan po'i yin /
translated: It is for the purpose of worship, not for the purpose of profit.🔽This belongs to the preceptor.

original: 'di slob dpon gyi yin /🔽'di ma'i yin /
analyzed: 'di slob dpon gyi yin / 'di ma'i yin /
translated: This belongs to the teacher.🔽This belongs to the mother.

original: 'di pha'i yin na /
analyzed: 'di pha'i yin na /
translated: This belongs to the father.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon dang pha ma'i phyir khyer ba gang yin pa de las kyang sho gam sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon dang pha ma'i phyir khyer ba gang yin pa de las kyang sho gam sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: If it is carried for the purpose of the preceptor, teacher, father, or mother, then no duty is to be paid on it.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ni nyo tshong bya ba'i rgyur mi khyer bas so //
analyzed: de ni nyo tshong bya ba'i rgyur mi khyer bas so //
translated: Because it is not carried for the purpose of buying and selling.

original: zong de las zong dang 'dra ba yang blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: zong de las zong dang 'dra ba yang blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: Goods similar to those goods should not be accepted.

original: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de ni mchod pa'i phyir khyer gyi rnyed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni mchod pa'i phyir khyer gyi rnyed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is carried for the purpose of worship, not for the purpose of profit.

original: 'di skyes yin te /🔽dper na yul gzhan nam /
analyzed: 'di skyes yin te / dper na yul gzhan nam /
translated: This is a birth present.🔽For example, if it is to be carried to another country

original: yul gzhan du bskur bar bya ba zhig yin na de las sho gam sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yul gzhan du bskur bar bya ba zhig yin na de las sho gam sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: or another place, then no duty is to be paid on it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: snga ma bzhin du skyes kyi phyir bskur ba yin gyi rnyed pa'i phyir ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar dang / 'di longs spyod kyi rdzas yin na longs spyod kyi phyir bskur ba gang yin pa de las kyang sho gam sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin du de longs spyod kyi phyir bskur ba yin gyi rnyed pa'i phyir ma yin no zhes bya ba
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du skyes kyi phyir bskur ba yin gyi rnyed pa'i phyir ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar dang / 'di longs spyod kyi rdzas yin na longs spyod kyi phyir bskur ba gang yin pa de las kyang sho gam sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin du de longs spyod kyi phyir bskur ba yin gyi rnyed pa'i phyir ma yin no zhes bya ba
translated: It is given for the sake of enjoyment, not for the sake of gain.

original: la sogs pa'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //🔽rgyal po'i bstan dag las kyang bag ma blang ba dang / gtang ba dang / mchod sbyin bya ba dang / btsas pa'i ltas mkhan dang / lha la mchod pa dang / gtsug phud 'dreg pa dang / ba lang sbyin pa dang / brtul zhugs dang /
analyzed: la sogs pa'i bar du 'byung ba yin no // rgyal po'i bstan dag las kyang bag ma blang ba dang / gtang ba dang / mchod sbyin bya ba dang / btsas pa'i ltas mkhan dang / lha la mchod pa dang / gtsug phud 'dreg pa dang / ba lang sbyin pa dang / brtul zhugs dang /
translated: This is stated in the scriptures of the king.

original: rab tu 'byung ba la sogs pa bya ba'i khyad par rnams kyi rdzas kyi sho gam mi bya ba yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba la sogs pa bya ba'i khyad par rnams kyi rdzas kyi sho gam mi bya ba yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The king's scriptures also state that a tax should not be levied on substances used for special purposes such as taking a bride, giving her away, making offerings, consulting astrologers at birth, worshipping gods, shaving the head, giving cows, austerities,🔽going forth, and so on.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten na zong las gzhan pa lam brgyags la sogs pa ni sho gam gcad par 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten na zong las gzhan pa lam brgyags la sogs pa ni sho gam gcad par 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the world, goods other than merchandise, such as provisions for the journey, are not subject to customs duties.

original: 'o na gang na sho gam gcod pa dag thams cad 'phrog pa yin na der ji ltar bsgrub ce na /
analyzed: 'o na gang na sho gam gcod pa dag thams cad 'phrog pa yin na der ji ltar bsgrub ce na /
translated: But if all the customs officials in a country were to steal, how could one establish a case?

original: rtsa ba'i bye brag tu bshad pa las /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i bye brag tu bshad pa las /
translated: The Mūla-vibhāṣā says:

original: de'i phyir sho gam 'di ci 'dra ba zhig gis dbang bar bya ba yin zhe na /🔽gang zhig chos bzhin du srung ba dang / skyob pa dang / sbed pa dang / kun 'ged par byed pa des sho gam dbang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sho gam 'di ci 'dra ba zhig gis dbang bar bya ba yin zhe na / gang zhig chos bzhin du srung ba dang / skyob pa dang / sbed pa dang / kun 'ged par byed pa des sho gam dbang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, what kind of customs duty is to be collected?🔽If one protects, guards, hides, and distributes in accordance with the Dharma, then customs duty is to be collected.

original: gang zhig chos bzhin du srung ba dang / skyob pa dang / sbed pa dang / kun 'ged par mi byed pa des ni sho gam dbang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig chos bzhin du srung ba dang / skyob pa dang / sbed pa dang / kun 'ged par mi byed pa des ni sho gam dbang bar mi bya'o //
translated: If one does not protect, guard, hide, and distribute in accordance with the Dharma, then customs duty is not to be collected.

original: gang zhig len par byed na de thams cad dngos gzhi'am byin par len pa'i kha @101b na ma tho bas reg pa yin no zhes gsungs pa dang 'jig rten pa'i tshul las kyang rgyal pos bsrungs pa'i phyir skal ba sho gam yin no zhes 'byung ba dang /🔽de'i phyir / skye dgu nyon mongs srung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gang zhig len par byed na de thams cad dngos gzhi'am byin par len pa'i kha @101b na ma tho bas reg pa yin no zhes gsungs pa dang 'jig rten pa'i tshul las kyang rgyal pos bsrungs pa'i phyir skal ba sho gam yin no zhes 'byung ba dang / de'i phyir / skye dgu nyon mongs srung ba'i phyir //
translated: Also, in worldly terms, it is said that a tax is a share of the harvest, because it is protected by the king.🔽Therefore it is said:

original: rgyal po la ni sho gam 'jal //
analyzed: rgyal po la ni sho gam 'jal //
translated: Because the king protects the people,🔽he is paid a tax.

original: gal te de yang srung ba yis //🔽nyon gla yin bu lon min //
analyzed: gal te de yang srung ba yis // nyon gla yin bu lon min //
translated: If he also protects them,

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: he is paid a salary, not a debt.

original: de bas na chom rkun dag dang 'dra bar thams cad 'phrog pa dag las ni 'das na yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na chom rkun dag dang 'dra bar thams cad 'phrog pa dag las ni 'das na yang nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, if one passes beyond all those who are like thieves, there is no fault.

original: de bzhin du yang de srung ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes kyang 'byung ste de'i las ni zong srung ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang de srung ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes kyang 'byung ste de'i las ni zong srung ba yin te /
translated: Also, it is said that it is like that because it is the Dharma of protection. Its function is to protect goods.

original: srung ba'i skal ba yin pas de la sho gam gzhal lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / de bas na 'phrog pa rnams ni srung ba'i skal ba mi dbang bar 'os pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: srung ba'i skal ba yin pas de la sho gam gzhal lo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / de bas na 'phrog pa rnams ni srung ba'i skal ba mi dbang bar 'os pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that those who steal are not entitled to the protector’s share.

original: sho gam gyis ni gru btsas kyang rnam par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: sho gam gyis ni gru btsas kyang rnam par bshad pa yin te /
translated: The toll is also explained as the fare for a boat.

original: de yang 'jig rten kho na las yin pas so //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten kho na las yin pas so //
translated: And that is only in the world.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽One should not pay the fare for a boat

original: sbrum ma zla ba gnyis la sogs //
analyzed: sbrum ma zla ba gnyis la sogs //
translated: to a pregnant woman, to one who is two months pregnant,🔽to one who has gone forth, to a sage,

original: rab tu byung dang thub pa dang // bram ze dang ni rtags can las //🔽gru btsas blang bar mi bya'o //🔽zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rab tu byung dang thub pa dang // bram ze dang ni rtags can las // gru btsas blang bar mi bya'o // zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: to a brahmin, or to one who has a mark.

original: de bas na rab tu byung ba rnams la ni gru btsas med do //🔽skal ba thob phyir sdom brtson rkun po la //
analyzed: de bas na rab tu byung ba rnams la ni gru btsas med do // skal ba thob phyir sdom brtson rkun po la //
translated: Therefore, those who have gone forth do not pay the fare for a boat.🔽If a monk who is diligent in the precepts

original: lam stsogs ston pas gal te grogs byed na //
analyzed: lam stsogs ston pas gal te grogs byed na //
translated: shows the way to a thief in order to help him,

original: skal ba thob na brtul zhugs nyams par 'dong //
analyzed: skal ba thob na brtul zhugs nyams par 'dong //
translated: he will lose his vow if he receives a share.

original: tshul min chad pas gcod pa chod na yin //
analyzed: tshul min chad pas gcod pa chod na yin //
translated: If he is cut by an unjust punishment, that is permissible.

original: gal te sdom brtson gyis skal pa thob par bya ba'i phyir chom rkun pa rnams la lam la sogs pa ston pa dag gis grogs byed na de'i tshe skal ba thob par gyur na brtul zhugs las nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te sdom brtson gyis skal pa thob par bya ba'i phyir chom rkun pa rnams la lam la sogs pa ston pa dag gis grogs byed na de'i tshe skal ba thob par gyur na brtul zhugs las nyams pa yin no //
translated: If a monk who is striving for spiritual accomplishment helps thieves by showing them the road, etc. in order to obtain a share of the loot, then he loses his spiritual discipline when he obtains his share.

original: de bzhin du gang gi tshe las byed pa rnams la ni rigs pas chad pas gcod na de'i tshe yang chad pas chod par gyur pa nyid na brtul zhugs las nyams pa yin no //🔽lo tog dag la shog shig gzhan min zhes //🔽gzhan gyi zhing la chu 'dren gcod byed la //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang gi tshe las byed pa rnams la ni rigs pas chad pas gcod na de'i tshe yang chad pas chod par gyur pa nyid na brtul zhugs las nyams pa yin no // lo tog dag la shog shig gzhan min zhes // gzhan gyi zhing la chu 'dren gcod byed la //
translated: Similarly, if he punishes criminals in accordance with the law, then he loses his spiritual discipline when the punishment is carried out.

original: rang gi lo tog dag ni legs gyur cing //🔽gzhan gyi lo tog 'gribs 'dir dngos gzhir 'gyur //
analyzed: rang gi lo tog dag ni legs gyur cing // gzhan gyi lo tog 'gribs 'dir dngos gzhir 'gyur //
translated: The root text states, “It is a root downfall for a monk to divert water to his own field, or to prevent it from reaching another’s field.”🔽The commentary explains:

original: gal te bdag gi ni legs par shog shig / gzhan gyi ni nyes par gyur cig ces bya ba'i bsam pa 'dis pha rol gyi zhing la chu 'dren tam gcod par byed la /
analyzed: gal te bdag gi ni legs par shog shig / gzhan gyi ni nyes par gyur cig ces bya ba'i bsam pa 'dis pha rol gyi zhing la chu 'dren tam gcod par byed la /
translated: If a monk diverts water to his own field or prevents it from reaching another’s field, with the thought, “May my crops grow well and may the crops of others wither,” then this is a root downfall.

original: pha rol gyi nyes shing rang gi lo tog @102a * //
analyzed: pha rol gyi nyes shing rang gi lo tog @102a * //
translated: The faults of others and your own harvest🔽

original: legs na de'i tshe dngos gzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: legs na de'i tshe dngos gzhir 'gyur te /
translated: If the harvest of the other is poor and one's own is good, then it is the actual basis.

original: pha rol gyi nyes pa'i tshad las lhag par gyur na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pha rol gyi nyes pa'i tshad las lhag par gyur na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If the measure of the other's loss is exceeded, that is the meaning.

original: dper na khal bcu gnyis byung ba las khal bzhi 'gribs la dge slong la ni khal bzhi lhag par gyur na de dag gi rin thang gis ltung ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na khal bcu gnyis byung ba las khal bzhi 'gribs la dge slong la ni khal bzhi lhag par gyur na de dag gi rin thang gis ltung ba yin no //
translated: For example, if twelve measures of grain are produced and four measures are lost, but four measures are left for the monk, then it is a downfall by the value of those.

original: 'dir chu 'dren pa dang gcod pa ni rgyun phyogs su 'bab pa las sam zhing 'gram du bab pa las yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir chu 'dren pa dang gcod pa ni rgyun phyogs su 'bab pa las sam zhing 'gram du bab pa las yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand that drawing off or diverting water is from a current or from a field.

original: de bzhin du 'dir rku ba ni lo tog legs pa la brten pa yin gyi chu la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir rku ba ni lo tog legs pa la brten pa yin gyi chu la ni ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, here, stealing is based on a good harvest, not on water,

original: rang gi zhing la chu 'dor ba'am gcod pa ni rku ba mi bskyed par thal ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rang gi zhing la chu 'dor ba'am gcod pa ni rku ba mi bskyed par thal ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it would follow that drawing off or diverting water to one's own field would not generate stealing.

original: ; gzhan gyi lo tog dag ni 'gribs zhes bya ba ci dgos she na /
analyzed: ; gzhan gyi lo tog dag ni 'gribs zhes bya ba ci dgos she na /
translated: What is the point of saying that the harvest of others is diminished?

original: gzhan gyi lo tog 'gribs par ma gyur na cung zad kyang brkus par mi 'gyur zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lo tog 'gribs par ma gyur na cung zad kyang brkus par mi 'gyur zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is taught in order to show that if the other's crop is not diminished, then it is not stealing at all.

original: lo tog bdag la shog shig gzhan min zhes bya ba ci dgos she na /
analyzed: lo tog bdag la shog shig gzhan min zhes bya ba ci dgos she na /
translated: What is the point of saying, May the crop come to me, not to another?

original: rku ba'i bsam pa med na yang rku ba slong ba ma yin la ;
analyzed: rku ba'i bsam pa med na yang rku ba slong ba ma yin la ;
translated: If there is no intention to steal, then it is not stealing.

original: 'dir rku ba de yang lo tog gang zhig gzhan gyi lo tog nyes pas rang gi lo tog legs pa gang yin pa'o zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir rku ba de yang lo tog gang zhig gzhan gyi lo tog nyes pas rang gi lo tog legs pa gang yin pa'o zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And here, that stealing is also the crop which is good for oneself, because of the fault of the other's crop.

original: 'dir yang sa'i yon tan la sogs pas gang dag lhag par grub pa ma gtogs par chu las gyur pa kho nas gang dag grub cing /
analyzed: 'dir yang sa'i yon tan la sogs pas gang dag lhag par grub pa ma gtogs par chu las gyur pa kho nas gang dag grub cing /
translated: Here also, except for those which are accomplished by the qualities of the earth, etc., those which are accomplished only by water,

original: gzhan gyi lo tog 'gribs nas rang gi lo tog legs pa kho nas gang dag grub cing gzhan gyi nyes pa'i tshad pas rang gi lhag pa de kho na la rin thang brtsi bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lo tog 'gribs nas rang gi lo tog legs pa kho nas gang dag grub cing gzhan gyi nyes pa'i tshad pas rang gi lhag pa de kho na la rin thang brtsi bar bya'o //
translated: and those which are accomplished only by the excellence of one's own crop, after the other's crop is diminished, the value of that which is superior to the other's fault should be assessed.

original: gal te rdzas la bshal te rku byed na //
analyzed: gal te rdzas la bshal te rku byed na //
translated: If one steals by deception with regard to the substance,

original: ngos gzhan gyis ni ngos gzhan sa mtshams thal //🔽de tshe brkus yin bteg brkus sa 'phags yin //
analyzed: ngos gzhan gyis ni ngos gzhan sa mtshams thal // de tshe brkus yin bteg brkus sa 'phags yin //
translated: If one side is lifted, then the other side is lifted.

original: gal te rdzas bshal te rku bar byed na ngos gzhan gyis ngos gzhan phyi ma'i sa las thal te song na de'i tshe brkus pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te rdzas bshal te rku bar byed na ngos gzhan gyis ngos gzhan phyi ma'i sa las thal te song na de'i tshe brkus pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: If one steals by scraping away the substance, then one should understand that at the time the other side has gone beyond the boundary of the other side.

original: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: Here the text of the Vinaya Scripture says:

original: dge slong gis yo byad lci bas shin tu thag ring por rku bar bgyid kyang mthar mi 'gyur ba mchis lags sam /
analyzed: dge slong gis yo byad lci bas shin tu thag ring por rku bar bgyid kyang mthar mi 'gyur ba mchis lags sam /
translated: “Can it be that a bhikṣu steals a heavy article over a long distance, but does not commit a pārājika offense?”

original: yod de / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yod de / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Yes, it can be.

original: dge slong gis yo byad lci ba phyogs gcig nas bzung ste shin tu thag ring por 'dren par byed kyang ngos cig shos gnas de nas ma thal na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gis yo byad lci ba phyogs gcig nas bzung ste shin tu thag ring por 'dren par byed kyang ngos cig shos gnas de nas ma thal na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: It is like this: if a bhikṣu seizes a heavy article at one place and drags it over a long distance, but the other side does not leave that place, then there is a saṃghāvaśeṣa offense.”

original: gal te de ltar @102b yin na rdzas kyis non pa'i ri mo la sogs pas mtshams la ji ltar rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te de ltar @102b yin na rdzas kyis non pa'i ri mo la sogs pas mtshams la ji ltar rtogs par bya ste /
translated: If that is so, how would one understand the boundary of a design that is covered by a substance?

original: 'di ltar gal te sa de gas pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bye brag ma phye bar gsungs kyi rdzas kyis khyab pa'i phyogs las phyi rol du gyur pa'i sa de gas pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ma gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te sa de gas pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa bye brag ma phye bar gsungs kyi rdzas kyis khyab pa'i phyogs las phyi rol du gyur pa'i sa de gas pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ma gsungs so zhe na /
translated: If one says, “The Buddha spoke in a general way, without specifying that the earth is cracked and so on, but he did not say that the earth outside the area covered by the substance is cracked and so on,”

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: then we reply:

original: rdzas rku bar bya ba des khyab pa'i phyogs gang yin pa der gtogs pa dag gas pa rnams la ni mtshams gzhan nyid yin par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rdzas rku bar bya ba des khyab pa'i phyogs gang yin pa der gtogs pa dag gas pa rnams la ni mtshams gzhan nyid yin par mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable that the boundary of the area covered by the substance is different from the area where the earth is cracked and so on.

original: de ltar na ril gyis brkus par mi 'gyur gyi cha phyi ma la brkus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na ril gyis brkus par mi 'gyur gyi cha phyi ma la brkus par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the entire area would not be stolen, but only the area outside would be stolen.

original: cha shas 'dres shing 'byar ba drang bar bya ba la brten par byed pa dag ni 'dus pa'i ngo bo las logs shig tu rku bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: cha shas 'dres shing 'byar ba drang bar bya ba la brten par byed pa dag ni 'dus pa'i ngo bo las logs shig tu rku bar mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable to steal the mixed and combined parts of a whole that is to be stolen.

original: 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is located in the nature of the assembly.

original: bteg ste rku ba thams cad la ni sa las 'phags pa kho na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: bteg ste rku ba thams cad la ni sa las 'phags pa kho na brkus pa yin no //
translated: In all cases of theft, when something is lifted up, it is considered stolen when it is taken off the ground.

original: 'dir sa ni rdzas kyi gzhi zung la sogs pa mtshon pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir sa ni rdzas kyi gzhi zung la sogs pa mtshon pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the ground should be understood as a general term for the basis of a material object.

original: de ltar yang zhus pa las /
analyzed: de ltar yang zhus pa las /
translated: Thus, the Questions of Revata states:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis zung dang bcas te brkus na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis zung dang bcas te brkus na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “Lord, if a monk steals something that is part of a pair, what does he become guilty of?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha replied:

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: “He becomes guilty of a serious offense.

original: gang gi tshe zung las bral ba de'i tshe mthar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zung las bral ba de'i tshe mthar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: When it is no longer part of a pair, then he becomes guilty of a serious offense.”

original: dbyug pa la sogs brgyab pas shing tog rku //
analyzed: dbyug pa la sogs brgyab pas shing tog rku //
translated: When fruit is stolen by striking with a stick, etc.,

original: 'og tu ltung na brkus pa yin par bstan //
analyzed: 'og tu ltung na brkus pa yin par bstan //
translated: it is taught that it is stolen when it falls.

original: dbyug pa la sogs pa dag gis brgyab pas shing tog rnams brku na 'og tu ltung ba kho na na brkus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dbyug pa la sogs pa dag gis brgyab pas shing tog rnams brku na 'og tu ltung ba kho na na brkus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: When fruit is stolen by striking with a stick, etc., it should be understood that it is stolen when it falls to the ground.

original: grogs mang dag dang 'grogs te rku byed na //
analyzed: grogs mang dag dang 'grogs te rku byed na //
translated: When many people steal together,

original: skal ba thob na brkus yin sngar min no //
analyzed: skal ba thob na brkus yin sngar min no //
translated: If one obtains one’s share, it is stealing, but not otherwise.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /
translated: Here is the text:

original: mun khud du gos gzhag pa las dge slong bzhis rku na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: mun khud du gos gzhag pa las dge slong bzhis rku na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “If a monk steals the robe of another monk who has placed it in a dark place, what is the offense?”

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: “It is a serious offense.”

original: gang gi tshe mthar 'gyur lags /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mthar 'gyur lags /
translated: “When does it become a downfall?”

original: gang gi tshe bzhi char gyis so so'i skal ba rang gir byas la gcig gi skal ba la dngos po tshang na mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bzhi char gyis so so'i skal ba rang gir byas la gcig gi skal ba la dngos po tshang na mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: “When each of the four has taken his own share, if the value of one’s share is complete, it becomes a downfall.

original: ma tshang na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: ma tshang na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If it is incomplete, it is a serious offense.”

original: skye bo mang po'i rdzas rku gang gi tshe //
analyzed: skye bo mang po'i rdzas rku gang gi tshe //
translated: When many people’s goods are stolen,

original: re re'i skal bas rin thang tshang na brlag //
analyzed: re re'i skal bas rin thang tshang na brlag //
translated: if the value of each person’s share is complete, it is a downfall.

original: skye bo mang pos gang tshe rku byed na //
analyzed: skye bo mang pos gang tshe rku byed na //
translated: When many people steal,🔽then it is determined by the value of each person’s share.

original: de tshe rang skal rin gyis rnam par gzhag / skye bo mang po la bdog pa rku bar byed na @103a * //
analyzed: de tshe rang skal rin gyis rnam par gzhag / skye bo mang po la bdog pa rku bar byed na @103a * //
translated: When many people’s possessions are stolen,

original: bdag po re re'i skal ba'i rin thang las ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag po re re'i skal ba'i rin thang las ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if the value of each owner’s share is complete, there is a downfall.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /
translated: Here is the text:

original: dge slong gis shin tu mang po brkus kyang mthar mi 'gyur ba ma chis lags sam /
analyzed: dge slong gis shin tu mang po brkus kyang mthar mi 'gyur ba ma chis lags sam /
translated: Is it possible that a fully ordained monk does not become an outcast even though he steals a great deal?

original: yod de / skye bo mang po'i rku bar byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: yod de / skye bo mang po'i rku bar byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Yes, if he steals from many people, he commits a serious offense.

original: 'dir yang skye bo mang po ji snyed pa'i rin thang tshang bar ma gyur ba'i skye bo mang po de snyed la dgongs nas nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang skye bo mang po ji snyed pa'i rin thang tshang bar ma gyur ba'i skye bo mang po de snyed la dgongs nas nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Here, the serious offense is committed with the intention of the value of the many people equaling the value of the many things.

original: 'dir 'phags pa nyer sbas kyi zhal nas ni gal te de la srung ma dag bzhag pa yin na de dag kho na las ma byin par len pa yin te ;
analyzed: 'dir 'phags pa nyer sbas kyi zhal nas ni gal te de la srung ma dag bzhag pa yin na de dag kho na las ma byin par len pa yin te ;
translated: Here Ārya Upagupta says, “If guardians are appointed over that property, then it is taken without giving from just those guardians.

original: 'di ltar mchod rten la sogs pa dang / phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi rdzas dag las gang gi phyir srung ma dag gis gzhal dgos pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar mchod rten la sogs pa dang / phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyi rdzas dag las gang gi phyir srung ma dag gis gzhal dgos pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because the guardians must be paid from the property of the stūpa and so on and the Saṅgha of the four directions.”

original: gzhan dag na re ni rdzas kyi bdag po kho na dag las ma byin par len pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ni rdzas kyi bdag po kho na dag las ma byin par len pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: Others explain that the completion of taking what is not given is by the owner of the substance alone.

original: skye bo mang po dang lhan cig pas gcig gi rdzas rku bar byed na rang rang gi skal ba'i rin thang kho na las ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bo mang po dang lhan cig pas gcig gi rdzas rku bar byed na rang rang gi skal ba'i rin thang kho na las ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one steals the substance of another together with many people, then one commits a downfall by the value of one’s own share.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /
translated: Here the text of the Questions of Upāli says:

original: de bzhin du skye bo mang po dang lhan cig tu rku bar byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye bo mang po dang lhan cig tu rku bar byed na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: “If one steals together with many people, one commits a serious transgression.

original: ji ste re re'i skal ba las ma sha ka lnga byung na mthar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ste re re'i skal ba las ma sha ka lnga byung na mthar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one steals the property of many people and one’s share is worth less than one and a half māsaka coins, one commits a downfall.”

original: 'o na gang na skye bo mang po'i rdzas yod pa la skye bo mang pos rku na der ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang na skye bo mang po'i rdzas yod pa la skye bo mang pos rku na der ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: If the property of many people is stolen by many people, how should one understand this?

original: dbrog par bya ba gcig gi skal ba ji tsam yod pa de las 'phrog pa po gcig gi skal ba ci yod pa de'i rin thang gis de la ltung bar 'gyur bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dbrog par bya ba gcig gi skal ba ji tsam yod pa de las 'phrog pa po gcig gi skal ba ci yod pa de'i rin thang gis de la ltung bar 'gyur bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The value of the share of one who steals should be understood as the value of the share of one who is entitled to a share.

original: dge 'dun dag ni nor gcig spun 'dra bas //
analyzed: dge 'dun dag ni nor gcig spun 'dra bas //
translated: The Saṅgha is like a single kinsman.

original: dge 'dun ched byas skal ba mi brtag ste //
analyzed: dge 'dun ched byas skal ba mi brtag ste //
translated: The share of one who is for the sake of the Saṅgha is not to be considered.

original: zhing bgo min phyir sdom brtson mang phyir ro //
analyzed: zhing bgo min phyir sdom brtson mang phyir ro //
translated: Because the field is not divided, and because there are many who are diligent.

original: gzhan du lung las rin thang dpyad mi 'gyur //🔽ji ltar spun nor gcig pa rnams ni so so nas nor thams cad la so so ba ma yin pa nyid kyis bdag gir bya ba'i blo 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan du lung las rin thang dpyad mi 'gyur // ji ltar spun nor gcig pa rnams ni so so nas nor thams cad la so so ba ma yin pa nyid kyis bdag gir bya ba'i blo 'byung ngo //
translated: Otherwise, the value would be considered in the scriptures.

original: de bzhin du dge slong rnams la yang dge 'dun gyi rdzas la so so ba ma yin pa nyid kyis bdag gir bya ba yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong rnams la yang dge 'dun gyi rdzas la so so ba ma yin pa nyid kyis bdag gir bya ba yod do //
translated: Just as kinsmen who have a single property do not have individual ownership of the property, because it is not divided, in the same way, monks have a share in the property of the Saṅgha, because it is not divided.

original: de lta bas na dge 'dun gyi ched du brkus pa la ma sha ka lnga tsam kho nas pham par 'gyur gyi dge slong re re'i skal bas ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rnam par @103b gnas so ;
analyzed: de lta bas na dge 'dun gyi ched du brkus pa la ma sha ka lnga tsam kho nas pham par 'gyur gyi dge slong re re'i skal bas ni ma yin no zhes bya bar rnam par @103b gnas so ;
translated: Therefore, it is determined that stealing for the sake of the Saṅgha is a downfall by the mere value of five māsakas, but not by the value of the share of each monk.

original: /'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
analyzed: /'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
translated: Here is the text from the Vinaya:

original: dge slong gnyug mar gnas pa zhig gis dge 'dun gyi zhing rmed par byed la de dang ha cang mi ring ba zhig na khyim bdag gi zhing zhig yod pas khyim bdag de 'ongs nas smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong gnyug mar gnas pa zhig gis dge 'dun gyi zhing rmed par byed la de dang ha cang mi ring ba zhig na khyim bdag gi zhing zhig yod pas khyim bdag de 'ongs nas smras pa /
translated: A resident monk was plowing the Saṅgha’s field. Not far from there was a householder’s field. The householder came and said,

original: btsun pa ci bdag gi zhing rmed dam /
analyzed: btsun pa ci bdag gi zhing rmed dam /
translated: “Venerable! Are you plowing my field?”

original: zhing 'di ni khyod kyi ma yin gyi dge 'dun gyi yin no //
analyzed: zhing 'di ni khyod kyi ma yin gyi dge 'dun gyi yin no //
translated: “This field is not yours, it is the Saṅgha’s.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: btsun pa mi ma yin pa'i che bzhi rnams kyis bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: btsun pa mi ma yin pa'i che bzhi rnams kyis bstan par bya'o //
translated: “Venerable! The nonhuman spirits will teach you.”

original: zhes smras nas /
analyzed: zhes smras nas /
translated: Having said that,

original: khyim bdag des sngon gyi mur phur pa btsugs pa dag des brkos te bstan pa dang / dge slong gis rmed pa bor ro //
analyzed: khyim bdag des sngon gyi mur phur pa btsugs pa dag des brkos te bstan pa dang / dge slong gis rmed pa bor ro //
translated: the householder pulled out the old pegs that marked the boundaries and showed them to the monk. The monk stopped plowing.

original: des khyim bdag de song ba dang phur ba de nang du btsugs nas zhing rmed do //
analyzed: des khyim bdag de song ba dang phur ba de nang du btsugs nas zhing rmed do //
translated: When the householder had gone, the monk planted the stake and plowed the field.

original: khyim bdag de yang 'ongs nas smras pa /
analyzed: khyim bdag de yang 'ongs nas smras pa /
translated: When the householder returned, he said,

original: btsun pa khar rtsang bdag gis khyod pham par byas na ci da ltar yang zhing rmed dam /
analyzed: btsun pa khar rtsang bdag gis khyod pham par byas na ci da ltar yang zhing rmed dam /
translated: “Venerable, yesterday I defeated you, but now you are plowing my field.”

original: de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: When he felt regret, the Bhagavan said,

original: gal te dngos po tshang na mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po tshang na mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the conditions are complete, a downfall is accrued.

original: dngos po ma tshang na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po ma tshang na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If the conditions are incomplete, a serious violation is accrued.

original: 'di snyam du gal te dngos po tshang na zhes gsungs pa las na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te dngos po tshang na zhes gsungs pa las na /
translated: If you think that since it says, “If the conditions are complete,”

original: de las de'i skal ba gang yod pa de kho na las ltung ba de 'byung bar dgongs pa yin te /
analyzed: de las de'i skal ba gang yod pa de kho na las ltung ba de 'byung bar dgongs pa yin te /
translated: then the downfall is accrued only from that which is the portion of the monk,

original: ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa las chung ba'i zhing ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems na de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: ma sha ka lnga la sogs pa las chung ba'i zhing ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems na de ni mi rung ste /
translated: that is not correct because it is not tenable that a field smaller than five māsakas and so on is a field.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: zhing bgo min phyir /
analyzed: zhing bgo min phyir /
translated: Because it is not a field to be divided.

original: dge 'dun gyi zhing ni bgo bar bya ba ma yin pas skal ba rnam par gcad pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi zhing ni bgo bar bya ba ma yin pas skal ba rnam par gcad pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The field of the Saṅgha is not to be divided, so it is impossible to determine a share.

original: gzhan yang sdom brtson mang phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang sdom brtson mang phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, because there are many who are diligent in vows.

original: dge slong rnams ni dpag tu med pa yin pas til tsam gyi skal ba zhig srid pas rin thang tshang ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong rnams ni dpag tu med pa yin pas til tsam gyi skal ba zhig srid pas rin thang tshang ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since there are innumerable monks, it is possible that a share the size of a sesame seed would be equal in value to the entire gift.

original: de lta bas na lung gi gzhung las /
analyzed: de lta bas na lung gi gzhung las /
translated: Therefore, in the scriptures,

original: gal te dngos po tshang na zhe 'am 'on te ma tshang na zhes rin thang dpyad par 'di mi 'byung gi /'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po tshang na zhe 'am 'on te ma tshang na zhes rin thang dpyad par 'di mi 'byung gi /'o na ci zhe na /
translated: it does not say, “If the value is complete or incomplete,” but rather,

original: nyes pa sbom po kho nar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs par gyur pa zhig na /
analyzed: nyes pa sbom po kho nar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs par gyur pa zhig na /
translated: “There is only a serious offense.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rin thang dpyad par yang mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rin thang dpyad par yang mdzad do //
translated: But the Blessed One did determine the value.

original: de lta bas na 'di skad gsungs pa ni zhing ma bgos pa la bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di skad gsungs pa ni zhing ma bgos pa la bya bar mngon no //
translated: Therefore, it is clear that this statement refers to an undivided field.

original: gzhan du na ni rin thang dpyad pa'i skabs med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni rin thang dpyad pa'i skabs med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no occasion to determine the value.

original: gang zhig btus sam bsdus sam nags tshal la //
analyzed: gang zhig btus sam bsdus sam nags tshal la //
translated: If one plucks or gathers or steals a forest,

original: rku na spags pa nyid na brkus pa yin //
analyzed: rku na spags pa nyid na brkus pa yin //
translated: it is stolen when it is removed from its place.

original: me tog dag ni btus @104a * //
analyzed: me tog dag ni btus @104a * //
translated: If one plucks flowers,

original: nas gos dag ni bsdus nas spungs shing thum por bcings te rku na thum po gnas nas spags pa kho na nas brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: nas gos dag ni bsdus nas spungs shing thum por bcings te rku na thum po gnas nas spags pa kho na nas brkus pa yin no //
translated: gathers grass, or steals a forest, it is stolen when it is removed from its place.🔽If one plucks flowers, it is stolen when it is removed from its place.

original: de bzhin du nags tshal yang gnas nas spags pa kho na nas brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du nags tshal yang gnas nas spags pa kho na nas brkus pa yin no //
translated: If one gathers grass or steals a forest, it is stolen when it is removed from its place.🔽But what about the Exposition of the Vinaya, which states:

original: 'o na rnam par 'byed pa las me tog dang ljon shing bton nas rku bar byed na me tog dang ljon shing gi rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par 'byed pa las me tog dang ljon shing bton nas rku bar byed na me tog dang ljon shing gi rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ji lta bu yin /
translated: If one plucks flowers or trees and steals them, one should calculate the value of the flowers and trees.

original: 'di ltar 'di las bton nas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir sngar 'don par byed na phyis rku bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di las bton nas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir sngar 'don par byed na phyis rku bar byed do //
translated: It is said here that if one plucks them, one steals them later.

original: bar mngon na de ji ltar na spags pa nyid na brkus pa yin zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: bar mngon na de ji ltar na spags pa nyid na brkus pa yin zhes bya zhe na /
translated: But if it is in the middle, how can it be said that it is stolen when it is removed from its place?

original: bshad pa las ni shing bton nas rku bar byed ces bya ba ni kha gdangs nas nyal lo zhes bya ba dang 'dra'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bshad pa las ni shing bton nas rku bar byed ces bya ba ni kha gdangs nas nyal lo zhes bya ba dang 'dra'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The Subcommentary states: “The phrase ‘having removed it, one steals it’ is similar to the phrase ‘having opened the mouth, one sleeps.’🔽”

original: bshad pa zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i rnam par 'byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i rnam par 'byed pa yin no //
translated: The Subcommentary is the Pratītya­sunnatti.

original: 'di ltar 'di las bton nas rku bar byed ces bya ba'i don 'di gnas pa'i phyir nas zhes bya ba ni dus snga ma nyid la mi bya'i dus mnyam pa nyid kho na la bya bar mngon te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di las bton nas rku bar byed ces bya ba'i don 'di gnas pa'i phyir nas zhes bya ba ni dus snga ma nyid la mi bya'i dus mnyam pa nyid kho na la bya bar mngon te /
translated: The meaning of the phrase “having removed it, one steals it” is that the word “having” indicates not only the prior time but also the simultaneous time.

original: dper na kha gdangs nal zhes bya ba dang / mig btsums nas dgod ces bya ba dang / brten nas 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba la nas zhes bya ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na kha gdangs nal zhes bya ba dang / mig btsums nas dgod ces bya ba dang / brten nas 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba la nas zhes bya ba yod pa yin no //
translated: For example, the words “having opened the mouth” and “having closed the eyes” and the phrase “dependent origination” have the word “having.”

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang bton nas zhes bya ba nas ni dus mnyam pa nyid la bya bar gsungs so zhes bya bar the tshom med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang bton nas zhes bya ba nas ni dus mnyam pa nyid la bya bar gsungs so zhes bya bar the tshom med do //
translated: Similarly, there is no doubt that the phrase “having removed it” refers to the simultaneous time.

original: nags tshal zhes bya ba yang 'dir mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: nags tshal zhes bya ba yang 'dir mtshon pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: The word “forest” is merely an illustration.

original: 'bras bu can ni nags tshal yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu can ni nags tshal yin //
translated: The forest is the fruit-bearing trees.

original: me tog 'bras ldan ljon shing yin //
analyzed: me tog 'bras ldan ljon shing yin //
translated: The trees are the flowering and fruit-bearing trees.

original: 'bras bu smin zad sman yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu smin zad sman yin no //
translated: The medicinal plants are the trees whose fruit is ripe.

original: 'khri shing gel ba nags ma yin //
analyzed: 'khri shing gel ba nags ma yin //
translated: The vines and bushes are not the forest.

original: zhes 'byung ba lta bur ljon shing dang / nags ma dang sman rnams zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba 'di la brten par mi bya'o //🔽rgyan po dor byas rgyal na nyes par 'gyur //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba lta bur ljon shing dang / nags ma dang sman rnams zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba 'di la brten par mi bya'o // rgyan po dor byas rgyal na nyes par 'gyur //
translated: Thus, one should not rely on this classification of trees, forest, and medicinal plants.🔽If one wins by cheating at dice, one commits an offense.

original: rgyan po dor byas pas rgyal na nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyan po dor byas pas rgyal na nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one wins by cheating at dice, one commits an offense.🔽Cheating at dice, etc., counting,🔽creating signs, deceiving,🔽placing in another place, discarding,🔽changing the order, or denying,

original: rgyan po la sogs grangs la dor byed dang // mtshan ma bskyed dang 'brid par byed pa dang // gnas gzhan du ni 'jog dang 'dor byed dang // tshoms gzhan du ni 'grang ngam snyon byed dang // mi rigs pa yis thob pa sgrub byed dang //
analyzed: rgyan po la sogs grangs la dor byed dang // mtshan ma bskyed dang 'brid par byed pa dang // gnas gzhan du ni 'jog dang 'dor byed dang // tshoms gzhan du ni 'grang ngam snyon byed dang // mi rigs pa yis thob pa sgrub byed dang //
translated: attaining by an improper means,

original: gzhan la snyad btags la sogs tshul gyis rku //
analyzed: gzhan la snyad btags la sogs tshul gyis rku //
translated: stealing by slander, etc.

original: grub pa nyid na nyes pa yin par dgongs //
analyzed: grub pa nyid na nyes pa yin par dgongs //
translated: It is considered an offense even if one is successful.

original: rgyan po la @104b sogs pa bgrang ba la dor byas pas rku na grub pa nyid na nyes pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyan po la @104b sogs pa bgrang ba la dor byas pas rku na grub pa nyid na nyes pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If one steals by counting dice and so on as discarded objects, then the fault is established by the mere completion of the object.

original: de bzhin du mtshan ma bskyed pa'am 'bri ba'am gnas gzhan du 'jog pa'am 'dor ba'am de bzhin du gang na tshogs su byas te /
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan ma bskyed pa'am 'bri ba'am gnas gzhan du 'jog pa'am 'dor ba'am de bzhin du gang na tshogs su byas te /
translated: Similarly, if one steals by creating a sign, or by writing, or by placing in another location, or by discarding, or by counting oneself in the assembly,

original: rnyed pa 'bul bar byed pa'i tshogs gzhan der bdag nyid grangs su chud par byed dam /
analyzed: rnyed pa 'bul bar byed pa'i tshogs gzhan der bdag nyid grangs su chud par byed dam /
translated: or by saying, “I will give my share to the other assembly,”

original: kho bo gzhan du ma grangs so zhes tshogs snga ma la snyon par byed pa'am /
analyzed: kho bo gzhan du ma grangs so zhes tshogs snga ma la snyon par byed pa'am /
translated: or by saying, “I was not counted in the other assembly,”

original: de bzhin mi dbang bzhin du kho bo dbang ngo zhes sgrub par byed pa dang / de bzhin du khyim bdag gis byin cig ces smos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan la snyad btags pas rku na thams cad la yang don grub pa kho na na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin mi dbang bzhin du kho bo dbang ngo zhes sgrub par byed pa dang / de bzhin du khyim bdag gis byin cig ces smos so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan la snyad btags pas rku na thams cad la yang don grub pa kho na na brkus pa yin no //
translated: or by saying, “I was counted as a king,” or by saying, “I was counted as a householder,” and so on, then all of these are stealing by deception.

original: bskyis dang gtams dang brnyas pa rnams la ni //
analyzed: bskyis dang gtams dang brnyas pa rnams la ni //
translated: In the case of barter, exchange, and fraud,

original: bsnyon pas thag bcad pa na nyes pa yin //
analyzed: bsnyon pas thag bcad pa na nyes pa yin //
translated: If one denies and is found guilty, then it is a downfall.

original: bskyis pa zhes bya ba ni skyin po byas pa dang skyin por blangs pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bskyis pa zhes bya ba ni skyin po byas pa dang skyin por blangs pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Borrowed” means that it is a substitute, and “taken” means that it is a substitute that has been accepted.

original: gtams zhes bya ba ni gzhag pa ste bgrangs nas gtams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gtams zhes bya ba ni gzhag pa ste bgrangs nas gtams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Deposited” means that it is set aside, and “counted” means that it is set aside and counted.

original: de la bskyis pa dang brnyas pa dang gtams pa la bsnyon pa dag gis rku bar byed pa na thag bcad na brkus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la bskyis pa dang brnyas pa dang gtams pa la bsnyon pa dag gis rku bar byed pa na thag bcad na brkus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If one denies having borrowed, having been insulted, or having deposited something, and then steals it, then one should understand that one is guilty of theft.

original: thag bcad pa zhes bya ba ni gcig kho nar chad par byed pa ste /
analyzed: thag bcad pa zhes bya ba ni gcig kho nar chad par byed pa ste /
translated: “Found guilty” means that one is sentenced to a fine.

original: gzhan gyi re thag bcad par byas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi re thag bcad par byas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “One’s hopes are dashed” means that one is sentenced to a fine.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /
translated: Here is the text of the questions and answers:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis bskyis nas bsnyon par bgyid na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis bskyis nas bsnyon par bgyid na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “Lord, if a monk denies having borrowed something, what is he guilty of?”

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: “He is guilty of a serious offense.”

original: brnyas pa las bsnyon nas rku na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: brnyas pa las bsnyon nas rku na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “If he denies having been insulted and then steals it, what is he guilty of?”

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: “He is guilty of a serious offense.”

original: nam mthar 'gyur lags gang gi tshe thag bcad pa na'o //
analyzed: nam mthar 'gyur lags gang gi tshe thag bcad pa na'o //
translated: When does it become final? When the decision is made.

original: gzhan zhig gis dge slong la bzhag pa zhig gtams pa la blangs pa na des bsnyon par bgyid na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: gzhan zhig gis dge slong la bzhag pa zhig gtams pa la blangs pa na des bsnyon par bgyid na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: If someone deposits something with a monk, and then takes it back, and the monk denies it, what is the offense?

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: It is a serious offense.

original: nam zhig mthar 'gyur lags /
analyzed: nam zhig mthar 'gyur lags /
translated: When does it become final?

original: gang gi tshe kun du thag bcad na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe kun du thag bcad na'o //
translated: When the decision is made.

original: gtams pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gtams pa ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of deposits:

original: bgrangs nas gtams pa dang / rgyas btab ste gtams pa'o //
analyzed: bgrangs nas gtams pa dang / rgyas btab ste gtams pa'o //
translated: a deposit by counting and a sealed deposit.

original: de la gang zhig bgrangs nas gtams pa ni gtams pa zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //🔽rgyas btab ste gtams pa ni bcol te bzhag pa'o zhes te /
analyzed: de la gang zhig bgrangs nas gtams pa ni gtams pa zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to // rgyas btab ste gtams pa ni bcol te bzhag pa'o zhes te /
translated: In this case, “deposit” is taught by the phrase “a deposit by counting.”🔽A sealed deposit is a deposit that is sealed.

original: gtad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gtad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Sealed” means “sealed up.”

original: 'di'i rab tu dbye ba ni /
analyzed: 'di'i rab tu dbye ba ni /
translated: The analysis of this is as follows.

original: bcol te gtams pa rku par byed pa la //
analyzed: bcol te gtams pa rku par byed pa la //
translated: When a deposit is stolen,

original: thag bcad pa yi rab dbye rnam gsum ste //🔽zhes rnam pa @105a * //
analyzed: thag bcad pa yi rab dbye rnam gsum ste // zhes rnam pa @105a * //
translated: the analysis of a decision is of three kinds.

original: gsum du bstan to //
analyzed: gsum du bstan to //
translated: This is taught in three parts.

original: bcol ba rku ba la thag bcad pa'i rab tu dbye ba gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bcol ba rku ba la thag bcad pa'i rab tu dbye ba gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: There are three types of decisions to steal what has been entrusted.

original: gsum gang dag ce na /
analyzed: gsum gang dag ce na /
translated: What are the three?🔽It is said:

original: bshad pa / thag bcad pa dang spags mnyam spags pa yi //
analyzed: bshad pa / thag bcad pa dang spags mnyam spags pa yi //
translated: The decision is equal to the stake,

original: 'og tu thag bcad pa las nyes par 'gyur //🔽spags pa'i  rol thag bcad de bzhin bsnyon //
analyzed: 'og tu thag bcad pa las nyes par 'gyur // spags pa'i  rol thag bcad de bzhin bsnyon //
translated: the offense is below the stake.🔽The stake is decided upon, the stake is applied,

original: sbyor ba'o 'dir ni spags pa dngos gzhi yin //
analyzed: sbyor ba'o 'dir ni spags pa dngos gzhi yin //
translated: the preparation is here, the stake is the actual basis.

original: spags pa dang thag bcad pa mgo mnyam pa ni dbye ba gcig go //
analyzed: spags pa dang thag bcad pa mgo mnyam pa ni dbye ba gcig go //
translated: When the stake and the decision are equal, that is one type.

original: spags pa ni snga la phyis thag bcad pa 'di ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: spags pa ni snga la phyis thag bcad pa 'di ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: When the stake is first and the decision is later, that is the second.

original: thag bcad pa ni snga la phyis spags pa ni gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: thag bcad pa ni snga la phyis spags pa ni gsum pa yin no //
translated: When the decision is first and the stake is later, that is the third.

original: de la gal te gnas nas spags pa dang lhan cig tu thag bcad pa dang / yang na gal te spags pa'i 'og tu thag bcad pa yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: de la gal te gnas nas spags pa dang lhan cig tu thag bcad pa dang / yang na gal te spags pa'i 'og tu thag bcad pa yin yang rung ste /
translated: If the stake is decided upon together with the stake, or if the decision is made after the stake,

original: gnyi gar yang thag bcad pa nyid na brkus pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyi gar yang thag bcad pa nyid na brkus pa yin no //
translated: in both cases, if the decision is made, it is stealing.

original: 'on te thag bcad pa ni snga la /
