analyzed: 'on te thag bcad pa ni snga la /
translated: But if the decision is made first🔽and

original: phyi nas spags pa yin na de'i tshe thag bcad pa ni sbyor ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi nas spags pa yin na de'i tshe thag bcad pa ni sbyor ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If it is later that he is accused, then at that time the accusation is to be understood as the application.

original: de bzhin du bsnyon pa yang sbyor ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsnyon pa yang sbyor ba kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Likewise, the accusation is also just the application.

original: 'dir don gyis na thag bcad pas snga ba'i bsnyon pa ni sbyor ba nyid yin par khong du chud par bya la /
analyzed: 'dir don gyis na thag bcad pas snga ba'i bsnyon pa ni sbyor ba nyid yin par khong du chud par bya la /
translated: This means that in this case, by implication, the accusation that precedes the decision is itself the application.

original: 'dir spags pa kho na ni pham pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir spags pa kho na ni pham pa yin no //
translated: Here, the accusation itself is the defeat.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las /
translated: Here, the text of the questions and answers is:

original: gzhan zhig gis dge slong la gzhag pa gtams pa las blangs pa na des bsnyon par bgyid na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: gzhan zhig gis dge slong la gzhag pa gtams pa las blangs pa na des bsnyon par bgyid na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “If someone takes a deposit from a monk and the monk denies it, what is the offense?”

original: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //
translated: “It is a serious offense.”

analyzed: phyis thag bcad na dngos po tshang na mthar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ma tshang na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba dang / gal te des sngar thag bcad la /

translated: If he first decides and later moves from the site, there is a serious offense.🔽Here, one should understand that if one first decides, there is a serious offense from the decision,

analyzed: btsun pa rku ba du mchis /

original: nye ba 'khor drug ste /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor drug ste /
translated: “Upali, there are six:

original: mthus rku ba dang / 'drid pas rku ba dang / gtams pas rku ba dang / slar sbyin par bya ba rku ba dang / 'joms pas rku ba dang / chos rku ba dang drug go //
analyzed: mthus rku ba dang / 'drid pas rku ba dang / gtams pas rku ba dang / slar sbyin par bya ba rku ba dang / 'joms pas rku ba dang / chos rku ba dang drug go //
translated: Stealing through force, stealing through deception, stealing through fraud, stealing through returning what was given, stealing through destruction, and stealing through Dharma.

analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis rku ba rnam pa drug po gang lags pa 'di dag las gsungs pa de dag las du zhig gis mthar 'gyur lags /
translated: “Venerable! Among these six types of stealing taught by the Blessed One, by how many does one become an extremist?”🔽“Upāli, except for stealing through Dharma, all the others make one an extremist.”

original: nye ba 'khor chos rku ba ma gtogs pa thams cad kyis mthar 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa'i gzhung gi don 'di ci bstan nam /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor chos rku ba ma gtogs pa thams cad kyis mthar 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa'i gzhung gi don 'di ci bstan nam /

original: smras pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: smras pa de bzhin no //
translated: “It is just as you have said.”

original: de la re zhig chos rku ba'i don ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig chos rku ba'i don ni /
translated: “Among them, the meaning of stealing through Dharma is

original: yid dge ba yis len na nyes pa med //
analyzed: yid dge ba yis len na nyes pa med //

original: ces bya ba'i tshig 'dis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig 'dis bstan pa yin no //

original: 'drid pas rku ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'drid pas rku ba rnam pa gnyis te /

original: chom po dang / dor thabs kyis so //
analyzed: chom po dang / dor thabs kyis so //
translated: stealing through robbery and stealing through trickery.

original: de la chom pos len pa ni rku ba'i sems kyis su zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la chom pos len pa ni rku ba'i sems kyis su zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa yin no //

original: dor thabs kyis rku ba ni /
analyzed: dor thabs kyis rku ba ni /

analyzed: rgyan po dor byas rgyal na nyes par 'gyur // zhes bya ba 'dis bstan pa yin no //

original: gtams pa rku ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gtams pa rku ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /

original: bgrangs nas gtams pa dang / rgyas btab nas gtams pa'o //
analyzed: bgrangs nas gtams pa dang / rgyas btab nas gtams pa'o //

translated: Stealing by concealing by counting and stealing by concealing by returning the borrowed object are indicated by the phrase in regard to what is stolen, borrowed, concealed, and what is despised.🔽 Stealing by power is indicated by the phrase if one steals by force.

original: 'joms pas rku ba ni sho gam 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: 'joms pas rku ba ni sho gam 'joms pa'o //
translated: Stealing by destruction is indicated by the phrase if one destroys a toll gate.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /

original: mthu dang 'jab bus so //
analyzed: mthu dang 'jab bus so //

original: de yang rku ba'i sems kyis su //
analyzed: de yang rku ba'i sems kyis su //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis don bstan pa yin no //

original: de ltar brku bya'i dbye bas rku dbye ba //
analyzed: de ltar brku bya'i dbye bas rku dbye ba //

analyzed: brku bar bya ba'i dbye bas rku ba'i rab tu dbye ba 'di 'dul ba'i rgya mtsho las phyung nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this classification of stealing is extracted from the ocean of the Vinaya and explained.

original: rang gzhan bang chen brgyud la sogs pa yis //🔽gang zhig rku na thams cad rkun ma yin //
analyzed: rang gzhan bang chen brgyud la sogs pa yis // gang zhig rku na thams cad rkun ma yin //
translated: If one steals by oneself, by others,🔽by messengers, or by a series of messengers,🔽all are thieves.

original: rang rku 'am /
analyzed: rang rku 'am /
translated: If one steals by oneself,

original: gzhan dag gis sam /🔽bang chen btang bas sam /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis sam / bang chen btang bas sam /
translated: by others,🔽by sending a messenger,

original: bang chen brgyud pas rku @106a * //🔽yang rung ste //
analyzed: bang chen brgyud pas rku @106a * // yang rung ste //

original: de thams cad rkun ma nyid yin par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de thams cad rkun ma nyid yin par rtogs par bya'o //

original: 'dir gzhung ni bdag nyid kyis rku bar byed pa dang / bdag nyid kyis rkur 'jug pa dang / bdag nyid kyis gnas nas gnas su spog par byed pa dang byin gyis brlabs nas rku bar byed pa dang / byin gyis brlabs nas rkur 'jug pa dang /

translated: Here, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:

translated: If one steals oneself, if one induces another to steal, if one moves it from one location to another, if one steals by consecrating it, if one steals by consecrating it, if one moves it from one location to another by consecrating it, if one steals by messenger, if one steals by messenger, if one moves it from one location to another by messenger, one commits an offense entailing expulsion.

analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rjes su 'brangs nas rku ba 'di dag rnam par bshad par bya'o //

translated: The continuum of that connection is a single entity.

analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhus pa las / btsun pa dge slong gis chu bo bkum nas chab rku @107a * //
translated: Here is the text of the question:

original: bar byed na cir 'gyur lags /
analyzed: bar byed na cir 'gyur lags /
translated: “Venerable, if a bhikṣu kills a river and steals the water, what does he become?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said:🔽“He becomes a thief.”

original: chu'i phung po dang po nas chu'i mjug gi rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: chu'i phung po dang po nas chu'i mjug gi rin thang brtsi bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The value of the water at the end is to be calculated from the value of the water at the beginning.

original: de bzhin 'dir ni kha dog gcig gyur gnas //
analyzed: de bzhin 'dir ni kha dog gcig gyur gnas //
translated: In the same way, here, the place is of one color.

original: ri mo la sogs med sa steng mnyam gcig / de bzhin du kha dog gcig par gyur pa'i gnas kyang gcig pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ri mo la sogs med sa steng mnyam gcig / de bzhin du kha dog gcig par gyur pa'i gnas kyang gcig pa nyid yin te /
translated: The earth is of one color, without lines, etc.

original: gal te sa gzhi kha dog gcig pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te sa gzhi kha dog gcig pa yin la /
translated: If the earth is of one color, without lines, etc.,🔽it is to be understood that it is of one piece.🔽The place is of one color, without lines, etc.🔽The place is of one color, without lines, etc.🔽The place is of one color, without lines, etc.

original: ri mo la sogs pa yang med cing mnyam pa dang mtho dman med pa de yang gcig pa nyid du shes par bya'o //🔽glang chen la sogs phyogs ni mi mngon dang // dong na yod pa'i 'bras chan kha dog mtshungs //
analyzed: ri mo la sogs pa yang med cing mnyam pa dang mtho dman med pa de yang gcig pa nyid du shes par bya'o // glang chen la sogs phyogs ni mi mngon dang // dong na yod pa'i 'bras chan kha dog mtshungs //

original: rtsva rnams bkram pa'i 'byar ba mnyam pa'am //🔽gzhan rnams la yang 'os pa nyid kyis dpyad //
analyzed: rtsva rnams bkram pa'i 'byar ba mnyam pa'am // gzhan rnams la yang 'os pa nyid kyis dpyad //
translated: The place is of one color, without lines, etc.

original: gal te glang po che de sha rgyas pa zhig yin na phyogs gcig yin no //
analyzed: gal te glang po che de sha rgyas pa zhig yin na phyogs gcig yin no //
translated: The place is of one

original: gang zhig rtsi ba logs la sogs pa rus pa dag snang ba de dag ni phyogs tha dad pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig rtsi ba logs la sogs pa rus pa dag snang ba de dag ni phyogs tha dad pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Those who see the bones as separate, as in the case of the skull, etc., should see them as being in different places.

original: de bzhin du dong dag na yod pa'i 'bras kha dog gcig pa dang / rtsva bkram pa 'byar ba mnyam pa'i ngo bor gyur pa las yang gcig pa nyid kho na yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dong dag na yod pa'i 'bras kha dog gcig pa dang / rtsva bkram pa 'byar ba mnyam pa'i ngo bor gyur pa las yang gcig pa nyid kho na yin no //
translated: In the same way, the rice in a pot is of one color, and the spread-out grass is of one nature, being a uniform mass.

original: gzhan rnams la yang ji ltar 'os pa nyid kyis dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams la yang ji ltar 'os pa nyid kyis dpyad par bya'o //
translated: The same holds for the other cases, as is appropriate in each case.

original: gser dngul rnam pa nyams byas rku byed na //🔽nyams byas ngo bo brku bar bya bar 'dod //
analyzed: gser dngul rnam pa nyams byas rku byed na // nyams byas ngo bo brku bar bya bar 'dod //
translated: When gold and silver are damaged, one is guilty of theft🔽if one takes them after having damaged them.

original: gser ram dngul dag sman gyis nyams par byas nas rku bar byed pa na /
analyzed: gser ram dngul dag sman gyis nyams par byas nas rku bar byed pa na /
translated: When gold or silver is damaged by an ointment, one is guilty of theft

original: nyams par byas pa'i ngo bo kho na'i rin thang brtsi bar bya'i nyams par ma byas pa'i ma yin no //
analyzed: nyams par byas pa'i ngo bo kho na'i rin thang brtsi bar bya'i nyams par ma byas pa'i ma yin no //
translated: if one takes it after having damaged it. The value of the object is that of the damaged object, not that of the undamaged object.

original: gsad pa nyid ni nam yang brkus min te //
analyzed: gsad pa nyid ni nam yang brkus min te //
translated: The dead are never stolen.

original: de ni rku ba'i sbyor ba yin par bstan //
analyzed: de ni rku ba'i sbyor ba yin par bstan //
translated: This is the rule for theft.

original: lug la sogs pa bsad nas rku ba na de'i gnas skabs kyi rin thang brtsi bar bya'o //
analyzed: lug la sogs pa bsad nas rku ba na de'i gnas skabs kyi rin thang brtsi bar bya'o //
translated: When one steals after killing sheep and so on, the value is determined at the time of the killing.

original: bsad pa ni rku ba'i sbyor ba kho na yin par bstan to //
analyzed: bsad pa ni rku ba'i sbyor ba kho na yin par bstan to //
translated: The killing is taught to be the mere preparation for the stealing.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus:

original: brku bya gcig nyid dang ni gzhir gyur gcig / brku bya'i ngo bo ji ltar de ltar bshad //
analyzed: brku bya gcig nyid dang ni gzhir gyur gcig / brku bya'i ngo bo ji ltar de ltar bshad //
translated: The object of stealing is one, the basis is one, the nature of the object of stealing is explained as it is.

original: brku bar bya ba gcig pa nyid ni gzhi nas rgyun gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
analyzed: brku bar bya ba gcig pa nyid ni gzhi nas rgyun gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
translated: The object of stealing is one, as explained by “from the basis up to the continuum” and so on.

original: gzhir gyur pa gcig pa nyid ni /🔽de bzhin 'dir ni kha dog gcig gyur gnas //
analyzed: gzhir gyur pa gcig pa nyid ni / de bzhin 'dir ni kha dog gcig gyur gnas //
translated: The basis is one,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
translated: as explained by “here, the color is one” and so on.

original: brku bar bya ba'i rang bzhin yang //
analyzed: brku bar bya ba'i rang bzhin yang //
translated: The nature of the object of stealing

original: gser dngul rnam pa nyams byas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
analyzed: gser dngul rnam pa nyams byas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
translated: is explained by “gold and silver, in any form” and so on.

original: @107b da ni bdag po'i rab tu dbye ba bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: @107b da ni bdag po'i rab tu dbye ba bshad par bya'o //
translated: Now the classification of the owner will be explained.

original: nor gyi bdag po mi 'am ri dgas zhes //
analyzed: nor gyi bdag po mi 'am ri dgas zhes //
translated: The owner of the wealth is either a human or an animal.

original: nges pa med na dngos kyi dbang gis gzhag / bdag po rnams mi yin na 'o na te mi ma yin zhes nges pa med na //
analyzed: nges pa med na dngos kyi dbang gis gzhag / bdag po rnams mi yin na 'o na te mi ma yin zhes nges pa med na //
translated: If the owners are human, but there is no certainty that they are human,🔽then it is determined as if there were certainty.

original: yid gnyis gyur na nges dang 'dra bar gzhag / ces bya ba 'dis dngos po las rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: yid gnyis gyur na nges dang 'dra bar gzhag / ces bya ba 'dis dngos po las rnam par gzhag go //
translated: This is how it is determined by the thing itself.

original: rkun pos chos gos rdzas la sogs phrogs na //
analyzed: rkun pos chos gos rdzas la sogs phrogs na //
translated: If a thief steals the robe or possessions of a monk,

original: de la re ba med na bdag gi min //
analyzed: de la re ba med na bdag gi min //
translated: if he has no hope of getting it back, it is not his.

original: de phyir nan gyis de las len na mtha' //
analyzed: de phyir nan gyis de las len na mtha' //
translated: If he takes it back by force, it is a serious offense.

original: bsam pas ma btang ba la nyes pa med //
analyzed: bsam pas ma btang ba la nyes pa med //
translated: There is no offense if he does not give up his intention.

original: rkun ma rnams kyis chos gos la sogs pa phrogs na /🔽gang zhig bsam pas btang ba de la bdag nyid kyir bya ba med do //
analyzed: rkun ma rnams kyis chos gos la sogs pa phrogs na / gang zhig bsam pas btang ba de la bdag nyid kyir bya ba med do //
translated: If a thief steals the robe or possessions of a monk,🔽if he has given up his intention, it is not his.

original: bsam pas ma btang ba la ni yod do //
analyzed: bsam pas ma btang ba la ni yod do //
translated: If he has not given up his intention, it is his.

original: de ltar bas na nan gyis rkun ma las len par byed na /🔽bsam pas yongs su btang ba las mthar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bas na nan gyis rkun ma las len par byed na / bsam pas yongs su btang ba las mthar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if he takes it back by force,🔽it is a serious offense if he has given up his intention.

original: bsam pas ma btang ba la ni nyes pa med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: bsam pas ma btang ba la ni nyes pa med pa nyid yin te /
translated: There is no offense if he has not given up his intention.

original: 'dod pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis bdag gir bya ba nyid dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis bdag gir bya ba nyid dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not free from the state of being appropriated by the self due to having desire.

original: 'o na phran tshegs las /
analyzed: 'o na phran tshegs las /
translated: But the Kṣudraka Collection states:

original: rang gi chos gos dang lhung bzed ngo shes nas dge slong rnams kyis ku co bton pa dang / chom rkun pa de rnams skrag nas bor te byer ro //
analyzed: rang gi chos gos dang lhung bzed ngo shes nas dge slong rnams kyis ku co bton pa dang / chom rkun pa de rnams skrag nas bor te byer ro //
translated: When the monks recognized their own robes and alms bowls, they cried out and the thieves were frightened and fled.

original: dge slong rnams kyang rang rang gi chos gos dang lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs nas 'khod la /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyang rang rang gi chos gos dang lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs nas 'khod la /
translated: The monks blessed their own robes and alms bowls and sat down.

original: ci 'di bdag cag la rung ngam 'on te mi rung snyam du mi shes pa las /
analyzed: ci 'di bdag cag la rung ngam 'on te mi rung snyam du mi shes pa las /
translated: They did not know whether this was proper or not.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said:

original: de dag skrag par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de dag skrag par mi bya ste /
translated: They should not be frightened.

original: de ni gang gis phrogs pa de'i yin no //
analyzed: de ni gang gis phrogs pa de'i yin no //
translated: That belongs to the one who was robbed.

original: zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: This contradicts that.

original: 'di la 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: 'di la 'gal ba med de /
translated: There is no contradiction,

original: gzhung gi don ni nor gyi bdag po rnams kyi bsam pas btang ba byas na /
analyzed: gzhung gi don ni nor gyi bdag po rnams kyi bsam pas btang ba byas na /
translated: because the meaning of the text is that if the owners of the wealth give it mentally,

original: de gang gis phrogs pa de'i yin no zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gang gis phrogs pa de'i yin no zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It belongs to whoever stole it.

original: 'di ga las shes she na /
analyzed: 'di ga las shes she na /
translated: Why is this known?

original: de srid du ltos pa med par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de srid du ltos pa med par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that one should not be indifferent to it for that long.

original: 'di ni khungs ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni khungs ma yin te /
translated: This is not a source,🔽because it is said in the scriptures:🔽“When thieves began to plunder the saṅgha, the monks discarded their Dharma robes and alms bowls without concern.

original: de ltar yang choms rkun rnams kyis gzhom par brtsams pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis ltos pa med par chos gos dang lhung bzed bor ba dang / de rnams phongs par gyur ba na /
analyzed: de ltar yang choms rkun rnams kyis gzhom par brtsams pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis ltos pa med par chos gos dang lhung bzed bor ba dang / de rnams phongs par gyur ba na /
translated: When they became destitute,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽ji srid du chom rkun rnams kyis bcom pa'i rdzas khyer nas sbyor ba'i rgyun ma chad pa de srid du ltos pa med par mi bya'o zhes gzhung las 'byung @108a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / ji srid du chom rkun rnams kyis bcom pa'i rdzas khyer nas sbyor ba'i rgyun ma chad pa de srid du ltos pa med par mi bya'o zhes gzhung las 'byung @108a * //
translated: the Bhagavān said,🔽‘Until the thieves have carried off the plundered goods and the continuity of their preparation is severed, one should not be indifferent to them.’

original: bas chom rkun mthong ba kho na las 'phral du ma btang ba zhes bya ba la dgongs pa'i phyir 'di ni khungs ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhe na /
analyzed: bas chom rkun mthong ba kho na las 'phral du ma btang ba zhes bya ba la dgongs pa'i phyir 'di ni khungs ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhe na /
translated: This is not a source because it is stated with the intention that one should not discard one’s robes immediately upon seeing thieves.

original: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this passage is as follows.

original: 'di ni byung ba tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni byung ba tsam yin gyi /
translated: This is merely an example.🔽One should not rely on thieves to that extent.

original: chom rkun de srid du ltos pa med par mi bya'o zhes 'byung ba 'di ni spyir gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chom rkun de srid du ltos pa med par mi bya'o zhes 'byung ba 'di ni spyir gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is a general statement.

original: gal te 'di spyir gsungs par mi 'gyur na de'i tshe chom rkun de dag bcom pa'i rdzas rnams khyer te mnyan yod du tshong bya bar btsams pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis bcom pa'i rdzas ngo shes la /
analyzed: gal te 'di spyir gsungs par mi 'gyur na de'i tshe chom rkun de dag bcom pa'i rdzas rnams khyer te mnyan yod du tshong bya bar btsams pa dang / dge slong rnams kyis bcom pa'i rdzas ngo shes la /
translated: If this were not a general statement, then when the thieves, having stolen the goods of the king, were about to sell them in Śrāvastī, the monks would recognize the stolen goods.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de srid du ltos pa med par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de srid du ltos pa med par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pas /
translated: And the Blessed One would not have said, “One should not rely on thieves to that extent.”

original: dge slong de rnams kyis bcom pa'i rdzas de ngo shes nas chom rkun de rnams rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor du khrid pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: dge slong de rnams kyis bcom pa'i rdzas de ngo shes nas chom rkun de rnams rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor du khrid pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: Therefore, when the monks recognized the stolen goods, they took the thieves to the king’s palace.

original: chom rkun pa rnams rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor du dbul bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: chom rkun pa rnams rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor du dbul bar mi bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, “The thieves should not be brought to the king’s palace.

original: 'on kyang chos bshad pas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos bshad pas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Rather, they should be released through teaching the Dharma.”

original: gal te mi ster na rin phyed kyis kyang blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te mi ster na rin phyed kyis kyang blang bar bya'o //
translated: If he does not give it, then he should take it for half the price.

original: 'on kyang mi ster na rin thang tshang bar byin te blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du 'byung ba'i gzhung 'di mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang mi ster na rin thang tshang bar byin te blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du 'byung ba'i gzhung 'di mi rung ste /
translated: If he still does not give it, then he should take it for the full price.

original: 'dir de srid du ltos pa med par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di mngon du byas nas dge slong rnams 'jug pa ni 'gal lo //
analyzed: 'dir de srid du ltos pa med par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di mngon du byas nas dge slong rnams 'jug pa ni 'gal lo //
translated: This passage is not correct, because it is contradictory for monks to engage in this practice, since they have taken the vow not to engage in such actions.

original: gal te don de ltar mi sems na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ma byin par len pa la brten nas dgag pa bor te chom rkun dbul ba bkag pa mi rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te don de ltar mi sems na bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ma byin par len pa la brten nas dgag pa bor te chom rkun dbul ba bkag pa mi rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not understand the meaning in this way, then it would be illogical for the Blessed One to abandon the prohibition against stealing in order to stop the poverty of thieves.

original: de lta bas na bsam pas btang ba las bdag gir bya ba log pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na bsam pas btang ba las bdag gir bya ba log pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should understand that the object is not yours if it is not given to you with the intention to give.

original: bsam pas ma btang na ni gzhan gyis bdag gir byas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: bsam pas ma btang na ni gzhan gyis bdag gir byas kyang rung ste /
translated: If it is not given with the intention to give, then it is not yours even if it is appropriated by another.

original: bdag nyid kyir bya ba ma nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyir bya ba ma nyams pa yin no //
translated: The appropriation is not lost.

original: de ltar yang 'dul ba mdo las /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dul ba mdo las /
translated: Thus the Vinaya Verses declares:

original: phrogs pa la bsam pas ma btang ba nyid ni bdag po nyid dang ma bral ba yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: phrogs pa la bsam pas ma btang ba nyid ni bdag po nyid dang ma bral ba yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'byung ba yin no //
translated: But if one does not give up the thought of stealing, one does not lose ownership.🔽The great treatise on differentiation states:

original: rtsa ba'i bye brag tu bshad pa las kyang phrogs ma thag tu dngos po de chom rkun gyi yin par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i bye brag tu bshad pa las kyang phrogs ma thag tu dngos po de chom rkun gyi yin par mi 'grub ste /
translated: Immediately after the theft, the object does not become the thief's property.

original: de ni bdag po kho na'i yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni bdag po kho na'i yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It remains the property of the owner alone.

original: 'on ni chos bshad pas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di dang 'gal te /
analyzed: 'on ni chos bshad pas blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di dang 'gal te /
translated: But this contradicts the statement that one should take it through explanation of the Dharma.

original: rang gi rdzas blang ba la chos bshad pa @108b dang 'brel ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: rang gi rdzas blang ba la chos bshad pa @108b dang 'brel ba ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the relationship between taking one's own property and explaining the Dharma?

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba lhur mdzad nas gsungs pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs brtse ba lhur mdzad nas gsungs pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: This is not contradictory because the Bhagavān taught this with the intention of showing compassion.

original: gzhung gi don ni gal te lus la gnod pa med par blang bar nus na de lta na ni blang //
analyzed: gzhung gi don ni gal te lus la gnod pa med par blang bar nus na de lta na ni blang //
translated: The meaning of the text is this: If one is able to take it without harming the body, then take it.

original: 'on te ma yin na chos bshad pas blang bar bya ba 'am rin gyis kyang blang bar bya'i /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin na chos bshad pas blang bar bya ba 'am rin gyis kyang blang bar bya'i /
translated: But if one is not able to do that, then take it through explaining the Dharma or take it through price.

original: chom rkun rnams rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor du dbul bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: chom rkun rnams rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor du dbul bar mi bya ste /
translated: Thieves should not be brought before the king.🔽If they are, they will be harmed.

original: des na de dag la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar gnang ste 'di ltar rin phyed kyis kyang zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: des na de dag la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar gnang ste 'di ltar rin phyed kyis kyang zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Since it is said that even half the value of the stolen goods is acceptable,

original: de ni de ltar gdon mi za ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni de ltar gdon mi za ba yin no //
translated: there is no doubt that this is the case.

original: de lta ma yin na rin phyed kyis ji ltar ltung bar mi 'gyur /🔽gal te zhes bya ba'i gzhung las /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rin phyed kyis ji ltar ltung bar mi 'gyur / gal te zhes bya ba'i gzhung las /
translated: Otherwise, how could a half be a downfall?🔽The text beginning “If they are not to be announced”

original: de dag bsgrag par mi bya ste de ni gang gis phrogs pa de'i yin no zhes gsungs pa yang de'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: de dag bsgrag par mi bya ste de ni gang gis phrogs pa de'i yin no zhes gsungs pa yang de'i don 'di yin te /
translated: means that the stolen goods belong to the one who stole them.

original: 'di ni bdag gi yin no snyam du mngon par zhen pa'i phyir de de'i yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi yin no snyam du mngon par zhen pa'i phyir de de'i yin gyi /
translated: This is because they think, “This is mine,”

original: rkun po ma yin par mi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rkun po ma yin par mi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no //
translated: but they do not belong to others who are not thieves.

original: mthus de'i re ba bcad na sdom brtson dbyug pa spangs pa dgon pa dang bas mtha' na gnas pa la srog gi bar chad byed par 'gyur ro snyam nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bzlog pa mdzad de /
analyzed: mthus de'i re ba bcad na sdom brtson dbyug pa spangs pa dgon pa dang bas mtha' na gnas pa la srog gi bar chad byed par 'gyur ro snyam nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bzlog pa mdzad de /
translated: If the Buddha had not stopped him through his power, the ascetic would have killed the monk, who was a renunciant, a wielder of the cudgel, living in the wilderness.

original: rang gi 'du shes kyis 'jug pas gzhan gyis ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi 'du shes kyis 'jug pas gzhan gyis ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one engages in sexual union through one's own discernment, not through the discernment of another.

original: gzhan gyi yin par 'du shes yod na ni kha na ma tho ba la sogs pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi yin par 'du shes yod na ni kha na ma tho ba la sogs pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one has the discernment that the other is another, then one generates the fault of sexual misconduct and so on.

original: gzhan gyis slob ma dbang byas de bdag min //
analyzed: gzhan gyis slob ma dbang byas de bdag min //
translated: If another controls the disciple, it is not one's own.

original: gzhan gyis slob ma bsdus pa'am sbyin pa la sogs pas dbang du byas na bdag nyid kyi ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis slob ma bsdus pa'am sbyin pa la sogs pas dbang du byas na bdag nyid kyi ma yin te /
translated: If another controls the disciple through gathering or generosity and so on, it is not one's own.

original: de slar phrogs na mthar 'gyur ba yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de slar phrogs na mthar 'gyur ba yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: If one steals that disciple back, it is a downfall.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
translated: Here the text of Vinayaka is:

original: dge slong gi slob ma chom rkun rnams kyis khrid pa dang / des de 'bros su bcug nas bkug pa las /
analyzed: dge slong gi slob ma chom rkun rnams kyis khrid pa dang / des de 'bros su bcug nas bkug pa las /
translated: A monk's disciple was led away by thieves and the monk made him flee and then summoned him.

original: de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: de 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: If regret arises, the Bhagavan said:

original: gal te de dag gi slob ma dbang du byas pa las 'gugs par byed pa na dngos po tshang na pham par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te de dag gi slob ma dbang du byas pa las 'gugs par byed pa na dngos po tshang na pham par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If one compels a disciple of theirs to summon them, if the requisite conditions are complete, one commits a defeating offense.

original: 'o na yang dge slong ma gang gis khyim thab kyis ma gnang bar rab tu 'byin par byed na ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: 'o na yang dge slong ma gang gis khyim thab kyis ma gnang bar rab tu 'byin par byed na ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu yin /
translated: But how is it that a nun who gives full ordination without the husband’s permission commits an offense?

original: 'di ni srog chags phal ba 'phrog pa'i rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni srog chags phal ba 'phrog pa'i rnam pa yin te /
translated: This is a case of stealing a minor living being.

original: ma gnad pa rab tu 'byin pas bdag nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa de'i phyir mthar 'gyur bar rigs so zhe na /🔽rku ba'i sems @109a * //
analyzed: ma gnad pa rab tu 'byin pas bdag nyid kyis sgrub par byed pa de'i phyir mthar 'gyur bar rigs so zhe na / rku ba'i sems @109a * //
translated: Since she gives full ordination without permission, she herself commits the act. Therefore it is logical that she commits a heinous act.

original: med pa'i phyir 'di 'phrog pa ma yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir 'di 'phrog pa ma yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: Because she has no thought of stealing, she does not commit theft and thus has no fault.

original: bdag nyid rku bas nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: bdag nyid rku bas nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: She never commits theft herself.

original: zhes bya ba 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
translated: Here the text of Vinayaviniscaya reads:

original: chom rkun rnams kyis dge slong brkus pa dang / de de rnams las bros nas slar 'ongs nas /
analyzed: chom rkun rnams kyis dge slong brkus pa dang / de de rnams las bros nas slar 'ongs nas /
translated: The thieves stole the monk’s possessions, and the monk escaped from them and returned.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong la bdag nyid rku ba med pas ltung ba med de zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dge slong la bdag nyid rku ba med pas ltung ba med de zhes bya ba'i bar du 'byung ba yin no //
translated: “There is no offense for a monk who is not himself a thief.”🔽The master of the animal and the animal itself,

original: dud 'gro'i nor la bdag dang dud 'gro dag / zas btang ba la bdag po dud 'gro yin //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i nor la bdag dang dud 'gro dag / zas btang ba la bdag po dud 'gro yin //
translated: The master of the food and the animal itself.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni bya'i bdag po rnams kyi bu dang 'dra bar bya rnams la rgyan de byin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni bya'i bdag po rnams kyi bu dang 'dra bar bya rnams la rgyan de byin no //
translated: The master of the birds gave the ornaments to the birds as if they were his own children.

original: de lta bas na 'dir bya yang bdag po nyid yin pas gnyi ga bdag po nyid yin yang 'du shes kyi dbang gis ltung ba rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir bya yang bdag po nyid yin pas gnyi ga bdag po nyid yin yang 'du shes kyi dbang gis ltung ba rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in this case, the birds are the masters. Although both are masters, the offense is determined by the perception.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text says:

original: gal te 'di snyam du mi'i ni rku'i bya'i ni ma yin no snyam du sems na mi'i las rin thang brtsi bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du mi'i ni rku'i bya'i ni ma yin no snyam du sems na mi'i las rin thang brtsi bar bya'o //
translated: If you think that it is a human offense, not an animal offense, you should calculate the value according to human standards.

original: gal te dngos po tshang na pham par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po tshang na pham par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the conditions are complete, there is a defeat.

original: 'on te ma tshang na nyes pa spom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on te ma tshang na nyes pa spom por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If they are not complete, there is a serious transgression.

original: mi bdag po nyid ma yin na ni der pham par 'gyur par yang mi 'thad pas 'dir mi yang bdag po yin par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mi bdag po nyid ma yin na ni der pham par 'gyur par yang mi 'thad pas 'dir mi yang bdag po yin par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: If the animal is not the owner, it is not tenable that there is a defeat. Therefore, it should be understood that the human is the owner.

original: zas btang ba la bdag po dud 'gro yin //
analyzed: zas btang ba la bdag po dud 'gro yin //
translated: Animals are the owners of what is given to them as food.

original: zhes bya ba ni longs spyod pa'i phyir dud 'gro rnams la btung ba la sogs pa gang sbyin par bya ba de la 'di ni bdag gi yin no snyam du sbyin pa po la bsam pa med do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni longs spyod pa'i phyir dud 'gro rnams la btung ba la sogs pa gang sbyin par bya ba de la 'di ni bdag gi yin no snyam du sbyin pa po la bsam pa med do //
translated: When one gives water, etc. to animals for the purpose of enjoyment, the giver does not think, “This is mine.”

original: de ltar bas na btung ba la sogs pa la ni dud 'gro bdag po nyid yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bas na btung ba la sogs pa la ni dud 'gro bdag po nyid yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that animals are the owners of water, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dgon pa'i lam du dud 'gro rnams la btung ba'i skal ba byin pa la 'du shes kyi dbang gis ltung ba rnam par gzhag par ma mdzad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dgon pa'i lam du dud 'gro rnams la btung ba'i skal ba byin pa la 'du shes kyi dbang gis ltung ba rnam par gzhag par ma mdzad do //
translated: For this reason, the Blessed One did not establish a downfall for the monk who, on the road to the wilderness, gives water to animals with the idea of giving it to humans.

original: thob par bya phyir me sogs dkrogs pa yis //🔽ri dgas la sogs bdag po brtson por bstan //
analyzed: thob par bya phyir me sogs dkrogs pa yis // ri dgas la sogs bdag po brtson por bstan //
translated: The one who sets a fire, etc.🔽is the master of the deer, etc.

original: bshad pa las na ri dgas mtshon phyir yin //
analyzed: bshad pa las na ri dgas mtshon phyir yin //
translated: because of the explanation, and because of the example of the deer.

original: de phyir srog chags gzhan la'ang 'thad pa yin //🔽rngon pa la sogs brtson par byed pa las //🔽thob par bya phyir me la sogs pa dkrogs pa na ri dgas la sogs pa de'i bdag po ni brtson pa po kho na yin par bstan gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de phyir srog chags gzhan la'ang 'thad pa yin // rngon pa la sogs brtson par byed pa las // thob par bya phyir me la sogs pa dkrogs pa na ri dgas la sogs pa de'i bdag po ni brtson pa po kho na yin par bstan gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is also correct with regard to other living beings.🔽The one who sets a fire, etc.🔽in order to obtain deer, etc. is the master of the deer, etc. and not the others.

original: thob par bya phyir zhes smos pa ni gnod par bya ba'i @109b phyir me la sogs pas dkrogs pa la yang bdag po nyid yin par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob par bya phyir zhes smos pa ni gnod par bya ba'i @109b phyir me la sogs pas dkrogs pa la yang bdag po nyid yin par rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words “in order to obtain” are stated in order to show that he is the master even when he sets a fire, etc. in order to harm.

original: bshad pa las so zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i bshad pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa las so zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pa'i bshad pa ste /
translated: The explanation is the explanation of the Pratimoksa.

original: rnam par 'byed pa las nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin par rtogs nas ri dgas la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa las nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin par rtogs nas ri dgas la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra sbyar ro //
translated: The Vibhasa merely indicates this, but the word “etc.” is added in order to understand that it refers to deer, etc.

original: de lta bas na mi dang ma he la sogs pa la yang de kho na bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na mi dang ma he la sogs pa la yang de kho na bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the same is true of humans, buffaloes, etc.🔽A deer, pursued by hunters,

original: rngon pa rnams kyis ri dgas gtses pa zhig / gtsug lag khang du rgyug cing phyin pa na //
analyzed: rngon pa rnams kyis ri dgas gtses pa zhig / gtsug lag khang du rgyug cing phyin pa na //
translated: flees to a monastery.

original: skyabs su 'ongs pa de la bsrung bar bya //
analyzed: skyabs su 'ongs pa de la bsrung bar bya //
translated: One should protect that which has come for refuge.

original: de ni shin de dag rnams la gtad //🔽rngon pa rnams kyis ri dgas rnams gtses par gyur pa zhig gtsug lag khang dag tu rgyug cing phyin na rgyug pa yang de yin la /
analyzed: de ni shin de dag rnams la gtad // rngon pa rnams kyis ri dgas rnams gtses par gyur pa zhig gtsug lag khang dag tu rgyug cing phyin na rgyug pa yang de yin la /
translated: It is given to those.🔽A deer, pursued by hunters, flees to a monastery.

original: phyin pa yang yin pas na ri dgas gtsug lag khang du phyin pa de la bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyin pa yang yin pas na ri dgas gtsug lag khang du phyin pa de la bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: Since it flees and goes, it is a deer that has gone to a monastery. One should protect that which has come for refuge.

original: skyabs zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang la bya ste /
analyzed: skyabs zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang la bya ste /
translated: “Refuge” refers to a monastery.

original: de ltar yang skyabs kyi steng du 'dzegs te zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: de ltar yang skyabs kyi steng du 'dzegs te zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: Thus, it says, “Having climbed up on the roof of the house for refuge,”

original: de ni mgon skyabs byed pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: de ni mgon skyabs byed pa tsam yin te /
translated: and that is merely the protector and refuge.

original: khyed ba yang med cing btang ba yang med pas 'dir phrogs pa'i nyes pa ni med do //
analyzed: khyed ba yang med cing btang ba yang med pas 'dir phrogs pa'i nyes pa ni med do //
translated: But since there is no “your” and no “mine,” there is no fault of theft here.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed las /
translated: Here is the text from the Vinaya:

original: rngon pa rnams kyis ri dgas rnams la gtses pa na gtsug lag khang du phyin pa dang / rngon pa de rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: rngon pa rnams kyis ri dgas rnams la gtses pa na gtsug lag khang du phyin pa dang / rngon pa de rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: When hunters were harassing deer, they came to the monastery, and the hunters said,🔽“Since he was harassed and came to the monastery, give him to us.”🔽When they did not get him, they threw him away and left.

original: 'di gtses pa las gtsug lag khang du phyin pas 'di bdag cag la stsol cig / de dag gis gang gi tshe ma thob pa de'i tshe bor nas dong ba dang / dge slong de rnams 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'di gtses pa las gtsug lag khang du phyin pas 'di bdag cag la stsol cig / de dag gis gang gi tshe ma thob pa de'i tshe bor nas dong ba dang / dge slong de rnams 'gyod pa skyes pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The monks were remorseful, and the Bhagavān said,

original: ltung ba med do zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: ltung ba med do zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: “There is no offense.”

original: gal te yang shin de'i tshe de dag nyid la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te yang shin de'i tshe de dag nyid la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If they were to give him to them,

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed nyid las //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'dul byed nyid las //
translated: Here is the text from the Vinaya:

original: rngon pa rnams kyis rnyong gis ri dgas snad par byas pa la gtsug lag khang du phyin pa dang / rngon pa de dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: rngon pa rnams kyis rnyong gis ri dgas snad par byas pa la gtsug lag khang du phyin pa dang / rngon pa de dag gis smras pa /
translated: The hunters caught the deer in a snare. They went to the monastery and said,

original: bdag cag gis ri dgas 'di rnying gis snad par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag cag gis ri dgas 'di rnying gis snad par byas pa yin te /
translated: “We caught this deer in a snare.🔽He must be released.

original: 'di gdon mi za bar 'chis thong shig / dge slong de dag gis ma btang nas /
analyzed: 'di gdon mi za bar 'chis thong shig / dge slong de dag gis ma btang nas /
translated: ” The monks did not release the deer.

original: gang gi tshe ma btang ba de'i tshe bor nas dong ngo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ma btang ba de'i tshe bor nas dong ngo //
translated: When they did not release the deer, the hunters threw down the deer and left.

original: de dag dong ba dang shi nas dge slong de dag gis de ltar bsgrub par bya ba mi shes pa las /
analyzed: de dag dong ba dang shi nas dge slong de dag gis de ltar bsgrub par bya ba mi shes pa las /
translated: When they left, the deer died. The monks did not know what to do.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rngon pa de dag nyid la sbyin par bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //🔽skye bo nye dus brtul zhugs can gang zhig /
analyzed: rngon pa de dag nyid la sbyin par bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no // skye bo nye dus brtul zhugs can gang zhig /
translated: “They should give the deer to the hunters.”🔽If a person of pure conduct is led away by force

original: @110a * // mthu yis khrid nas 'bad pas gzung bar bya //
analyzed: @110a * // mthu yis khrid nas 'bad pas gzung bar bya //
translated: and is seized by relatives and others,

original: gal te rtags kyis de bsam skye bo gnyen //
analyzed: gal te rtags kyis de bsam skye bo gnyen //
translated: if the person of pure conduct thinks of the relatives

original: mthun par shes na gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: mthun par shes na gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: and recognizes them as friends, he should be released.

original: gal te nye du rnams kyis brtul zhugs can khrid la rtags 'ga' zhig gis 'dug par 'dod par shes na bsgrims te gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te nye du rnams kyis brtul zhugs can khrid la rtags 'ga' zhig gis 'dug par 'dod par shes na bsgrims te gzung bar bya'o //
translated: If the relatives lead the ascetic and he wishes to stay because of some sign, he should hold on tightly.

original: 'on te 'gro bar 'dod na de'i tshe gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te 'gro bar 'dod na de'i tshe gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: But if he wishes to go, he should not hold on.

original: rtags kyang khyod kyi lag pa gang na gal te gang nye du rnams kyis bzung ba'o zhes zer na gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtags kyang khyod kyi lag pa gang na gal te gang nye du rnams kyis bzung ba'o zhes zer na gzung bar bya'o //
translated: And if he says, “Your hand is here,” and if the relatives hold on to him, he should hold on.

original: 'on te gang khyed cag gis gzung ba'o zhes zer na kye ma 'di 'gro bar 'dod pa yin no zhes gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te gang khyed cag gis gzung ba'o zhes zer na kye ma 'di 'gro bar 'dod pa yin no zhes gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: But if he says, “You are holding on,” then, “Alas, he wishes to go,” and he should not hold on.

original: dbyar gyi gnas su rnyed pa'i rnam pa 'ongs //
analyzed: dbyar gyi gnas su rnyed pa'i rnam pa 'ongs //
translated: The form of the gain that comes from the rainy season retreat

original: de bas mang du dbyar gnas pa yang dbang //
analyzed: de bas mang du dbyar gnas pa yang dbang //
translated: is the power of the one who stays for many rainy seasons.

original: gang dag dam chos tshigs bcad 'ga' 'don pa //
analyzed: gang dag dam chos tshigs bcad 'ga' 'don pa //
translated: Those who recite even a few verses of the holy Dharma

original: de yang chos kyi rnyed pa dbang pa yin //
analyzed: de yang chos kyi rnyed pa dbang pa yin //
translated: are also powerful gainers of the Dharma.

original: dbyar gyi gnas dang 'brel ba'i rnyed pa 'ongs pa gang yin pa de ni dbyar gnas pa dbang bas gang gis tha na zla ba gnyis shig dbyar gnas pa yin na de yang dbang pa yin te /
analyzed: dbyar gyi gnas dang 'brel ba'i rnyed pa 'ongs pa gang yin pa de ni dbyar gnas pa dbang bas gang gis tha na zla ba gnyis shig dbyar gnas pa yin na de yang dbang pa yin te /
translated: The property of the rainy season retreat is that which is obtained in connection with the rainy season retreat.🔽The rainy season retreat is controlled by the one who stays in the rainy season retreat.

original: de bas mang du dbyar gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas mang du dbyar gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if one stays in the rainy season retreat for only two months, that is controlled by the one who stays in the rainy season retreat for more than that.

original: tha na shi ba dang babs pa rnams kyang dbang ngo //
analyzed: tha na shi ba dang babs pa rnams kyang dbang ngo //
translated: Even if one dies or falls away, it is controlled by the one who stays in the rainy season retreat.

original: chos kyi rnyed pa ni chos smra ba rnams kho na dbang ba yin pas //
analyzed: chos kyi rnyed pa ni chos smra ba rnams kho na dbang ba yin pas //
translated: The property of Dharma is controlled by those who teach the Dharma.

original: tha na tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'ga' tsam 'don pa gang yin pa de dag kyang chos smra ba dag yin no //
analyzed: tha na tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'ga' tsam 'don pa gang yin pa de dag kyang chos smra ba dag yin no //
translated: Even if they recite just a single verse of four lines, they are teachers of the Dharma.

original: de ni rtsod pa'i gzhi las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni rtsod pa'i gzhi las 'byung ngo //
translated: This is stated in the source on points of dispute.

original: 'dir yang bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis gal te mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos kyi yin na de'i tshe mchod rten gyi dkor dang 'dra bar spyad par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis gal te mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos kyi yin na de'i tshe mchod rten gyi dkor dang 'dra bar spyad par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Here, Vaibhasikas say: If it belongs to the Dharma of nirvana, then it is like the property of a stupa and should not be used.

original: 'on te lung gi chos kyi yin na de'i tshe spyad pa yin no zhes rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: 'on te lung gi chos kyi yin na de'i tshe spyad pa yin no zhes rnam par bshad do //
translated: But if it is the Dharma of the scriptures, then it is practice.

original: sing ga la'i rgyal po'i bu mo mu tig gis kyang lung gi chos kho na la phul ba yin par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sing ga la'i rgyal po'i bu mo mu tig gis kyang lung gi chos kho na la phul ba yin par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the daughter of the king of Siṅghala offered only the Dharma of the scriptures.

original: gal te de ci'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: gal te de ci'i phyir zhe na //
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Bhagavān said so.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni gang zhig gis tha na tshig bzhi ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni gang zhig gis tha na tshig bzhi ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said, “If someone recites even one verse of four lines from the Buddha’s teachings,

original: 'ga' zhig 'don par byed na de la yang sbyin par bya'o zhes gsungs kyi /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig 'don par byed na de la yang sbyin par bya'o zhes gsungs kyi /
translated: one should make an offering to them.”

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la'o zhes ni ma gsungs so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la'o zhes ni ma gsungs so //
translated: But he did not say, “Make an offering to the Dharma of the scriptures.”

original: ci ste 'o na chos la ni mu tig bre gang do zhes bu mo mu tig gis spyir smras na ji lta ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste 'o na chos la ni mu tig bre gang do zhes bu mo mu tig gis spyir smras na ji lta ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that the daughter of the king of Siṅghala offered a measure of pearls to the Dharma in general, how is that?

original: shed ma bye ba ni brdar btags pa'i chos la 'du shes 'byung ba kho na yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: shed ma bye ba ni brdar btags pa'i chos la 'du shes 'byung ba kho na yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault, because the idea of the Dharma of conventional symbols arises only in the ignorant.

original: gtsug @110b lag khang mang gnas par khas blangs kyang //
analyzed: gtsug @110b lag khang mang gnas par khas blangs kyang //
translated: Even though he has accepted the duty of staying in many monasteries,

original: rnyed pa gcig na len par dbang ba yin //
analyzed: rnyed pa gcig na len par dbang ba yin //
translated: he is entitled to take the property of only one monastery.

original: gal te thams cad du na gtsug lag khang //
analyzed: gal te thams cad du na gtsug lag khang //
translated: If he is entitled to take the property of all,

original: rnyed pa kun las cha gcig tsam zhig blang //
analyzed: rnyed pa kun las cha gcig tsam zhig blang //
translated: he should take only a portion of the property of all the monasteries.

original: gtsug lag khang mang po dag tu dbyar gnas par khas blangs kyang gtsug lag khang gcig kho na nas rnyed pa len par dbang pa yin no //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang mang po dag tu dbyar gnas par khas blangs kyang gtsug lag khang gcig kho na nas rnyed pa len par dbang pa yin no //
translated: Even though he has accepted the duty of staying during the rainy season in many monasteries, he is entitled to take the property of only one monastery.

original: 'on te thams cad nas len par 'dod na de'i tshe gtsug lag khang gi rnyed pa de dag thams cad las cha gcig tsam byung ba de tsam blang bar bya'i lhag par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te thams cad nas len par 'dod na de'i tshe gtsug lag khang gi rnyed pa de dag thams cad las cha gcig tsam byung ba de tsam blang bar bya'i lhag par ni ma yin no //
translated: But if he is entitled to take the property of all, then he should take only a portion of the property of all the monasteries, not more than that.🔽A novice monk is entitled to one third of the share

original: dge slong gcig gi nges par 'dra ba las //🔽dge tshul sum cha gcig cig dbang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dge slong gcig gi nges par 'dra ba las // dge tshul sum cha gcig cig dbang bar 'gyur //
translated: of a fully ordained monk who has no relatives.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod na cha gnyis te //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod na cha gnyis te //
translated: If he wishes to be fully ordained, he is entitled to two thirds of the share.

original: zas la sogs gtogs bgo ba ma gtogs so //
analyzed: zas la sogs gtogs bgo ba ma gtogs so //
translated: This does not apply to the distribution of food and so on.

original: dge tshul la ni dge slong gcig gi skal ba nges pa de dang mnyam pa'i rdzas las sum cha gcig sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: dge tshul la ni dge slong gcig gi skal ba nges pa de dang mnyam pa'i rdzas las sum cha gcig sbyin par bya ste /
translated: For a novice, one third of the share of a fully ordained monk should be given.

original: dper na gal te dge slong gis skal ba pa na gsum zhig yod na de'i tshe dge tshul la ni pa na gcig / bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa la ni pa na gnyis sbyin par bya ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dper na gal te dge slong gis skal ba pa na gsum zhig yod na de'i tshe dge tshul la ni pa na gcig / bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa la ni pa na gnyis sbyin par bya ba lta bu yin no //
translated: For example, if a fully ordained monk has three shares, then one share should be given to the novice and two shares to the one who wishes to be fully ordained.

original: 'dir gzhung ni sil bu las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni sil bu las /
translated: Here, the text is from the Ksudraka Collection:🔽In Śrāvastī, a householder built a temple and when he dedicated it, he invited both the Saṅgha of monks and the Saṅgha of nuns and offered much wealth.

original: mnyan yod na khyim pa zhig gis gtsug lag khang brtsigs nas des de zhal bsro ba na gnyi ga'i dge 'dun mchod ston gsol nas rnyed pa mang po phul ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽dge slong dang dge slong ma la ni skal ba ma nyam par sbyin no //
analyzed: mnyan yod na khyim pa zhig gis gtsug lag khang brtsigs nas des de zhal bsro ba na gnyi ga'i dge 'dun mchod ston gsol nas rnyed pa mang po phul ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / dge slong dang dge slong ma la ni skal ba ma nyam par sbyin no //
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Give the monks and nuns equal shares.

original: dge tshul dang dge tshul ma la ni sum cha'o //
analyzed: dge tshul dang dge tshul ma la ni sum cha'o //
translated: Give one third of the share of the monks and nuns to the novices and female novices.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa dang dge slob ma la ni sum gnyis sbyin par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa dang dge slob ma la ni sum gnyis sbyin par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: If one wishes to be fully ordained or is a female novice, one should give two thirds.

original: mchod ston la dge slong gtsor bya ba yin gyis kyang dge slong ma rnams kyis kyang zhos pa las rnyed pa sbyin sbyin pa'i tshul ni 'di kho na yin no //
analyzed: mchod ston la dge slong gtsor bya ba yin gyis kyang dge slong ma rnams kyis kyang zhos pa las rnyed pa sbyin sbyin pa'i tshul ni 'di kho na yin no //
translated: This is the method of giving the share of the deceased to the Sangha.🔽Some recite this passage:🔽“One should give one third,”🔽“One should give two thirds,”

original: yang kha cig ni sum cha sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di la sum cha zhes bya ba dang / sum gnyis zhes bya ba 'di las yang skal ba mnyam par sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba 'don te /
analyzed: yang kha cig ni sum cha sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di la sum cha zhes bya ba dang / sum gnyis zhes bya ba 'di las yang skal ba mnyam par sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba 'don te /
translated: “One should give an equal share.”

original: gzhung 'di nyid 'dul ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: gzhung 'di nyid 'dul ba'i mdo las /
translated: This very text is cited in the Vinaya Sutra:

original: dge tshul dang dge tshul ma gnyis kyi rnyed pa ni sum cha dang bral ba nyid yin no// mid par bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dge tshul dang dge tshul ma gnyis kyi rnyed pa ni sum cha dang bral ba nyid yin no// mid par bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid yin no //
translated: “The property of both novices and female novices is free from one third. The share of the deceased is equal.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa dang / dge slong ma'i yang nog zhes bsdus so //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa dang / dge slong ma'i yang nog zhes bsdus so //
translated: If one wishes to be fully ordained or is a female novice, one should give two thirds.”

original: mdo'i don ni dgrol na sum cha dang bral ba @111a * //
analyzed: mdo'i don ni dgrol na sum cha dang bral ba @111a * //
translated: If the meaning of the sūtra is to be explained, it is the third part that is not the third part.

original: nyid ni sum cha ma yin pa'i cha nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyid ni sum cha ma yin pa'i cha nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement.

original: mid par bya ba ni 'bras chan la sogs pa'o //🔽mnyam pa nyid ni dge tshul dang dge tshul ma gnyis skal ba mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: mid par bya ba ni 'bras chan la sogs pa'o // mnyam pa nyid ni dge tshul dang dge tshul ma gnyis skal ba mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: Food is rice and so on.🔽Equality is the equality of the portion of a novice monk and a novice nun.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa dang dge slob ma'i yang mnyam pa nyid do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa dang dge slob ma'i yang mnyam pa nyid do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The equality of the portion of one who wishes to be fully ordained and a female trainee should be applied.

original: mid par bya bar ma zad do //
analyzed: mid par bya bar ma zad do //
translated: It is not only food.
